Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Derry055
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night got a great deal with travel republic night before no complaints lovely room with wonderful view big modern room breakfast super a little out of Paris but great transport links would return again

Reviews.Title: “i would most certainly come back!”
Reviews.Author: Erin100
Reviews.Content: disregard any negative reviews you may have read regarding this hotel. as a regular traveller, i place an emphasis on ensuring a quality experience and am happy to pay a little extra. this hotel is located in a nice neighbourhood and two min walk from the nearest metro station. access to all the Paris sights is not a problem as you have the metro on your doorstep! less than a ten minute walk from the hotel and turning left out of main entrance, is a thriving area of restaurants, cafes, shops etc. there is certainly plenty of choice if you decide you don't want to eat in hotel. the hotel itself was very modern with plenty of amenities including its own cafe, restaurant, business centre, gym etc. the rooms were very spacious, clean and comfortable. our room had flat screen tv, fridge, safe etc. the only negative was that there was no free wi fi. i would come back to this hotel when next in Paris and would recommend it for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful refuge”
Reviews.Author: carryon101
Reviews.Content: After a particularly harrowing day - including having to book last minute due to a completely unacceptable attempt to stay at another hotel, it was so wonderful to take refuge in the Paris Marriott Rive Gauche. I was immediately welcomed and felt right at home. My room on the 18th floor had a beautiful view overlooking the city and was extremely spacious. Although I was traveling alone on this trip, I particularly like that the toilet and the main bath were separate - that's always helpful when traveling with the family. As an American traveling in Europe for the last three years I have become accustomed to the differences in most European hotels but it is always nice when a Marriott (or Hilton) is available and the experience is more in line with the service and quality I prefer. It is a nice location - not right in the centre - but there is easy access to public transit and it is only a short ride to the popular attractions. Some of the "small" things I specifically appreciated were the face cloths, quality toiletries, bathrobe/slippers, and of course the bedding/bed. I only stayed one night before continuing my trip (as originally planned) but the service and experience was a good one from start to finish and I will definitely return on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great business stay location and staff”
Reviews.Author: yellowjacket6
Reviews.Content: Only here four days on business, central location to metro and EZ one change ride to Porte de Versaille Convention Center. Local restaurants to hit nearby as were food stores. Ten minutes from RER stop "Denffert" so could take 9.7 Euro ride from airport vs 60 for taxi plus faster. Staff at hotel very French but spoke excellent English and very friendly. Exec lounge a plus if you book that.- small sized for a Marriott but adequate and again very friendly. Desk managers are superb. Some days, tour buses abound but that is part of a big hotel. Just book a high level room and on business travel they are gone by time you return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Comfortable Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sailor42London
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights mid-week on a business trip. The hotel is a little out of the centre from a tourists perspective although very well connected by both RER and Metro, both just a few minutes walk away. The RER station is a simple walk away and is on Line B, which offers a direct connect to Charles de Gaulle Airport. The hotel, is big and busy with a conference centre associated with it. There seems plenty of stay at hand in the lobby area, check in was efficient and quick by very pleasant reception staff. My room was large, clean, had a king sized bed, desk to work at, tea and coffee making facilities and an empty fridge for your own drinks and snacks. My room on the 10th floor was quiet, away from the elevators, had a good view and was all I could expect. There was no WIFI in the room unfortunately, internet was available via a cable which one had to pay. The hotel has a fitness centre and a business centre, neither of which I used. What I think lets the hotel down is the restaurant, breakfast is fine - the usual buffet of hot and cold options, priced between 14 to around 20 euros depending on whether you want the full hot buffet. The restaurant in the evening does not have a great menu, didn't inspire me at all so I just went out to eat. The bar area is fairly small and not inviting. Despite some criticism about the bar and restaurant, I would undoubtedly go back due to the fact that the rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet, hotel staff are very good so I was happy with my stay!

Reviews.Title: “To expensive”
Reviews.Author: Hans S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is way to expensive for the accommodation & comfort. Very small rooms, empty mini bar, no slippers, no bathroom cape in the room. No window opening possible, only Airco. Very chaotic place to stay due to the many tourists visiting Paris. However a good basis to see Paris Rive gauche.

Reviews.Title: “Obviously Cutting Back”
Reviews.Author: Slavomir B
Reviews.Content: I stay here when I have to (work) but not for fun. This time I noticed a lot of cut-backs on service and on things they gave. The hotel has an odd smell and the food is ... well I think you shouldn't try it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: Gwattley
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel very clean and friendly cooperative staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great American Style Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: adamsaintlouis
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a fantastic stay at this Marriott, without any issues to speak of. We did stay on a great rate (from bidding), so it was a good deal to begin with. The hotel itself appears brand new inside, and is of typical Marriott style and quality (for new European Marriott's, which I find much nicer than in the USA). The lobby and all public spaces were in perfect shape. The room was large, with a large bath tub, a large bed, nice views, and overall a great American style hotel. This is in contrast to many Paris hotels, which are old, small, and often come with bad service (though if you want the "Paris" experience, those may be the way to go). Everyone spoke English. Internet was $20 euro per day, typical Marriott (still annoying though). Location: This seems to be a big debate here on Trip Advisor reading other reviews. I actually thought it was a fine location. The Metro stop is 1 block away. Metro line 6 directly takes you to the Eiffel Tower in about 10 minutes. It was also convenient to the RER to Disneyland Paris, and the opposite way to Versailles. It was really an easy 10 min Metro ride to anywhere in central Paris. Overall, I actually think the location might be a plus for this hotel. Overall I would recommend this hotel. I did not pay full price obviously, but it was one of the nicer hotels I have stayed at in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Well-connected and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelieL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located around 5 minutes walk south of Denfert-Rochereau metro/train station, which is where the airport bus from Orly arrives and leaves, making is a great place to stay if you are arriving early/leaving late. It is also within a short walking distance to a station for Paris' almost-free bike system, Velib, which is a fun and easy way to get around Paris. Near the hotel are the Catacombs, and in around 10 mins on a bike you'll be in the heart of Paris at Notre Dame, passing Montparnasse and the Jardin du Luxembourg on the way. It is definitely not in the heart of Paris and I wouldn't stay too much further south. The hotel itself is very comfortable, there is a buffet breakfast which was above-average quality. We stayed on the Executive floor, allowing us access to the Executive Lounge which was located on the conference floor. During the week, there was an exclusive breakfast (although it was not as ample as the main breakfast), snacks during the day and an evening cocktail "hour" which even included a hot meal. The rooms were small but clean, with the toilet and bathroom separated. Things that could be improved are having the Executive Lounge open on weekends (I was a little disappointed to miss out on the benefits because I was there over a weekend) and also the generosity of the hotel (not leaving new toiletries, leaving only one chocolate on the pillow instead of two... little things). The staff were mostly helpful, but I would ask the concierge for a few suggestions, if you must ask at all, to avoid being sent to their "friends" restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service but a little far away from super touristy things, if that's what your into”
Reviews.Author: ntfbball
Reviews.Content: The Marriot is great with very nice people, many who speak english. Fitness center and business center are present. The beds were amazingly comfortable! The rooms are smaller than the average american hotel (because they're in the city) but very well decorated with gorgeous bathrooms. The location is good for restaurants and shopping but a little far from the river but all you have to do is take St. Michael north.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you get a good rate; not best location for first time visitors”
Reviews.Author: inbru
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at a phenomenal rate in January with a deal through priceline. I had a room on the 16th floor with a fantastic view over Paris. The room was very large and the bed was very comfortable. It was a pretty typical Marriott. The internet was not included and very expensive. The hotel is close to a couple metro stops but is a bit off the beaten path. I would not pay the standard rates to stay here especially if I were a first time visitor. I would rather get something a little closer to the attractions even if I had a room that was a little smaller. If I got this hotel again through priceline, I'd be more than happy to go back (or if I had a reason to stay in the area), but it won't be my first choice otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Pone1
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at the Paris Marriott Rive Gauche last week. The hotel was clean and beautiful. Our room on the 16th floor had the most spectacular view. Bed was comfy too. The staff and concierge (Sonjia, Carl-Pierre, Sophie, and everyone with them) were just amazing. They had answers to our questions, they had the flowers I ordered for my sister's room (birthday celebration) ready and waiting in her room, and since we were coming from the US overnight, our rooms were ready for early check in @8:30am. My sister and husband stayed in a family suite which was large, 2 rooms, 2 bathrooms and could have easily slept 4-5 people. They had the concierge package which included a bank of computers, breakfast daily snacks and coffee all day and wine/beer happy hour (until9:30pm) every weeknight included. They were very pleased. The hotel is a little out of the main stream for tourists, but there is a metro stop almost across the street and a hub station in easy walking distance to get you across town and to the CDG airport in 45 minutes. I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking to do Paris, but still want the familiarity and understanding of things US. Thank you to everyone who made out stay in Paris UNFORGETABLE!

Reviews.Title: “Practical stay in an expensive city!”
Reviews.Author: TravlinfoolSeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed 9 nights at the Marriott Rive Gauche Hotel. It was typical for a European Marriott which is to say, a little lower in quality than what we are used to stateside. It is clean and well maintained, but quite unexceptional. We did not have breakfast included in our rate and found many restaurants in the area for meals when we were at the hotel. In fact, I think it is an unremarkable area for this city with many charms if that makes any sense. This is a convenient public transportation center. You can easily use either of 2 Metro stations and Place Denfert Rochereau is the terminus for the airport bus to/from Orly as well as the RER to/from CDG. Our favorite "find" was Rue Daguerre just beyond Denfert Rochereau. A wonderful pedestrian boulevard that is a mecca for local restaurants, bars, street musicians, fishmongers, pastries, butchers, flowers, wine shops, markets, etc., etc. In other words, a real middle class Parisian neighborhood unlike Rue Cler. Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: RafiqueMultan
Reviews.Content: I had a chance to stay at this hotel for five nights. The room was not spacious and facilities were not to the standard which one expects from a hotel of this popular name. The Wi Fi was not free in the room or in the reception lobby for even a limited time. Daily charge for Wi Fi was 20 Euro which was unjustified, while the same facility was free for the customers in nearby McDonald restaurant. The breakfast time started from 630 am,but some food shelves were still empty and many a times there was no cook to fry an egg for you; disappointment for early birds wanted to set off for their work early.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable stay at Marriott Paris”
Reviews.Author: Renata09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Marriot Paris Rive Gauche for 4 nights on a short vacation trip. I booked a executive room , but I didn't think it was a good deal. Executive lounge is well-appointed , but the breakfast and hors d'oeuvres are weak. The rooms are confortable,the concierge and check- in atendants are very helpful .Restaurant for dinner its ok, nothing special, but I liked the buffet breakfast served there. I like Marriot standart for any trips anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Michimi
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel over New Years Eve. Considering Paris prices, I think we would still be giving this place a four star rating up to a cost of about $200/night. We had a corner room on the east side, facing the city on the 8th floor. Unfortunately, the hotel would not confirm a city-facing room prior to check-in but we lucked out. The view was fantastic, except of all things the Montparnasse Tower blocks the view of the Eiffel (at least we think that's what it was). The area was quiet and close to the metro station, although it's a bit out of the way from some of the more desirable neighbourhoods. Best features for us were the chic bar, the great service we received at the front desk and concierge, and the comfortable mattress. Worst features, the fact that as a conference hotel it was fairly busy (although the wait for the elevator was never that long), a little farther away than hoped, expensive bar and room service. Tip: There is a quaint convenience store a block East of the hotel that's open late and sells baguettes, wine and beer.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable USA brand in Paris”
Reviews.Author: tripperhov
Reviews.Content: For some reason Paris seems to be a magnet for poor hotels at extortionate prices. Knowing this, you know what you’re going to get from paying more for the Paris Marriott Rive Gauche. If you can get around the Paris train and metro system, getting to the hotel from Denfert Rocherau station (on metro line 6 if needed) could not be easier. Plenty of shops near to the hotel for provisions, plenty of places to eat at reasonable prices within a 5 minute walk. Apparently there is a good Italian restaurant behind the hotel, through the hospital. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms are a good size for Paris, the design is the usual modern Marriott style, with all the mod cons and convenience you can rely on from the Marriott brand. Internet was costly, usual for Marriott. Breakfast was good, continental buffet style in a huge restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyinggator
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights for a conference in Jan 2012. It was a good conference venue, and had relatively easy access to the Metro. It is a bit far from anything really "interesting," but the conference rate we had made it well worth it. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was very fine, and the beds were unusually comfortable (for hotel standards). The view from our 16th floor room, facing toward the city, was a special treat.

Reviews.Title: “A phoney”
Reviews.Author: AmyOSL
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights. Did not really enjoy the stay since: - internet is not free which we thought was stingy given the star rating and price of the room. Internet costs ~20 euros for 24hrs or ~8 euros/hr. Not even free in reception! - A couple of hours after we checked in we heard the door to our room open and a lady walked in with her luggage, was surprised to see us, and asked: who are you? Turned out that reception had allocated her the same room as ours; we called them and they asked her to come down and we didnt see her again. -Breakfast was pretty basic not much choice - In the elevator you need to stick in your room card before clicking your floor number. Fine. But it doesn't always work so you sometimes end up hotel according to other peoples' wishes! We once saw a man who remained in the elevator while we fetched something from our room and found him still in the elevator trying to get to his floor! - No ventilation in the room. OK the air conditioner works fine but the window is sealed so no chance of getting in some fresh morning air. - Otherwise fine; metro and RER stations nearby (5 min and 8-min walks respectively); nice bedding and pillows so good sleep quality, but overall wouldn't stay there again if had the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Industrial strength”
Reviews.Author: Gkrieger
Reviews.Content: This is a typical large marriott not ideally located for tourism but set up for conventions. Executive club is good and if you cant access it your costs will rise significantly. Rooms ok. Easy to get to from airport on rer b and metro but not an ideal location for sightseeing despite rive gauche name. Internet is lousy ibahn and exoensive unless you ar gold or platinum. Staff was quite good and helpful and very pleasant butnoverall it is a bit sterile and not parisian or boutique at all

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, awesome rooms, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Saffa_Travel_Girl
Reviews.Content: Reception : You are welcomed by very friendly and professional staff who cannot do enough to assist you. Between them and the concierge, I was really impressed. Room : Stunning!! I had a beautiful room that was just SO cosy! I had a great work desk so that I could so some work in the evenings. My bed was so comfortable that I did not want to get out of it! There was a laptop safe and lots of place for my clothes, shoes, etc. My bathroom was spotless with great water pressure. Restaurant : We had fantastic breakfasts! There was an amazing variety with gorgeous pastries. Convention Centre : I was so impressed with the convention centre! I attended a conference of a few thousand people and it all went so well. Even during lunch time when we eat at the hotel the food was divine. I would definitely recommend this hotel again, not just for business but definitely for leisure too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fabulous staff!”
Reviews.Author: corty13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got a great deal to stay here through Priceline. It is not near any major attractions, but that does not matter since you have access to the metro just a short walk away. There are plenty of little bistros nearby as well. We were pleasantly surprised when we were upgraded to a junior suite when we arrived. The staff was over the top helpful! At the front desk, in the executive lounge, the concierge...everyone we met at the hotel was wonderful! Our room was spectacular! We were on the 18th floor and had amazing views of the city. The bed is very comfortable and I just couldn't get over how much room we had in our suite and the TWO bathrooms! We stayed in a tiny room at a hotel right next to the Eiffel Tower last time, but I will choose to go back to this Marriott on our next trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Marriott, but still a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Onesense
Reviews.Content: It all depends from the price you pay: at the official rate is almost a fraud, internet offers can be interesting, if you succeed to buy it through Priceline can become a bargain. Summarizing: position a bit faraway from the centre (though well connected) and lobby requiring a renovation are the negative points; a good overall service, nice rooms and a beautiful view are the positive ones

Reviews.Title: “Great Attention to Details”
Reviews.Author: jdmckay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Paris for a Valentine's Day get-away. We have stayed at the Renaissance, Arc D'Triomphe and the Marriott Champs Elysses as well as other Parisian Hotels. The Rive Gauche, while a bit off the beaten path, served us very well. We arrived at CDG and took the RER train from terminal 2 to Denfert Rochereau. It took about 45 minutes and was a comfortable ride. From there, we walked 8 minutes downhill on Avenue St. Jacques to the hotel (Right side of street). We could have gotten closer with a change at the station to Glaciere, but the hassle of changing trains made our decision to walk a good one. When we checked in the pleasant clerk asked if we needed any local information, and he also called over the supervisor who introduced herself to us. I'm a platinum elite member, and we were given the red carpet treatment. They explained about the executive lounge which served breakfast until 10:30 in the morning, provided soft drinks duringthe day, an afternoon tea with pastries at 3:30, hot snacks at 5:30, along with beer and wine until 9:30 P.M. This was very convenient and the workers in the lounge were most helpful. If staying at the Marriott Rive Gauche, I would suggest the weekly metro pass (discouvert). We used the 1-5 zones pass (38.50 and runs from Monday to Sunday...Don't get this pass if you arrive on a Thursday or Friday!). With this pass we easily could navigate throughout Paris. The room 1818 was very comfortable. I really appreciated the heating/cooling system. It was really responsive. You could set the fan speed, and by cranking up or down on the thermostat, you were given instant relief. Unlike a lot of European hotels where you practically die of heat exposure, we were able to keep the temperature very comfortable at all times. The shower area was adequate, the toilet is located in a VERY small room off to the side. The bed was very comfortable and we got great sleep all four nights. There was never any hall noise! All in all, I'd stay there again, buy the metro pass, and use this as a base to explore Paris. Don't be put out by its distance from the Champs Elysses or Eiffel tower. These sights are a quick metro ride away.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay at the Marriott.”
Reviews.Author: misssyd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got a really great deal with the Marriott Rive Gauche Hotel in Paris over the European Summer break in 2010. (Late Post) A few of our comments below: Staff - Staff were lovely and friendly. Check in and check out went smoothly. Rooms - The rooms were lovely. Very typical 'Marriott' style but super clean, confortable and quite large! Bed: The bed was one of the most comfortable out of our entire European trip! Such an important factor for a goods night's rest when you've been out sightseeing all day. Location: Probably not as central as some of the other hotels in the area. However, there is a metro station nearby which is really convenient and will see you around the city. Food: As expected, food at the actual hotel is more expensive than outside. We liked to eat outside as it was cheaper and had a more 'French' feel. Overall, a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Paris with small issues”
Reviews.Author: MH_Golfer
Reviews.Content: Fair priced hotel in Paris. The rooms are good with good bathrooms and shower. There is an electrical problem that causes the treadmills to lose power about every 30 minutes if all of them are being used. It happened to me twice while I was there. I spoke to the guy on the treadmill next to me and he said it happened to him about 3 months ago. Sounds like a problem they have not fixed yet. A little bit away from the action of Paris but close to train and plenty of taxis. Be sure to ask for Philippe Cherence at the Concierge desk. He is as good as it gets at recommendations and reservations. Really, really excellent Concierge!

Reviews.Title: “Great concierge”
Reviews.Author: lia_indo
Reviews.Content: The room is not very big but enough if you dont have many luggage. Since it's near metro station, it's convenience to go everywhere. I must give credit to the concierge because i keep a package for a friend in paris and my friend only have time to take it after 2 weeks since he just come back from vacation trip and he receive it with perfect condition

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: BanerjeeFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Rive Gauche for 4 days. It is specially good for Marriott Rewards members - we were upgraded to a beautiful suite with 2 bathrooms and a panoramic view of the city. We were pleasantly surprised to find a bottle of champagne waiting in the suite to welcome us. The suite was spacious with 2 King size beds (real US King size!) and a large living area. But since we were 3 people (my son, wife and me), the extra bath really helped getting ready on time!! The location is very convenient, with the Metro station barely 3 mins walk and the Eiffel Tower station only 7 stations away. The neighborhood is very nice to walk as well, with flower shops and vegetable shops offering fresh produce. It is also much less expensive than the other Marriott on Champs-e-elysees - so best of both worlds.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't eat there”
Reviews.Author: Jaconnon
Reviews.Content: The location is close to two metro stations but not close to any major attractions. The concierge was very helpful and friendly. The bed and bedding was comfortable and we slept well. But, the Marriott Rive Gauche restaurant (including room service) serve, hands down, some of the worst food I've ever had in a restaurant. I can't believe they get away with serving that stuff on a daily basis. And I gave it a few tries to be fair. I ordered my steak medium, it was medium well and the side dish was tasteless and mushy. I ordered my cheeseburger medium well and it was barely to the point of medium. The club sandwich was obviously pre -made, packaged and shipped and far from fresh with brown, soggy lettuce and grainy, mushy tomatoes. The worst was the sausage that my boyfriend ordered. I can not believe they served something that smelled like that. It smelled like excrement, as if the casing had not been properly cleaned out. So, he cut into it, but of course didn't eat it and we both lost our appetite. I'd say they'd be a lot better if they would overhaul their kitchen staff, procedures, menu and get a professional cook or chef in there. It's unacceptable as it is.

Reviews.Title: “Good but can be better”
Reviews.Author: Shanu400001
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights based on budget recommendation from a friend. It is a fairly good hotel - though rooms are small, beds are comfortable and amenities are well provided for in the rooms. Service at the check in counter can be faster. The concierge was quite helpful. The older concierge staff was bit impatient but there was a younger gentleman who recommended and helped make some excellent reservations (night cruise on Seine, dinner recommendations, arranging tickets for Moulin Rouge etc). Given the rush at the hotel and number of guests lined up for assistance, the concierge desk can be better staffed. Location: Very convenient for tourists. It is quite easy to get to almost any major tourist site in Paris with very little need to change lines by using either metro or RER. Walk to the train station is less than 5 minutes and we were able to go to the Eiffel Tour (west) and Montmarte (north) quite easily. Even the buses connecting to the Seine, the Louvre and major attractions are only a ten minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not very close but good.”
Reviews.Author: elenxhi
Reviews.Content: I expected the hotel to be closer to Eiffel Tower but the Hotel is a little far from Paris' main downtown landmarks but there are two metro stations within very easy walking distance.Then in walking distance there is an extensive a French market that opens up twice a week just down the street from the Hotel. Also few supermarkets and coffee shops within walking distance to the hotel The market offers fresh flowers, fresh produce, and fresh meats and seafood. The Hotel rooms were spotlessly clean and comfortable.But the lobby staff doesn't volunteer any information about the availability of extra touring options. the concierge was not especially warm or friendly. We did switch rooms because our tub wasn't working properly and they got us moved to a room that someone had already occupied. So frustrated but finally they got us in a decent room. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JH72
Reviews.Content: Easy access to the metro. The staff are fully bi-lingual and could even speak flemish. This is an ideal hotel to visit paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay- nice service!”
Reviews.Author: LyndaParis_France
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a couple January 21-22, 2012. The hotel is very well placed with easy access to metro/RER transportation. We had a great view from our room 1230 of paris from Invalides to Monmatre to Pantheon. Fab! The best thing was the service- these guys were fast and very pleasant. I called sunday at Noon and asked for a late check out- I got it. Look forward to a new stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, interesting location”
Reviews.Author: ktlbt
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a combination business/pleasure trip. It was not the usual type of hotel I would choose in Paris as it is large and not typically "Parisian". However, I was very pleased with the accommodations. The room was very spacious for Paris - there was even room for a comfortable chair. The beds were quite comfortable and the entire room and bath very clean. There was the necessary equipment for making coffee or tea and the refrigerator was empty for the guest's use. That was a decided plus. Since breakfast was included in my conference rate, I took advantage of it everyday. The choices were varied and many. An omelet station was even available. Everyone I came into contact with was very pleasant and accommodating. The people who worked in the business center could not have been nicer. They were the ones you go to for everything from computer use, to printing, to borrowing bottle/wine openers, to electric converters. The office was always open and always pleasant and helpful. If you are looking for a typical Parisian experience, this would not be the place to go. It is much more typically American. That said, it does "American" very well. The location is more of a neighborhood feel than a tourist area. It is close to to metro stations and very close to bus and RER stations. Taking the RER straight in from Charles DeGaulle airport and walking the few blocks to the hotel will save a lot of money. The trip is easy and pleasant. I did it both ways and it took just under an hour. It is within walking distance to rue Daguerre, a partial pedestrian street with lots of markets open to the street as well as some cafes. If you are familiar with Paris, it has a "rue Cler" feel to it. Montparnasse cemetery and Parc Montsouris are within easy walking distance. Just a little farther away is the Pantheon area. It is quite easy to get to almost any major tourist site in Paris with very little need to change lines by using either metro or RER. There is a restaurant and bar in the hotel, but I did not use them. I did see a lot of other business type people in there. The elevator requires the use of your key card to go up. That certainly added to the sense of security. What are the downsides to this hotel? It was very busy - always groups coming and going (although I never had to wait long to have a question answered) It is very American - unless that's what you want. It is expensive - not the amount I would normally pay for a hotel in Paris. The wi-fi was 20 euros a day, which seemed high to me since I wasn't on a business account. You could purchase shorter amounts of time in the business center using their computers. There were several computers, but only one American keyboard - if you don't get that one, it takes longer looking for the keys. It isn't in the heart of Paris. I liked the neighborhood feel, but not everyone would.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Week ending Jan1 2012”
Reviews.Author: jeffrey b
Reviews.Content: Prior to arrival, Philippe, at the concierge desk, made New Year's eve dinner reservations per our request. A great dinner at Chez Gabrielle. Upon check-in, we were given access to the Executive Level daily, which included a full buffet breakfast and snacks and wine in the early evening. What a great way to unwind after strolling the City of Light all day. This was our second stay at the Rive Gauche and would do so again. Conveniently located in the 14th Arr between two metro stops on line 6 -- will take you to Tour Eifel. The staff was very welcoming and did not take you for granted. A fine Marriott property with rooms to match.

Reviews.Title: “Very solid choice, with full services”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: To be frank, this is an American hotel , with all of the full service you might expect: good fitness centre, big executive lounge, internet support, business centre, room service, restaurants, etc. Great for business, but not really a "romantic French boutique" escape. I continue to go back even when I deviate from time to time to more local Parisian options. Hard to beat the Marriott for your functional comfort.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steliosoctavios
Reviews.Content: 2nd time in Paris, in the first time we stayed at the Novotel Vaugirard, but as I´m a travel agent wanted a new hotel to stay and look out. We arrived at the hotel by taxi from gare du nord, its localized in montparnasse in front a metro line. Quick and lovely check-in and up to our room. They gave us a room in the 5th floor in front of the lifts and whas a special room for who got a wheel chair. This gave a bit extra space in the room and large bathroom. Very good room with lcd tv (though the image of many channels whas not good) and a view to the city. The breakfast whas good but as we got 30min until it ended everyday, the where not too many things to choose(no replacement) and not even coffee on the machine, we needed to call the waiter to bring us some. The hotel has access to 2 metro station of the same line, so you can go everywhere in Paris from there, this line is the same that goes near Eiffel tower not having to change to another to reach it. We did our reveillon in the hotels bar as other 20+- guests and also haded in the restaurant if you want a party with diner and champagne that costed 90euros per person.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Marriot, nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: VA-TravelGirl99
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very easy to find and convenient to metro (the Glaciere metro is about a block away), but it wasn't really a central location. I only stayed here because the rate was VERY good and I was using some Marriott Points for one of the nights. I had a room with a King bed and it was a little musty. The bathroom was split - toilet in one teeny little "room," and sink/shower in a more typical bathroom. Bathroom amenities were standard - shampoo, body wash, lotion, soap. I had access to the Concierge Lounge which offers breakfast in the morning, snacks throughout the day, and wine / hor d'oeuvres / dessert at night. The food in the lounge was OK, but honestly, it's Paris, there are so many fantastic places to eat. I'd stop in for a glass of wine in the afternoon, but not really anything else so I can't really comment on whether or not it was good. The one very nice thing about the hotel was the staff. They could not have been more friendly. I had no trouble checking in very early in the morning (after flying in from the States). They were very responsive to my questions and always willing to help. Overall, it's not a bad hotel, it just really didn't have the Paris ambiance I was hoping for. The neighborhood was a bit more residential. I don't think I'd stay here again on a future trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: ALG_RC
Reviews.Content: A dear old friend and I met up in Paris to shop, dine, and just enjoy all the splendors of the city. The hotel, unfortunately, started us off on the wrong foot. When we checked in, the manager whispered to the clerk that we should be put in a lower-floored room, I'm guessing because we'd secured our reservation through a budget auction site. (The women did not know that I spoke French and could therefore understand every word they were saying.) The viewless room was otherwise lovely, though, having all the qualities you'd expect from a Marriott. When we stood in line to ask the concierge for restaurant recommendations, the man behind us advised us not to! He said that the concierge steered him toward a terrible place the evening before. Still, we persevered in the line - but when we began our chat with the concierge, I was immediately put off by his arrogance. In the end, we branched out on our own. And by branching out, I mean a good 20-minute walk to the city center. My friend and I are both avid walkers, but this distance deflated much of our enthusiasm by the time we found lively venues for eating. We took the metro during the day, but the cramped quarters and peculiar smells weren't the most savory alternative to walking. In hindsight, we should have splurged and stayed in a more central location.

Reviews.Title: “Very large Hotel ... a little remote from attractions”
Reviews.Author: Ian994
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in Paris Marriott Rive Gauche Hotel as part of a tour group. The rooms were a little small which is common for European hotels though very comfortable. Took an hour to have bags brought to our room after checkin. As part of a coach tour we had a buffet dinner in the hotel one evening and both breakfasts. The buffet was average and the breakfasts were very disappointing. The eggs were powdered rather than "real" and had no taste. The buffet range was fairly limited for an international hotel. Breakfast for tour groups was in a separate room ("barn") so I assume the standard in their regular restaurant would have been much better. Last time we were in Paris we stayed in a hotel near the Champs Elysees which was certainly more convenient to all attractions though with a metro stop fairly close to the Hotel it just meant a little more time travelling to get anywhere. Despite its positives I wouldn't choose again ... just too large for any personal feel.

Reviews.Title: “not a great location if you want to experiance Paris”
Reviews.Author: mohnaz
Reviews.Content: the rating is 4 star , I suppose because of the amenities most of us dont use ( conferance hall , business centre , etc ..) the hotel caters to business people mainly . 200 meter from a metro stop but takes more tha 30 minutes to get to the other side of the River and most of what city has to offer . you cant walk out of your hotel and go to a little cafe and have a nice coffee and croissant in the morning , well you can but you either have to walk for 20 minutes or take metro ! the standard room and the bathroom was small ,even by french standards, the room had no charm nor did the lobby or common areas of the hotel . More of holiday inn atmosphere than Marriott, a 3 star hotel at best . The internet charge was exuberant !( have never paid more for internet connectionin my life !)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IOW77
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights in between Christmas and New Year 2011. It is not the most picturesque part of Paris, but it is very close to metro lines and, if you fancy a walk, in walking distance of all attractions. We walked from the hotel to Notre Damm and then onto the Champs Elysees, and its a really lovely walk with lovely buildings and shops. The front desk staff were helpful and friendly as were the concierge staff. The bar was lovely but very expensive!! The food in the restaurant was exceptional but again very expensive! The room was lovely but a little smaller than previous Marriott hotel rooms I have stayed in. It was however very clean and the bed was incredibly comfortable! The bathroom was quite small also but clean and had everything you needed. Breakfast was good although the staff weren't as attentive as we would have liked, i.e. having to really try and get someone's attention to get some coffee delivered to the table. The selection of breakfast and the food itself however was superb. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Big Hotel, big comfort”
Reviews.Author: TraveLynnWis
Reviews.Content: My stay at theMarriott Rive Gauche was a surprise: comfort and quiet in big hotel which caters to conferences and tours. However, as a solo traveler I found the hotel to be easy to navigate and relaxing at the end of a long day touring. The room had a great shower, luxury amenties, & of course that Marriott bed to recharge. I had a view of a huge church and the train lines; but it was rather quiet. Don't let the busy lobby overwhelm you; it quiets down after the usual morning rush. Several blocks away you can catch the Loop bus which will get you to many for a popular tour sites. Make sure to get to the Marais for a Falafel, there are several good spots for them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: niallmc82
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights here in December 2011. Location: This was very good but it was not in the most picturesque part of Paris. For us this was fine as it is located very close to two metro lines 4 (RER connections) and 6, Glaciere is the closet Metro stop about a block away. Service: Very good, when we first checked in we noticed that there was a smell in the room, we asked to be changed and within minutes we were in a new room (no smell). One thing to note is that the Business Center charges for Internet which i thought was unusual. You are able to do a few things for free including checking in for your flight. We only used the concierge once and they were helpful. Rooms: The rooms were good. They were clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. Overall this is a very good hotel. What it lacks in charm it makes up for in good rooms and good service.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Conference Venue & Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ajay A
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my coleagues for our annual conference in Decemberb 2011. The Conference facilities are Excellant. The Staff, particularly the Front-Desk/Reception is very receptive and Guest Friendly. Only minus point I found was the Room Size. They were too small for 2 guests to stay in. There is practically no space for 2 gueats to keep their luggage in there. Overall services, Food & Conceirge were satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lrmjun
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 18th floor. Great views of the city and very convenient to two metro stops (st jacques and glaciere).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great amenities!”
Reviews.Author: tamago r
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights. Great price, excellent service and amenities. I always trust Mariott but this is one of the best I've stayed so far. Good location, renovated, clean, good restaurants and excellent gym that opens 24 hrs a day! Staff are very friendly and helpful... and efficient. We upgraded our rooms to executives package that comes with b'fast and lounge access. It also has parking (25 euro ) if you have a car. I also had something expensive needed to be delivered to the hotel but they took care of it well.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Modern Convenience in Paris' Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: RichTBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: We picked the Marriott Rive Gauche initialy becuase it allowed us to maximize the value of some hotel reward points - but after staying there, we would pick this place again regardless of the reward points. The Rive Gauche isn't a typical tourist hotel - however, it was Christmas and was full of tourists, many Americans to our surprise - but it has modern amenities and is situated at a convenient Metro stop. It was only three stops to get to Monparnasse, eight to the Eiffel Tower, six or seven to get to the Louvre. Other hotels place you at one of these sites and you're doing multiple trains or switches to get anywhere. I've been to Paris many times (my favorite areas are St. Germain de Pres and the Sourbonne) and the left bank is, like NYC's Upper West Side, more of a place you'd find the real Paris versus a tourist spot.

Reviews.Title: “Paris for Christmas”
Reviews.Author: AnhandEm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the 23rd to the 26th of December. The hotel staff was excellent from the start and very helpful throughout our stay. I booked this hotel through Priceline so the value was better than it could have been. My true complaint is the high cost of the extra items at the hotel. I expect the food to be more on the expensive side (especially during the holidays) but 20 euro for 24 hours of internet service is really price gouging. Other than that, the value was good. The beds were very nice and we slept comfortably and were not disturbed by outside noise. The room was very clean and organized although small, but this is Paris. Unless you pay a lot more, don't expect the rooms to be very big. I think most of us are spoiled by larger room when staying in U.S. hotels. Just enjoy the stay. Earlier posts did have that the hotel might be showing some age and this is true. Although well maintained, there were some chipped paint on the walls in the bathroom. But do not let this small thing keep you from staying at the hotel. It is still very nice and well maintained. As far as the view, we had a city view over Paris. It wasn't spectacular but it was still a good view. I didn't come to Paris just to look out at it from my hotel window though so for those visiting, I wouldn't concern myself with this too much. The location is not right next door to most of the main attractions but there are are subway stations on each side of the hotel within about 2-3 minutes walking distance so you can get anywhere in Paris with ease. Directly outside of the hotel there are a couple very good Italian restaurants we dined at so there is other food available if you don't feel like going to the hotel bar or traveling too far. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to other travelers unless you must have the internet. Then your price could increase dramatically but just buy a package that includes the internet in your fee and this might reduce the costs a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: hbavguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week while recently attending a conference, which was held in the hotel conference center. Very nice, upscale hotel, with all the ameneties that U.S. folks are used to. Rooms and beds were great, as was the very nice bathroom. The location is a ways away from the center of town, but there are several metro stations within a couple blocks that will get you anywhere quickly. The staff, especially the folks at the concierge desk, were all very friendly and extrememly helpful and most spoke very good English. Only down side is that I probably couldn't afford to stay here on my own (the conference rates were a deal).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie U
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within walking distance to the metro & RER station, and it was really easy to get into the city. We were on the 7th floor and had a nice view of the city. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The room also had a safe. One of my complaints was the piping above or around our room - every time anyone on the floor above us flushed their toilet it would make a really loud squeaking sound as the water rushed above our ceiling and walls. But we were out sightseeing most of the day so it wasn't that big of an issue. The water also fluctuated from warm to scalding hot a few times in the shower. It also would've been nice if wi-fi was free, but it was quite expensive for us to access it from the room. Overall - great value for your money. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We liked that it was away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: utahfamilytravellers
Reviews.Content: I always put a big emphasis on location for hotels. A Parisian told us of all the Marriotts scattered across Paris, book the Rive Gauche if we want to book one that has more of a neighborhood feel to it. It was a decent walk from the hotel to the Seine (we enjoy walking) but the location did make you feel more like you were seeing Paris through the eyes of a local. We spent 8 days at the hotel and really settled in and started to feel at home. So for us, we quite liked the location although I'm sure if you were spending a couple nights in Paris with your significant other you would prefer the Vendome. The rooms were average. The staff was friendly. We did find a few side streets with good restaurants and grocery stores and bakeries. It was nice to not be around the masses. I have written more details about the hotel and features on our blog at www.worldfamilytravellers.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: peachfr0nt
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in budget properties but I got a deal I couldn't pass up, and I really enjoyed my large, beautiful, well-appointed room, complete with bathrobe, coffee-maker, in room safe, and fridge, and a spacious view overlooking the city. Wonderful location near 3 Metro stops, of which I would consider Glaciere to be the closest. If you're a business traveler or just there for the weekend, they have put forward several "Paris in a few hours" tours you can do starting from their hotel even if you have little time. A good one is to catch the Metro to the Trocadero, see the Eiffel Tower, walk down and take a tour of the river -- breath-taking by night! You do have to do some walking, but most people who love Paris love to walk, right? I read before I visited that most people consider this property a four star, not a five, but when I consider the price I paid relative to what I received, I'm 100% completely delighted and I consider this one an A-plus, highly recommended. Also, I LOVE it that they have got rid of those ticky tacky mini-bars and replaced it with a fridge for my own stuff. Will stay here again if at all possible...

Reviews.Title: “Geat comfor and staff and if you are walkers or will take metro, location is fine.”
Reviews.Author: rb818
Reviews.Content: With this hotel the staff's enthusiasm, professionalism and training makes all the positive difference. I don't know if I have ever stayed in a hotel where everone--from the chambermaids, to concierge, to reception, to those selling coffee greeted you with a big smile and couldn't do more to help. Not just with what you ask. They try and exceed what is needed across the board. It is a.comfortable Marriott in style. Without French charm. But that is not an alltogether bad thing when it comes to room comfort at a comparatively modest price. Perfect beds. Sound proof rooms. You do not always get that in europe in much more expensive hotels. We took the metro and we walk a ton so the location was not bad for us. Know however that the hotel is not in the middle of much action. It seems to be a safe area, a block or two from the metro. A few nearby restaurants, a ten or fifteen minute walk to more activity and probably within a half hour walk to the action of monpanarsse, or st germain des pres. In terms of value, we got it for 96 thru priceline. A real bargain. Knowing what I do now, I'd pay retail in order to stay there, just because I can feel pretty guaranteed that I will have a more comfortable stay at still a lower cost compared to other hotels. The metro is clean and inexpensive (1.7 euro) so if you are planning to be out all day anyway, this hotels location given the comfort and value is fine. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Curate's egg”
Reviews.Author: Tadgh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there recently for three nights as part of a large group. We arrived in the afternoon and firstly had a very pleasant lunch in the restaurant. The a la carte lunch menu was quite good and the food was quite enjoyable with good sized portions. The bedroom, as a few others have commented, isn't huge but neither is it small, I suppose you could say it is adequate, but then you might ask adequate for what, well, I suppose adequate for most purposes. The bed was probably the most comfortable I have ever slept in, also it was massive, if you are planning any engagements therein I would advise you to make an appointment to meet as it mightn't happen otherwise. The bedroom window is small, you cannot open it and so have to rely on air-conditioning, quite a headache in more ways than one. The hotel is quite expensive but I suppose most are in Paris, though as part of a group we didn't have any choice in where we stayed. When you do book don't forget to ask them to run your bath - it should be ready by the time you arrive, we found out that there is very little power is left in the hot water pressure by the time it reached the 14th floor. We found the staff quite friendly. In particular, I came across Phillippe, referred to below in not very complimentary terms, on two occasions and found him most gracious and helpful. The reception staff were also quite helpful though we did come across a waiter in the 3rd floor restaurant who did not appreciate people arriving for breakfast at 9.55 am despite being explicitly told on two separate visits to reception that it was served until 11am. Served is probably a euphemism as the hot food appears to be left out in huge quantities at first light and then left to simmer until so much so that the term lukewarm is being too generous to it. In addition, the choice is quite basic whether it is cold meats (4) cereals (3) or fruit (2). The hotel appears to be located in a very safe area, we walked 20 mins to Place d'Italie and in the opposite direction a similar walk to the Pantheon with a further 10 to Notre Dame. The metro runs past the door of the hotel with two stations nearby. Overall, I would stay there again but am unhappy about the breakfast restaurant and the obligatory air-conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Marriott with easy metro and RER access”
Reviews.Author: Czar
Reviews.Content: First, this is a beautiful example of a Marriott. When you arrive, it has a well-done facade and there are doormen and porters waiting to great you. Everyone I encountered here was professional, friendly, and looking to serve. This is not a typical French hotel in terms of style, decor, etc. I read several critical reviews because of its lack of charm. If you prefer a Parisienne experience, please do not pick an American hotel chain to stay in while visiting Paris. This is a high-end Marriott with a slight French charm. I normally wouldn't choose American hotel chain in Paris but I booked the room here for $112 per night through Priceline, which I think is a steal. The location is great for transpiration access but it's not in a great area for access to local sights. The metro stop is very close as is the RER. I you're not familiar with RATP, the RER is the regional train line that runs through Paris. There are several, and one stops very near the hotel - you can either walk or take the metro two stops. It's the same RER that Charles de Gaulle is on, so you can be to the airport in an hour from here. You're also a short trip for Notre Dame and Ile de Cite. The downside is that there's not much going on in the immediate area especially at night. Overall, I would definitely stay here again. I would not recommend this hotel for a first time Paris visitor unless you're here on business - just because I think here is too much to figure out in terms of sightseeing, etc. Otherwise, I think it's a great hotel, and probably one of the nicer Marriotts I've stayed in, and I would do so again at the right price point.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, standard marriot”
Reviews.Author: delineation
Reviews.Content: Service is professional, and the concierges knowledgeable. I didn’t have the breakfast here as I found the price to be hefty, especially with supermarket and nice eating establishments in the area. This is very much a business hotel, not much for character, impersonal and busy, but large, modern, and clean with good sized rooms and all the amenities you need on hand. I had a room with a King Sized bed, which was extremely comfortable!!! Wifi is an extra 20Euro a day. This hotel also has a fantastic gym. This hotel is a block away from Glaciere Station on line 6 on the Metro, which makes the location very accessible to anywhere in the city. An easy 1 hour metro ride from CDG airport.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to metro station, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: RarRarRar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel whilst travelling with insight vacations. The hotel is easily accessible to metro station within 5 mins walk. The hotel restaurant provided morning buffet breakfast. The food was great and provided a wide range of food to choose. The rooms are comfortable and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great but be prepared to pay for TV, Internet”
Reviews.Author: Sarah L
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel geared toward a business clientele (judging by the look of it). It is not in the center, but it is a short subway away from most tourist sites. The area is safe and the rooms we got had a nice view of the city (12th floor). We only paid $150 per night for two people and the rooms were spacious, clean and the beds were very comfortable. The main problem we had with the hotel was that Internet was not included (you had to pay 10 Euros for five hours or 20 Euros for 24 hours) and neither were many of the channels on TV. For free we could only watch news channels. Breakfast was also not included. Aside from this, we were quite happy with this hotel and would recommend it to people who are able to take the subway. Taxis sometimes take a while to appear.

Reviews.Title: “All you expect from a main Marriott - never surprised, never disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Gobbledyspook
Reviews.Content: Good standard Marriott, nothing special but you always know what you're getting with Marriott. This place is huge, and was very crowded with tourists when I stayed. Waiting for the lifts down to breakfast takes forever, but that's the same in any busy hotel. Room was nice, spotless and as usual a very good bed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but little charm”
Reviews.Author: Statement-dk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Nice and clean hotel, but boring. Location close to metro but few shops, restaurants and cafés in the neighborhood. Luckily we seached tripadvisor for restaurants in the neighborhood and found Auberge Etchegorry, a cosy basque restaurant nearby. If you stay at Marriot don't miss that restaurant. We didn't pay for the room ourselfs as it was part of a conference, but we would NEVER pick this hotel (for a weekend getaway) or pay the listed price if we had the choise.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel & nice conferencing facilities”
Reviews.Author: grk75
Reviews.Content: Has got good conferencing facilities, many rooms to accomodate huge groups. Rooms are nice, has a wide spread of breakfast & has multiple restaurants. Has a fitness centre & Executive lounge aswell. The staff is very helpful & co-operative. Has departmental store at 10 mins walking distance. Metro station is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Average Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jh_traveler004
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on points for my birthday and it was an average stay. We chose this hotel as it had a lounge and I'm a Marriott Platinum member. Upon arrival, the hotel really didn't bother that it was my birthday (they saw from my passport) which is fine but you always here of other hotels going above and beyond and creating something special. When my boyfriend asked them for a candle, they said oh, is there a birthday, he said yes and that's all they said! The reviews are basically spot on about it being such a huge hotel for businesses, conferences, you had to wait in line at times 15-20 minutes for service. Phillipe at the conceirge desk was a jerk, don't utilize him. Actually, most of the staff barely care to recognize you as a patron. I will NOT go to this hotel again just b/c of the cold treatment and the long lines and elevator wait (btw, there are 6 elevators)! The location is far from city center but the train station is right there and if you make a right and walk about 1 mile, you will see a big mall and lots of eatery.

Reviews.Title: “Seen better places than this!”
Reviews.Author: ashokbhanage
Reviews.Content: Front desk and service is very indifferent.Had a tough time convincing that a couple requires a double bed and not two single beds! The room was very small.you won't believe it- the loo is in a small closet like room,seperate from the bathroom! There is no coffee maker in the room. The hotel,however, is very conveniently located and easy to gind.Metro is within a walking distance. Overall,a very poor experience.

Reviews.Title: “Showing her age!”
Reviews.Author: MPR14
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really showing it's age. Carpets, curtains, general decor, etc in very poor condition. I requested king bed, but got 2 singles in a shoe box of a room (459).

Reviews.Title: “A great convention hotel - two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: Karson0303
Reviews.Content: I recently attended an international sales conference at this property and I must say it was one of the best! The staff including the front desk, concierge, and restaurant staff were all wonderful. I must especially give praise to the wonderful conference staff (red jackets) and the A/V team who made the entire meeting effortless. The rooms are quite nice and large for a European standard. It has all the comforts of a western Marriott hotel. I must say my only complain was the high cost for the wireless internet access at twenty euro per day. The restaurant was great and the cafe had wonderful pastries, sandwiches and drinks. I loved the lobby with all the comfortable seating choices and nooks in which to have an informal meeting or a drink. The location of this hotel is great, just off the metro. I suggest you take the 10 Metro tickets for 12.50 Euro and use them throughout your stay to avoid buying a ticket every time you go out. The hotel is just about 8 metro stops and a three-minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. If you are looking to spend a nice holiday in Paris with someone special or book a hotel for a company meeting - look no more! I cannot wait to return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Member / ‘Baby in tow’”
Reviews.Author: J&MDAV
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our anniversary weekend at the end of October in Paris, this time with 7 ½ month baby in tow, and found this hotel accommodating to our needs and even the French staff very friendly. Rooms to usual Marriott standard (comfy bed, clean bathroom), recommend high floor, north facing for Paris view. Executive lounge very stylish, though did not make use of much during the weekend. Room wifi was €20 for 24hr (did not use...found wifi elsewhere...). Requested crib/cot for baby in advance, Manager apologized as was not ready, but quickly rectified (Pack ‘n Play in great condition). Concierge staff very knowledgeable about the City (to be expected…), but also restaurants in the area, weekend activities in the area (e.g., restaurants and market in Rue Daguerre), as well as local buses. Restaurant staff during breakfast [buffet style with wide selection of hot/cold food] very receptive to catering to our needs with the baby, such as bringing over a high chair and asking to warm up her formula. We ate one evening in the hotel restaurant and thought it was pretty good. Other reviews point out Metro / RER stations near by [which sold carnet of 10 single trip bus/metro tickets from (somewhat confusing) machines which seemed better value than the unlimited day pass]. We found it easiest to travel by bus with the baby, and very easy to get to Paris attractions (or at least, the bus is a good alternative option). Note that you may not need to fold up a stroller as some have shared online, as the driver will open the doors in the back for the stroller (will depend on how busy the bus is....). Time your travels accordingly. Very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Americana”
Reviews.Author: Mwar1004
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after traveling France on a budget. For three weeks I stayed at budget hotels which were quirky. This was a great escape. It is just like most Marriott hotels with the comfy beds and linens. No views and the subway was a couple blocks away. I enjoyed this hotel and was sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not great”
Reviews.Author: Amaral1982
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Great, lovely personnel at the reception/check-in-area - Rooms are reasonably sized and really comfortable (especially for Paris!) - Bathtub, seperate toilet - GREAT breakfast buffett (fresh fruit, juices with pulp, freshly made omeletts, pancakes etc.) Cons: - Rude breakfast staff (they started clearing the buffett at 10.45am though people still came down from their rooms to have breakfast and breakfast should be available until 11am) - and that for the steep price of 25 Euros per person... - 20 Euros per day for internet is intolerable, there´s a lovely Brasserie just by the hotel that serves great food AND free wifi! - the toilet seat was chipped and looked a bit dirty - windows can´t be opened, air conditioning only The hotel was okay for the price we payed (thanks to a voucher from ebay). I would never pay 180 Euros a night for such a room.

Reviews.Title: “Bussiness hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dafyda
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is not very central but you can easily reach all Paris attractions by metro. The room I stayed in was big enough, with very comfortable bed and pillows, tea and coffee facilities, the bathroom was also big and with all you need. What I definitely did not like was the fact that you should spend about 20 Euros per day for internet connection in a 4 stars hotel. I had free internet connection and free access to printer at 3 stars hotel, so this was very unpleasant at Marriott Rive Gauche Hotel. Taking into account their fares, this is the least they can do for their guests. Breakfast is OK.

Reviews.Title: “Too far but enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: sandocious
Reviews.Content: My first choice is always Marriott even tho this one was a little out the way. Shops, underground and catacombes is about a 15 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get basics right”
Reviews.Author: buctootim
Reviews.Content: This is a nice enough hotel in a decent location and staff are pleasant. However pretty much constant availability for $100pn through priceline, I doubt I would make it three times and stay here again. Too much of the basic stuff just doesnt work as it should. Examples: I only watched movies twice (different rooms different stays - 15 euros each), the first time there was no sound, the second time it stopped after a couple of minutes - both times had to wait for an engineer to come to the room. Parking. There are two barriers to the car park operated by the concierge via a camera. On three occasions out of four despite telling him that I was about to leave or enter the car park I ended up stuck at the barrier eventually requiring me to leave car and two young children at the barrier whilst I walk back to the hotel to get him to open. Once he managed to trap me between the two barriers underground. On one occasion the lift from carpark didnt work and we had to bust open the fire escape latch. Breakfast for under 12s is free - 24euro for breakfast buffet for adult . This didnt stop head waiter in breakfast room trying to charge me a 'special generous reduced rate ' for my clearly (8 and 6) under 12 children. Too many low grade hassles to make it a reliable relaxing place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarloKunz
Reviews.Content: Had a special rate for August 2011 breakfast included , loved the location ; near to metro station , very friendly staff ; great room/breakfast !

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sep65
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in Monparnace. Nice big and clean rooms.Beautiful view from the rooms on boulevard side of the hotel. Close to metro station. Several good restaurants not far from the hotel. Expensive! Breakfast is not included in room rate. Food and vine in hotel bar/restaurant are aalso very good. Overall - good imresions

Reviews.Title: “Astonishing Trip to Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Barghouti
Reviews.Content: Went to paris for four days on 24 october 2011 with Qatar Airways the world's Best Airline in the world for the year of 2011, In the most generous Business Class, The Paris Marriott Rive Gauche Hotel & Conference Center is about two hours away from Charles de Gaulle (CDG) Airport, It was 17°C degree, The Lobby was modern, Shining & a kind gentle Concierge. Quick check in, then move to a Clean room, fresh air and a Wonderful view from the 18th floor, very comfortable marriott king size bed, the welcome fresh french Macaron Sweets & the fresh fruits with dip are waiting for you plus a complimentary evian water. WiFi & the speed internet complementary cost €20 I think daily, Business Center is also available. But If you get the access to the executive lounge in the 3rd floor you will get a free internet access but not a high speed internet Connection, Great fresh tasty breakfast at the executive lounge with a limited items. 6-7 fast left to left you from your room to the lobby and an Ice maker in each floor. The Hotel is about 10 Minutes far from the Eiffel Tower, Champs-Élysées and The louver Museum and cost €15, The night in this hotel is around €150, and 6 minutes walking to the Metro station, which it's cost €1.70 The hotel has a Building Systems Vibration. Have a nice trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but excellent”
Reviews.Author: markoer
Reviews.Content: I have been an a business trip and at conference rate, but a colleague of mine coming one day in advance had to pay 200 € cash for one Sunday night without breakfast! this is clearly an excessive price even for Paris. Nevertheless, the hotel is excellent, and I appreciate the fact that Marriott scores on some points that you would think kind of very elementary, but still many other - even better rated - hotels can't yet get, like: - have a switch that turn off the lights near the bed - have a charger on the small desk near the bed - who doesn't use their cellphones as alarm clock and needs to charge it during the night? Other plus points: - Gym open 24h - Ice-maker machines on every floor Some points that made this hotel not get my 5 points are: - 10 €/hour for WiFi access? are you still living in the middle age of Internet connectivity? it doesn't even happen any more in African countries (no offence intended as I found excellent infrastructure sometimes in Africa). I would expect WiFi for free or nearly for free as we are approaching 2012. - several of the cardio machines in the gym were just broken - not working. In general gym is not monitored Breakfast is really nice and the personnel can (almost) all speak English which is a real plus in Paris IMHO... Location is extremely nice and easy to reach - walking distance from a metro station and you can jog to the Jardin de Luxembourg which is cool for me. Strange the idea to have the toilet separated from the rest of the bathroom/bathtube. You end up relieving yourself physiologically in a small claustrophobic room, but I guess it is useful if you are sharing the room and your partner can still use the bathtube in the while.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Dogswood
Reviews.Content: We planned a 4 day stopover of Paris on our return from Istanbul in late September. We had not been in Paris for more than 10 years and were shocked at the prices for even very simple hotels. Since we had already booked our plane tickets, there was no way to back out. Since we have been very successful in finding reasonable good quality hotels using Priceline in Canada, US and London, we thought we would try it out in Paris. We got the Marriott and were not happy when we found that it was so poorly rated for a 4 star hotel. However, we were in for a very pleasant surprise. While it is not situated in central Paris, it is a quick and cheap RER train ride from the airport. Our check-in was quick and pleasant and while our room faced the street, it is so soundproofed that we could not hear the Metro which is above ground across from the hotel. While our room was compact, it had been recently renovated (flat screen TV, very comfortable bed, loads of pillows, floor to ceiling window, clean and modern bathroom, coffee making facilities). It is a very large convention hotel but we heard no noise from the corridors. We are walkers so we found everything within walking distance of the hotel but if you're not, there is a Metro station one block away and an RER station 3 blocks away. Lots of restaurants within 5-15 minutes away. Like most large chains, it is annoying that you have to get a second mortgage to get wi-fi, but walk a few blocks and the McDonald's offers free wi-fi and the McCafe within, great espresso drinks and breakfast pastries at a fraction of the hotel price. In addition, the local bakeries and Monoprix offer perfect ingredients - baguettes, cheese, fresh fruit for a picnic lunch in Luxembourg Gardens We were in Paris during a September heat -wave (mid to high 80's). Our friends stayed at a charming small typical Parisian hotel. While the Marriott lacks such charm, it did have wonderful a/c. Our friends were offered an electric fan. All in all a quiet, pleasant stay in a large North American style hotel albeit at a North American reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Excellent anniversary stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelCuties
Reviews.Content: DH and I returned to the Marriott to celebrate our anniversary. What an excellent stay! Still has the incredibly comfortable Marriott bedding, super quiet and dark room (get one on the back if you want quiet and remember to pull the metal shade on the window, not just the yellow cloth one), and convenient location. Unfortunately, there were some issues with maintenance and housekeeping - the staff had to come up three times to deal with HVAC, the seal on the shower door leaked, the bathroom was less than spotless, and we got messages on the TV that the At Your Service number had trouble figuring out. Hopefully the hotel addresses these issues and gets back to top form! Everything you want from RER/metro to happy hour to the post office is at Denfert a few blocks away or keep walking north until you get to the lovely Luxembourg Gardens. If you're booking online, be sure to check back for better rates before you leave? I booked months ago at one rate and found a rate that was nearly 70 Euro less for certain nights of our stay the day before we flew to Paris. What a huge difference! Have a great time in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for my business trips”
Reviews.Author: Ronit M
Reviews.Content: It’s a very good hotel for my business trips; the rooms are big, comfortable, and very clean. The nice thing is that all the rooms are facing the east so in the morning (if you get up early like me) you can catch the sunrise over Paris- a spectacular view!!!! The breakfast is very good but the price is outrageous (~25 euros per person), but again, it’s for my business. Also the price for the internet access is expensive…. The staff is very helpful as expected from a hotel in that level. I’ll recommend it for my colleagues and friends for business trips paid by the company, for private vacation you can find good hotel on a better budget

Reviews.Title: “Liked the location, staff were excellent, room was just okay”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaRes
Reviews.Content: The main thing going for this Marriott property is its location. Many interesting parts of Paris are walkable from the hotel, and there is a metro stop very nearby. The cheapest way to get to this hotel from CDG is to take the RER/Metro, and the hotel's website provides excellent guidance on how to do so. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. I do not expect large, or nicely appointed rooms in Paris, and this property lived down to European standards. Bottomline: this is a fine hotel for a quick business trip, or a stopover in Paris. I'd try to find something a bit nicer if going for a high end holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel !! Close to Metro Station St. Jacques.”
Reviews.Author: Mike C
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days at this hotel! Very nice rooms, and large for an european standard. The Breakfast was amazing with full european buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a huge conference”
Reviews.Author: peterlybeer
Reviews.Content: This hotel hosted a world wide event / conference and excelled in doing so. The staff and facilities were absolutely perfect, and the rooms offered were correct and decent. I would recommend this hotel if you're there on business and ofr business purposes. For romance, I would go elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “A real 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharkism
Reviews.Content: It couldn't be better. In Paris you are prepared for the worst. Usually when a hotel claims 4* it "feels like" 3*. Marriot justified the name that carries.

Reviews.Title: “Depends what you're looking for...”
Reviews.Author: gingerluci
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on what I thought was a great rate (around £150 per night through Viva Stay) - for Paris. One thing I learnt coming to Paris is that it is ridiculously expensive - get ready to spend 5Euros on a diet coke!! Therefore proportionately I guess this hotel was good value. The room was a good size, nice sized bathroom with good shower, fridge in the room (good for buying bottles of coke rather than buying them out!!). The bed was very comfortable. We were quite disappointed by the service – long wait to check in/check out – We waited 10 minutes when we got there to check in which as I’m sure you can appreciate is frustrating when you’ve just arrived and want to crash or explore. The area is fantastic for the metro – there are 3 metro stations all in walking distance which makes getting around a lot easier.
