It takes about 30 minutes from the Gare Du Nord and probably 20 minutes to the Eiffel tower (or around 10-15euros in a taxi). The metro line the hotel is on does run above ground (including going pass the Eiffel Tower above ground!) so is quite nice to travel around on. On the first day we walked to Notre Dame, probably took us over an hour and was a good couple of kms – but we were exploring so no problem there. Essentially the main attractions of Paris are spread out along the Seine so ideally you’d be close to there. There are a few restaurants in walking distance and a couple of mini-supermarkets too if you want to escape the hotel prices. The room wasn’t noisy & was air conditioned. One thing I would say is, if you’re not staying in Paris on business and would rather a Parisian atmosphere I would recommend staying somewhere else – there is nothing Parisian about this place; with all the Americans we could have been staying in a Marriot in Washington DC for all I knew! Overall a decent hotel, I was pleased with the price based on comparisons, there were no major issues, just very American when I wanted French! I would stay here again though; to get the quaint Parisian hotel in the center I would probably have to pay twice the price!

Reviews.Title: “OK stay”
Reviews.Author: TripadviceUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as part of a conference. The area it is located in is nothing special and the rooms look worn. Had an interesting view from 12th floor, although could not see any of the Paris landmarks. Bed was comfortable, but felt the room service was overpriced and not very good.

Reviews.Title: “an ok marriot but it's Paris”
Reviews.Author: globalpilot
Reviews.Content: The location is only a 5 minute walk to the metro. lots of Americans stay here and airline crews. Always a long line to check in and out. Rooms are small and so are the bathrooms but the bed is great. Executive lounge has wonderful chocolate croissant's. Not a lot of good TV channels to choose from and no movie channels. One of my biggest complaints is when you get a message it goes on the TV screen and until the front desk clears it you cant watch TV. I stay at Marriots around the world and this is the only one that has this awfull message feature.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service...too many Americans (I am one)”
Reviews.Author: Rinej
Reviews.Content: Typical Marriot, great rooms and facilities. Executive lounge was awesome. Good location and close to metro. Was surprised though with the number of North Americans. Kind of takes away some of the ambiance of being inParis if everyone is speaking English.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best in the Marriott line”
Reviews.Author: Traveler27PA
Reviews.Content: This is a very crowded standard Marriott conference hotel. Pros: Near the metro Cons:- Internet was intermittent at best, front desk did admit this was a problem. Definitely a problem for a business traveler - Very crowded - Long wait for crowded elevators, people were taking the stairs - Totally disorganized for getting a taxi, you could wait 30 mins or more - No water pressure in shower, light out in bathroom never replaced, good thing there were two - Refrigerator in room did not work, found out the hard way - Wanted to extend my 7 night stay 2 more days, they had a room but would not honor the corporate rate for the additional nights. I am sure my corporate travel dept will appreciate this information. - Not a lot of restaurants or stores in the area

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Marriott beds and service!”
Reviews.Author: jenadove
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, very near the Metro (5 minute walk). Typical Marriott - very generic, but good beds (in comparison to traditional European beds) which is why we stayed here. Concierge was great in recommending restaurants that were not touristy and gave us several recommendations of when and where to go to tourist destinations. There are several good cafe's a couple of blocks away. It's on a quiet street, not a lot of tourists so was nice to "get away" from the noise!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RJL1982
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great service and good location near metro and RER for Airport CDG.

Reviews.Title: “Meetings in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jmcewen28
Reviews.Content: Good hotel if your lookign for regular Marriott quality, rooms could use some scrubbing but overall comfortable stay in Paris. The hotel is located close to the metro so it is very easy to get around the city, the bar is great for an evening cocktail and the staff are very helpful in finding local eating establishments.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and Quiet Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ZzRicezZ
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was awesome, it is between 2 metro stop on the M6 line, also 10min walk from the RER B line which is the train you can take from the CDG Airport. There is also a nice pastry place right across the Saint Jacques metro stop if you are walking from the hotel. On Sunday when we arrived we were walking toward the Gladere metro stop there was a pretty long market that was setup along the way. The staff at the hotel was very nice and informative, check-in was very quick and concierge was very helpful, we found out from him the bike that are for rent was mainly for local cause they don't take foreign credit cards. We were on the 16th floor and the view was awesome, we could see the Sacre coeur from our room. The room size was small but no complaint for us, also they have a mini fridge for personal use which was awesome cause we went to the local convenience store to buy some water and beer for myself :).. One thing was we didn't understand why they didn't have shower curtains cause we take shower and water would splash onto the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Cecile1965
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very clean and comfortable, the staff very helpful and sympathetic and the restaurant and bar very attractive. The hotel is located near the metro so you can reach any destination within a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Springtime in Paris”
Reviews.Author: bluebonnet1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel via the metro, which is about a 10 minute walk. The rooms are small but comfortable. The bed linens were nice and we slept well. The bathroom was clean but smaller than we are used to in the states.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Good Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: gktambe
Reviews.Content: I happened to stay in this hotel during my visit to Paris for a conference. The staff was well attentive and has provided excellent. The rooms were comfortable though a bit small. It is located very close to the Metro. The convention center is very good with excellent acoustics

Reviews.Title: “Great stopover hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: n2research
Reviews.Content: After leaving Bordeaux, we took the TGV to Paris. We arrived by taxi from the Gare Montparnesse (7 Euros) by 9:30a. If we didn't have 6 bags between us, we would've easily used the the tram line 6 to Glacier station with only a 3 minute walk to the hotel. Our room wasn't ready so they held our bags and offered us access to the Executive Lounge. We had a nice continental breakfast before consulting the concierge about the ins/outs of the tram system. They gave us a map and pointed us in the right direction. The staff were very helpful. We spent all day in the city and arrived back in the late evening to find our bags already placed in our room and a note welcoming us to the hotel. We enjoyed cocktails in the executive lounge and then asked the concierge for dinner recommendations. We had a fantastic dinner in the neighborhood at A'Loutte and packed our bags. The next morning we enjoyed another breakfast before taking a taxi to the CDG airport (45 Euros). Overall, it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: riverrunnermo
Reviews.Content: We were with a group and found that the service was excellent. The room was comfortable and had a great view of the neighborhood. The hotel is not in the heart of the tourist areas, but the public transportation / Metro was very convenient to the hotel. We stayed an extra night and were given very good information from the concierge desk to make our travels easy. The advice for Notre Dame Cathedral services was excellent, and the directions to the Louvre from ND was also excellent. We purchased advanced tickets to The Louvre from the concierge and they worked wonderfully! We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: BostonGoBoSox
Reviews.Content: Excellent and attentive service, comfortable if unspectacular rooms, good health club, decent restaurants. Very near the metro and walking distance to both Place D'Italie and Denfert Rocheraux, which has direct subway service to Charles De Gaulle and bus service to Orly. 5 minutes from the catacombs and 20 minutes on the metro to any major attraction. Buy a Paris Visite pass for the best transportation value with unlimited bus and subway rides.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale hotel with Metro Convenience”
Reviews.Author: MarilynBrien
Reviews.Content: Forget everything you've been told about Left Bank hotels. This hotel is like walking into a convention center Marriott in the U.S. The rooms are large with heavenly beds and linens with expansive windows. The only complaint I have is the steep cost of Internet connections. The location is not in the tourist areas but the Metro is almost across the street. Returning from a Left Bank restaurant we had difficulty with two different taxi drivers recognizing the location and had to finally tell the 2nd driver to take us to Metro Glaciere. Take a photo of the hotel with address with you if you plan to return by taxi. This hotel had airline crews, a business convention, and sports teams there during our stay. It is a great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “WE WILL BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: candygirl82
Reviews.Content: My husband & I celebrated our wedding here & it was fantastic. The staff & service is first class. Our dinner which was provided by the hotel was amazing. we also spent the night there. Our room was on the 15th floor & the view of paris was magical. The room was spacious; modern; clean & very up to date. The bed was BIG & very comfy. We had a chance to experience their American breakfast buffet: They had an omelet station; pancakes; croissants; different types of breads; fruits; cereal; a selection of hot & cold drinks. There was just a very big variety of everythiing. My husband & I are eager to go back & spend the night & if we have other events; this hotel will always be our first choice. I can honestly say that you will not regret picking this hotel. JUST AMAZING

Reviews.Title: “Very nice side of Paris, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Earthbound-Traveler
Reviews.Content: Having been to Paris many times, this was the first time I stayed in the 'Left Bank'. I wiil come back here, the walking is easy and shaded. There are many good restaurants close by. The metro is on the corner and the train station is down the street. The staff made you feel welcomed, the in house brasserie was very good, a good bar and also executive lounge. The breakfast was very good, eggs cooked to order.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but technical difficulties”
Reviews.Author: AustinTraveler77
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with clean rooms. I am a Marriott Gold Elite and had access to the executive lounge which was well above average. The hotel is convenient to the Paris Metro and the RER station. Numerous restaurants are along the street between the hotel and the Metro stations. Shopping is available near the RER station, about a 5-10 minute walk away. The major problem I encountered at this hotel was the poor wireless provided through iBahn. The logon procedures do NOT work at all, a fact well known to the staff. Their stock response to complaints is to connect you to some iBahn service rep who needed to have me go through finding my IP address and other technical settings so they could authorize the access. After a few moments, I got annoyed at this nonsense and insisted on seeing the manager. I had HIM talk to iBahn and go through the exercise which took him almost a half hour. I got wireless service free as a Marriott Gold Elite; others would have had to pay an overpriced fee for this "service". The worse part of this was the attitude on the part of the staff that this was an iBahn problem, and not a Marriott responsibility. They seem to think it is OK to advertise the service and collect a fee while expecting you to have to contact a third party to get the broken service repaired. If the toilet breaks, are they going to give me the phone number for the plumber and expect me to take care of it, too? Also, we got woken up by an automated wake-up call which the previous occupant must have set. Apparently the staff does not reset these when a customer checks out. Also I did not get a email eFolio copy of my bill as is usual for Marriott Rewards members. Seemed like the staff was technically challenged, or these systems needed some upgrades and better management.

Reviews.Title: “Great American hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: likesabitofluxury
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my first night in Paris and it worked out perfectly. The room and bed were very comfortable and the bathroom great. They had a electric hot water heater in the room, which I find so much more useful than the usual coffee maker, so I made tea at night and coffee (provided) in the morning. TV offered English channels, including CNN, which I didn't realize wasn't the norm until I checked into my second hotel and had nothing to watch but French TV. This hotel is about a 10 to 15 minute walk from the RER B line (Denfert-Rochereau), which is the train you'll take from the airport into Paris (~10 Euro). It was great not to have to change trains with all my luggage to a local line as the main changing station (Chatelet Les Halles) is really big and has plenty of stairs that would not have been easy to traverse. There's a grocery store down the street if you want to stock up on essentials, but I really liked the instant coffee in the rooms. The concierge will show you the best places to go jogging, if that's your pleasure. I went on a great run to the Jarden du Luxemburg, St. Germaine, and the Pantheon. I highly, highly recommend this for other joggers! All in all, this was a great place to stay on my first night in Paris. It's not situated right in the middle of the Paris action, but gave me all the conveniences and a good night's sleep. I can't comment on the value of this hotel since I booked my room on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott still doesn't get it re WiFi”
Reviews.Author: roamingamerica
Reviews.Content: This was the second stop of a two week trip. We were first at the Budapest Marriott. As with that hotel, we used Marriott points to stay at the Marriott Rive Gauche Hotel. We also stayed here in 2007 when it was being renovated. We had no problem staying at this hotel and the prior review can be found on tripadvisor. Based on our good experience in Budapest we inquired about upgrading to the Executive Level in Paris. The cost was close to $100 per night rather than the $75 per night we paid in Budapest. I found out that snacks were only available five days a week rather than the seven days we had in Budapest. We decided to pass on upgrading as there was no value for us to do that. My wife noticed right away that this hotel didn't have bathrobe or slippers which she had at the Budapest Marriott. A prior post mentioned the shower 'curtain' which is a piece of glass that only covered about half the tub. It was impossible to shower without water spraying on the floor. The biggest problem continues to be the lack of free internet access which Marriott just doesn't seen to get. The charge here was about 20 euro PER DAY which came to about $29 per day. No weekly rate. It is insanity to pay that kind of money for access to the internet, especially considering the room runs about $189 per night. Friend flew in from Switzerland to visit with us for a week and stayed at a Mercure hotel. The cost was 95 euros per night which included breakfast and free WiFi. The rooms were not very much different in size. So given that Marriott continues to not provide free internet access I can't rate this hotel anything better than average and I had to fight with myself to not rate it poor.

Reviews.Title: “Soulless and expensive”
Reviews.Author: Goldilocks130
Reviews.Content: A soulless place. Adequate for business needs but terribly overpriced for what you get. If you are bringing your family to Paris there are many better alternatives. If you stay here be prepared to pay through the nose for everything, beginning with internet access for more than $30 DOLLARS A DAY (it's not even free in the lobby). For the money you can definitely do better and stay in a hotel that feels like you are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for large families”
Reviews.Author: Jason M
Reviews.Content: With four adults and four young children in our party, we needed a hotel that was convenient, offered connecting rooms and service to meet our needs. The Marriott Rive Gauche surpassed all my expectations. The neighborhood is quiet and safe - perfect for a good night's sleep, and the hotel provides nice views of the city. Regarding transportation, the St. Jacques Metro is a two minute walk, Denfert Rochereau for the 38 bus (Boulevard St Michel) is a five minute walk. The bell captain arranged for comfortable transportation - with four carseats - to CDG. The concierge was the best I have ever encountered. He was extremely helpful in providing guidance and arrangements for continuing medical care Food: Breakfast in the executive lounge is OK. Room service is prompt though the after 10pm menu is significantly limited. The hotel restaurant is contemporary and fun for both children and adults alike. Rue Daguerre and its shops are a five minute stroll if you'd prefer to be more local, if you go be sure to savor Le Pain Au Natural. In summary,

Reviews.Title: “Good service and perfect for business Meetings!”
Reviews.Author: LaTrottola
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel last April in occasion of an international conference. My room was a standard twin and it had all the services of a 4 star hotel; it had a modern furniture and even an ironing board! The bathroom is a bit small but the facilities had recently being restored. Breakfast is quite huge and offers a wide range of food. Reception and event staff is always very kind and attentive at every request. One negative point is that sometime elevators didn't work with the magnetic card so that I had to wait 10-15 minutes to get to my room (17th floor). I had lunch several times at the bar and at the restaurant as well, food quality and cost is good for Paris. Very useful the parking right behind the Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great service, decent property”
Reviews.Author: ENem
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews of this hotel prior to to our trip, and had a few reservations with what seemed like a mixed-bag of reviews. The reviews fit the hotel appropriately. The concierge service was impeccable. Like other reviewers have written, there were multiple people staffing the desk most times of the day. They were pleasant, recognized you when they saw you, and had great advice on dining, transit, and local attractions. The service alone made our stay as good as it was. The hotel itself is a little dated. Everything was in working order, but it wasn't "fresh". Also, our room was not in the best condition, with dirty carpet, mold growing in the bathroom and a sink that leaked all over the floor every time you turned the faucet on (which the hotel repaired during our stay). As others have written, it is a bit far from the major sights. That said, if you are a traveler who likes to explore, it's a really lovely 30 minute walk to Notre Dame, and you pass right by the Latin Quarter, Sorbonne, and several great restaurants and bakeries. The trains are right across the street if you aren't a fan of walking that far, and the Denfert Rochereau stop is one away, for easy transfers to most places in the city. If you are able to partake in the executive lounge, do so. It has a great breakfast, free internet (in-room is $20/day), and happy hour in the evenings. Mixed bag and all, I would probably stay there again. For the price, you get a decent hotel and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Highest level Marriott, treated like dirt”
Reviews.Author: ProfT
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times and loved it -- and given it rave reviews. This time I was staying on reward points. The hotel site asked if I wanted to pay extra euros per night for an upgrade, which I decline since as a Marriott Platinum Premier that is part of what you normally receive. The woman at the front desk got through what should have been a 5 minute spiel in French in about 1 minute. Fortunately, I speak French, but she didn't know that. In the past I have had welcome gifts in my room, such as fruit, chocolates or wine -- nothing this time. Not on that, but I was given the smallest room I have ever had in about ten stays at the RG. It also overlooked rooftops in the southern suburbs of Paris. When I checked out, I asked if they could call me a taxi to the airport. While not as rude as the check-in woman, he simply pointed outside. I will never, ever stay at the Rive Gauche again. If this is how they treat their most frequent Marriott travelers, then how do they treat others. I do think it is because I declined to pay extra for my 'free room'.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cargenty
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 days in this hotel with my family. It is a old hotel rebuilt for Marroit. The rooms are a little small and the bathrooms too but they are nice and clean. The location is good and very close to the metro stations .The parking is expensive but it is possible to leave the car outside for free (in august). Nice view and very good buffet breadfast. Only problem we need to pay internet and it is really expensive. ( 20 Euros per computer!!!!).

Reviews.Title: “Still a Good Solid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rhine-and-Roses
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our week at the MRG. Courteous check in, with the hotel respecting our wish for two beds. The rooms were standard Marriott rooms. We had a view facing the street on the 6th floor. We had no noise at all. The beds were comfortable. The room had enough space for two with suitcases. The closet is a little tight for hanging things. There is an iron and board, a mini-fridge, a tea kettle with instant coffee and tea bags. The were refreshed daily. The TV was a good size with plenty of channels. The desk was good for working. I LOVE the ice machine on each floor. The bathroom was a WC separate from the sink and tub. The tub had a half wall (glass) enclosure for showers. Plenty of hot water, although the water pressure was not always fantastic. They replenished toiletries as needed. Housekeeping was good. I called for a robe and they brought it up right away. Along with slippers. Our AC went out one evening and we had a warm night. I asked for it to be repaired, but it was not, so the next evening when I came back at 10pm, I had to move rooms. It was a little bit of a pain, but they were properly apologetic and offered to help. (I didn't want help- I didn't want to have to pack everything in the suitcase again.) The new room was even better than the first because by now I was alone and had a great big comfy king size bed. The meal I had in the ground floor cafe was not great. I am not sure I would eat there again. I did take out coffee and a breakfast pastry several times and that was reasonably priced and good. The staff was cordial each and every time. The concierge desk had long waits, even though the hotel was not crowded. This was my fifth or sixth stay here and this has always, always, always been a problem. No free wifi, or newspapers. You have to go to the business center to pick up a copy of Marriott's news flyers. I like the neighborhood and the convenience to public transportation. (Take the bus- better views and it's not hard.) Also consider Denfert Rochereau metro/RER stop as it is might be more convenient for many journeys and is only a tiny bit further than the St Jacques metro stop. It has the direct line to CdG Airport. I will unquestionably stay here again. I hope they continue to maintain a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenjram
Reviews.Content: Nice newer Marriott property. I was a little ticked that they made me buy an extra room when traveling with my two small children. Most European hotels are like that, though. Go prepared.

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel for families on their first trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Tobin A
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights and rented two rooms as there were five of us. The hotel thoughtfully placed our rooms close together on a high floor (15th - awesome views of the city). We stayed with our older teenagers who also enjoyed the hotel. It caters to business tourists and high-end leisure travelers. Families with younger children will not see some of the amenities (play areas, child sitting) associated with some Marriott hotels. The staff speak impeccable English and were friendly beyond any Parisian stereotype. The concierge desk is staffed 24/7 and is frequently staffed by more than one person. I had one gentleman call an Avis location for me so I could better find it when I walked over for me. The concierge staff simply could not have been more helpful or accessible. The hotel is tastefully decorated and is connected to a full gym to which hotel guests have 24/7 access. Spend the extra money to gain access to the executive room on the 3rd floor which serves breakfast and dinner on the weekdays. It will more than pay for itself as the restaurant on the ground floor is quite pricey as are many Parisian restaurants. The hotel is located between the Glaciere and Saint-Jacques Metro stations but is very close to the Denfert-Rochereau Metro station which is important because it is an RER transfer station. You can take the RER for the same price as the Metro and arrive at Notre Dame, the Louvre, and Musee D'Orsay much more rapidly than taking the Metro. Furthermore, we took the RER to Charles De Gaulle airport much more cheaply (2 euro/person) rather than taking a limo which would have been exorbitant. The neighborhood around the hotel is populated by shops and restaurants which while not very rustic, are very pleasant. We found a bakery nearby whose bread we could not resist. There is a shopping mall about a 15 min walk away. The Latin Quarter is nearby as are the Luxembourg Gardens. About the only downside to this hotel is that it is somewhat remote with regards to Parisian sights. Metro rides to the Eiffel Tower are about 20-30 mins which are long, but tolerable. The hotel is reasonably priced in comparison to hotels closer to the sights so there is your trade-off. This was our first trip to Paris and the Paris Marriott Rive Gauche made it an enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't feel more than an average 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa2319
Reviews.Content: Probably the worst feature of this hotel is location. If you want to go anywhere you probably will have to take the subway and even transfer Ask for a room that doesn't face the metro, as the hotel is across from it. If you want to use the internet be prepared to pay 6 euros for 15 minutes, that means about 10 dollars. In a four star hotel you have to pay for internet? Their little coffee-bar area is nice and you can get sandwiches and salads at an affordable price Rooms are OK Staff OK But nothing that you will remember after you leave as great service

Reviews.Title: “Still reliable and Efficient”
Reviews.Author: College Bowl
Reviews.Content: 20 months since our last stay and everything still runs smoothly. The room was fine and the Executive Lounge is terrific. The staff is friendly, courteous and helpful. The concierge team is brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home for a busines traveler”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFourZ
Reviews.Content: The "sameness" and high quality service of Marriotts all around the world are a comfort to the frequent traveler. For business or pleasure, this Marriott is no exception and has all the amenities one expects. Clean, spacious room and friendly staff. Wifi that works in the rooms and a nice executive lounge. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “aperfect place stay and run the marathon”
Reviews.Author: momcummings
Reviews.Content: My husband ran the 2011 Paris Marathon and we needed a good hotel with proper and comfortable beds and ice was available after the race for him to ice down ....he is 69 and ran his first marathon down the streets of Paris!...the rooms were perfect and very comfortable....staff was very helpful and accommodating....there were plenty of Italian restaurants nearby to bulk up on pasta....two metro stops also very close to get him to the start of race and return...we would pick this hotel again even if he doesn't run another marathon!

Reviews.Title: “To big to be good.”
Reviews.Author: FromPhillyPa
Reviews.Content: The public areas of this Marriott smelled like a dirty ashtray. The rooms, while large, were stuffy. Everything was extra. They wanted an outrageous price for Wifi. The breakfast was a ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice suburban neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: SavantIII_11
Reviews.Content: Our Paris Marriott decision was complicated due to a variety of Marriotts; we wanted to be close to the Left Bank, and Rive Gauche provided this location. Rive Gauche is a very large conference hotel, and we were initially concerned by the size. However, we never encountered waits or problems with this property, and highly recommend this hotel Marriott Gold Elite members enjoy excellent rooms and complimentary dining. This property seems to be a mini-United Nations because of numerous nationalities and languages. Concierge level rooms are on a par with Marriott's finest. Concierge level breakfast is complimentary, and is offered as a buffet in the executive lounge. Concierge evening events are provided on in the executive lounge with complimentary beverages. It is necessary to seek a local restaurant for dinner Given the subway, this Marriott is ideally located.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, reasonable rates.”
Reviews.Author: zerolex
Reviews.Content: The Marriot Rive Gauche is perfectly located for anyone who needs to work in Velizy but wants to enjoy downtown Paris at the same time. Sanit-Jacques station (6 Line) is less than 2 blocks away, with access to Eifel, Arc de Triumph and Trocadero. The rooms are quite nice and not at all small by European standards. Also, if you are a runner, this is a perfect starting point. You can easily run up and back to many landmarks or head right to the gardens around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great suite...”
Reviews.Author: katerina_bralos
Reviews.Content: We usually prefer hotels that are not in the city centre but a bit further with a some kind of transportation near. This way we stay at non-touristy district. This hotel was between 2 metro stations and was very convenient. I must say we were the lucky ones, because when we arrived there were so many people waiting to check-in (it was new year's eve) and they said they only had twin-bed (we didn't book it from their web site). Fortunately, i had a silver member Marriott card and when i complained about the twin-beds they gave us a suite and a pass to the executive breakfast lounge! I was impressed by their professionalism at this level... The suite was fantastic, 2 bathrooms, 2 flat screen tvs, nice view, and if i could put the bed in my suitcase i would buy it on the spot! Breakfast had great variety, i really enjoyed the omeletes made on order, although but it was crowded at this time of the year! The receptionist was very polite and when we asked him about restaurants with Eiffel Tower view he showed us on the map the available restaurants, how much it would be approximately and when we picked one he made us a reservation. It was great! I would recommend this hotel to anyone, the Marriott card is indeed appreciated. [ Tips: When you arrive at the airport try to get a card for all transports, according to the zone you want to go. Disneyland, Versailles and the airport were not at the city zones for example. We issued a weekly card (a photo was required but a photo-copy would also do) and travelled around. I think this card changed so ask there which card is the best for you. Also, we wanted to go to Trocadero station where the Eiffel Tower is for new year's eve. As the metro line near the hotel is the one that takes you directly there, we made the mistake to go to the station after 11 (so that we would be there by midnight). Wow you cannot imagine what was happening! The trains were full and we couldn't get in the first ones! We squeezed in one and we arrived 2 minutes before midnight, we almost had the change of the year in the train! Also it was mad out there :) If you plan to do so, you'd better start earlier! Another tip, on new year's day that almost everything is closed (museums etc), Disnayland is open! So go there not to lose a day :) ]

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for American Tourists”
Reviews.Author: fred200099
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with "US-sized" rooms. If you are not too adventurous this is a good hotel that would meet most tourist expectations. It does not have the character and charm of the many nice little French hotels around Paris, but then again, airconditioning in the summer, gyms with treadmills (mostly functional), gift shops, and a snack bar may be important to some travelers. Because of a conference arrangement, we had access to a special breakfast service that was mostly ok (not always fresh croissants, smoked salmon, runny eggs, chicken sausage, etc.) - same offerings in the concierge lounge (except for the salmon). Concierge service was superb (ask for Gerard, if you want the best source of information), we got our tickets for Versailles here, we got advice on how to take on the trek up to the top of Sacre Coeur, we got reservations for one of the best restaurants in Paris - Mon Veille Ami on the Ile de St. Louis, they also set up the return trip with a cab to the airport. Internet service costs 20 Euros per day -!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing American Luxury”
Reviews.Author: AliciaandPaul
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel on about 10 different occassions when I have had to travel to France for business. The staff is extremely friendly and all speak English. The room service and menu items in the restaurants offer options that remind me of home in the US after a week away in a foreign country. The beds are incredible. They have mini-fridges and a great shower/bath. Right across the street from the train and only 2 blocks to a train that goes directly to CDG airport. The concierge will give you advice on day trips around Paris. Very nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: trvladdictsd
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with great sized rooms, located away from the hub of Paris, but really close to two metro stations in easy walking distance. Lots of restaurants within walking distance, perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: acgwinn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room for 2 nights via priceline.com. We arrived the hotel had run out of rooms for us as well as another couple. They then placed us in a lower quality hotel, a Courtyard Marriott, far from the city center! It was terrible and was not even accessible by public transit!

Reviews.Title: “Large room in remote area”
Reviews.Author: TotoroNJ
Reviews.Content: Facility is great. Clean and large room. Very thick wall. So, no noise from next door. Breakfast is good. Hot and cold combination. Negative : For Wi-Fi , you have to pay 19euros/day. This is typical American hotel chain. Parking fee is high. So, you have to pay for internet, parking, breakfast. Location is far from the central area. From St. Jaque metro, 5 min. walk. But, from Louvre museum, 25~30 min by metro. If you want spacious room, I recommend this hotel to you. At least, this hotel near to a metro line.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and efficient”
Reviews.Author: oliveerpent
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel, renovated in 2007 with great capacity, equipped with meeting rooms for conventions where the international spirit dominates. This Marriott does not have the luxury that we hope to have but offers all you need to spent a comfortable stay and the rooms on the upper floor are quiet . I just regret the minibar completely empty but ... Excellent hot and cold breakfast with show cooking and pleasant service. Each day, you can enjoy an “happy hour” drink in a modern and design atmosphere. To make short : a good hotel a little far from the center of Paris but only 150m away of the subway station “Glacière” with excellent connections everywhere. Pleasant district not far from the Montparnasse tower. Some tips : the spectacle "Voca people"( Bobino theatre), the restaurant "Les 2 Magots", the Comartin theatre “J'aime beaucoup ce que vous faites”, To have a drink bld Saint Germain in the patio of the store Ralph Lauren and to see Paris ofrom the roof of the Montparnasse tower! Price per night per room (Friday & saturday) : 209 EUR (breakfast included) via Marriott webside

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not four stars”
Reviews.Author: LaWoj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a conference, so did no reSearch or shopping around for accommodations. We had read mixed reviews but overall were quite pleased with our stay here. The good: helpful concierge, comfy bed, nice gym, breakfast was delish, and though the location was not immediate to big tourist attractions, we liked the neighborhoody feel and the easy access to the metro got you quickly to wherever you wAnted to go. The bad: bathroom in need of some updating, room small, and it seemed expensive for a standard style hotel room. It didn't feel luxurious. Overall, if you can get a room here for a good price, it will be a nice place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Another Hotel Ripoff and Pretense at Grandeur”
Reviews.Author: lulupearl
Reviews.Content: I would never stay here again! Let's start with the charge of 19.95 Euros, PER PERSON PER DAY for the use of the internet! I remember when hotels made a lot of their money charging for the use of the phone. Now that everyone has a cell phone, they are doing it for use of the internet, AT SOME HOTELS! If you travel as a couple and you each have a computer to work, it's simply outrageous to have to pay 40 Euros a night to use your computer on the internet; not to mention being asked for my credit card when I went to the Business Center to ask if I could print something. I have no patience for any of this anymore. It was not even hot in Paris and the room was stuffy and hot with the A/C running at what was allowed as the maximum in the room. Finally, the windows could not be opened even if you wanted them.

Reviews.Title: “It was alright...”
Reviews.Author: tianaak
Reviews.Content: It wasn't fabulous or horrible. Decent rooms with okay service. It seemed as everyone in France was quite rude. The breakfast buffet closed early but was nice. It was horrible to see one of the waitors yelling at a younger trainee who had just started. The location again was alright, we were close to the metro but it was a little in the centre of nowhere with drunk locals on benches outside. It didn't really do it for me.

Reviews.Title: “Service was good. Location and tired interior not so good.”
Reviews.Author: matthewedward
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is good because it will not charge additional dollars when you book points. Furthermore, they give you a reasonable breakfast in the executive lounge. The interior is tired and in need of renovation. Carpeting, tiling, paint all needs to be upgraded though it isn't an emergency...just not up to Marriott standards. Rooms were big enough with an adequate view of the city if you are on the higher floors. Location is 1 1/2 blocks from the Glacier stop of the #6 Metro. That is good and convenient but don't think you are staying in a touristy area. There is no tourism in walking distance of the hotel...more a business area. Still the metro was convenient and only required one train switch to get just about everywhere. Stay here with points or if your company is paying for the rooms...otherwise, may do better to look elsewhere if you want that typical Marriott quality.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'd go back”
Reviews.Author: ljkfmk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here without knowing much about the hotel except that we are Marriott gold members and this hotel was available for the time we planned to be in Paris. It was extremely well located for us, just a block or so from the nearest metro station. The neighborhood is quiet and mostly residential but we found everything we needed nearby including a fabulous bakery, an open food market on Sunday and some really excellent restaurants. The staff at the hotel was outstanding, and were most accomodating to any minor requests we had. We had free internet access, though the connection was often spotty. The room was lovely, the bed divine and the view quite good. The concierge staff couldn't have been better and recommended two really good local restaurants that definitely were not touristy. Everyone was very friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CarolLeeAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times. I travel a lot on business and use my Marriott points for fun trips like Paris. I stayed five nights in July using my reward points. While I do sometimes get upgraded here I had a standard room this time which was fine. Bed was very comfortable, room was quite and service was fine. I did have a 'partially' accessible room this time. (I am not sure how a wheelchair user would be able to use this "accessible' bathroom) The big problem with that was the fact that there was no door or shower curtain so it tended to get a little wet in the bathroom when I took a shower. (I didn't notice this until the day after check in and decided it was too much trouble to move) As an elite level traveler with Marriott I got free internet, but it's very costly otherwise. The location is in the 14th, but the Metro is just a block away so it's easy to get everywhere! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Business standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: kenjukes
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, good rooms, good location and reasonably priced for Paris. Can take a long time to get taxis in the morning (around 8am) as ours took approx 30 mins from when we joined the taxi queue outside the hotel (should have taken the Metro!)

Reviews.Title: “Meh, if you have to stay here, it's ok.”
Reviews.Author: Francofile1
Reviews.Content: Large mid level hotel. If you are an elite Marriott member, you'll be ok. Even with that status, service follow through is lacking. Rooms weren't ready when we arrived at 1:30pm for a 3pm check in. 2nd room wasn't ready until 3:45pm. Not helpful with jet lag. Requests for the 2nd room and later extra towels, water bottles for the mini bar and other supplies had to be called in 2-3x before they were fulfilled. Bed very bouncy, so every time your partner turns over it disturbs your sleep. Still, relatively clean and quiet, so ok. In a nice but boring area, which is true of most large hotels in this ancient and charming city. Close to Metro stop and very safe for walking.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great choice”
Reviews.Author: Dave73y
Reviews.Content: I stay at Marriotts around the world, mostly on business, and am generally quite pleased. This hotel, though, proved to be a bit dissapointing. The rooms were clean and, by Paris standards, quite large. However, the service was not very good and the meal we had in the restaurant was easily the worst we had in Paris. The hotel is also located in a so-so area that is not close to shopping and good restaurant choices. If you want to stay at a Marriott in Paris, a better choice is their hotel on the Champs-Elysees. It's pricier but in a great location and, based on our experience last year, offers much better service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: lilac31661
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times for business, and I am always satisfied with my stay. First of all, the hotel is right across the street from the metro (Glaciere stop), and within minutes you can be at the Notre Dame and all the other sites. The hotel is situated in a neighborhood with grocery stores, cafes, and parks nearby as well. The rooms are decent size, and have all the amenities that you would expect to find at a Marriott. Remember, you are in Europe, so don't expect the size of room that we get in the US! But, you are in Paris and I can't imagine you will be spending much time in your room anyway. The hotel has a nice little bistro and bar in the lobby area, so you can grab a coffee and panini before sightseeing. One thing about the rooms...the majority of the rooms have windows that don't open, and sometimes during the hot summers the AC doesn't quite cut it. The hotel does have a few fans, so if you are there in a shoulder season before the AC is turned on you can call the front desk for a fan. They also have a great concierge desk, and they will make dinner reservations, set up tours, give directions etc.. All in all, I would recommend this hotel. It is comfortable, clean, convenient, and the staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay- room & service!”
Reviews.Author: guy4travel
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. It is a great area- easy walking to restaurants and very safe. The Metro is also very close and easy to use. The room was very comfortable- nice set up for charging all my gadgets. The bed was great. I recommend the hotel restaurant- had a really good dinner here- great food and service. The coffee bar is also great. The staff was very helpful and spoke English which made my stay easier,

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of America in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Texan56
Reviews.Content: After having spent a couple of weeks in French and Italian hotels we arrived at Marriott's Rive Gouche hotel in Paris. The attention to customer care and complete satisfaction during our stay stood out above all the other hotels we visited during our vacation. I travel around the country and as much as possible I stay at a Marriott hotel because of these qualities. It was a complete surprise and a pleasant one to find the same level of attention in another country. Kudos to Marriott for giving the same level of customer satisfaction abroad as we get in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Marriott Property in Paris”
Reviews.Author: RPoisson
Reviews.Content: This is a particularly nice Marriott property in a city where prices are astronomical and hotel standards can be very low. The rooms are large and modern and offer wonderful views of Paris. The staff is exceptionally welcoming and professional. Breakfast offers unusual variety and quality for a European hotel. While the neighborhood is a bit distant from the major points of interest, the metro is very handy and there are some real pleasures to being located in a Parisian residential neighbborhoos. Also the hotel is very convenient for those arriving at CDG airport as the RER traingoes right to Denfert Rochereau---just down the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good, with a few issues”
Reviews.Author: Jenny8551
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a pretty good place to stay in Paris. The location is not that great for travelers like myself who want to go all over the city, but the pastry shop and the florist nearby were terrific! It may not have a convenient location for sightseeing but its right next to a metro station so getting across the city was not a problem. The hotel itself was clean and overall a nice place. The rooms very fairly large and the beds were very comfortable. It had an American feel to it, but after weeks of staying in smaller less luxurious places it was a welcome change. Most of the staff was nice and polite, except for one gentleman behind the counter at the café who was a bit rude. Overall we had an enjoyable stay at this hotel. However we did encounter a few problems. The elevators were constantly having issues. The key card sometimes didn’t work and one day all of the elevators shut down and we had to navigate our way downstairs and through the basement level to get out. Also, the Wi-Fi was not very good at all. We were using an I-Pad and tried to download a movie on it. The Wi-Fi connection was so poor that after three hours it had only downloaded around 9%. Overall, it was a nice stay and we would likely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nothing amazing, but good”
Reviews.Author: ziggity15
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was your standard Marriott hotel, inside the hotel everything looked like a normal marriott which could have been anywhere in the US. The room was nice and clean. The location isn't great for sight-seeing, but the hotel is located about a block away from a subway station, which makes getting to things much easier. There are a few good restaurants in the local area but you had to look for them as most of the better or more authentic restaurants were off the main roads on little side streets. Good hotel, but nothing spectacular; the hotel staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: hungrykat
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on Priceline for $115/nt in the beginning of June. It was fabulous. 2 minute covered walk to the metro. Only 1 train change to the airport. Very convenient to main attractions. Staff were fantastic and beds were very comfortable. Would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Worry free and close enough.”
Reviews.Author: RADARSHE
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times while on business in Paris. The rooms are well appointed and large by European standards. The staff as a whole is quite good, with the Concierge and front desk personnel standing out. The physical fitness facility will easily meet most traveler's needs. My rating of 3 for location is because the hotel isn't near any of the "tourist" sites. Having said that, Le Metro is just a minute walk away from the front door. It is a short ride to the museums. The hotel is in a nice area and I've walked to it after dinner many times. I would not hesitate to stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Showing mom around Paris”
Reviews.Author: MJWORK
Reviews.Content: Great location! A block or two to the metro, 2 grocery stores (which helps because meals are expensive but if you buy fresh fruit and croissants you are set) close by, nice rooms and lounge!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rate Wonderful Room Mavelous Stay”
Reviews.Author: phennisbaby
Reviews.Content: I was concern initially that my transfer from the airport to the hotel would be problematic and expensive. However, since I carried only on checked bag and one carry on, I decided to take the RER-B from CDG to the hotel. It cost me only 8.70 Euros which is approximately $13 USD and I only had to walk for ten minutes from the Denfert-Rochereau RER station to the hotel. Compared to 15-30 Euros for a bus shuttle or 50-60 Euros for a taxi, the RER-B and the ten minutes of walking/exercise was the best choice for me. I do not recommend the RER-B from the airport, if you have more that one bag, have children with you, or if you are not up to walking with your luggage. I go a really good rate for my week at the hotel (180 Euros for the first night and 145 Euros for the other six night). My room was on the 15th floor with a fine view of the city. I could see Notre Dame Cathedral from the window. As always the king size bed was extremely comfortable and just what I needed/wanted after my nearly 9 hour flight and my ten minute walk with luggage. Everything is Paris is pricey, so, I have no complaints about the 24 Euro daily buffet breakfast. However, I passed on the 39 Euro Sunday Brunch, it just did not seem worth it to me. My only disappointment with this hotel was the limited options from the dinner menu. There are several restuarants near by. I strongly recommend that you do not go to the very first one you find located to your right, after you exist the hotel and walks a few feet. I ordered a beef dish from there that came with fries. The beef /steak was inedible, I could not chew or swallow it . I was given no satisfaction by the waiter or manager for the awful beef I was served...just the bill. However, the restuarant that is immediately next to it, (sorry, I do not recall the name) was good, great pizza. The neighborhood seemed quite safe, and I am a woman who was traveling solo. The Metro system was very easy to use and 3 Metro stations were within easy walking distance 5-10 minutes. I was able to make smoooth connects to all the places I need to go, roland Garros, Printemps, Galeries Lafeyett, Notre Dame Cathedral, Champ Elysees, etc. I had originally planned to stay at the Renaissance Arc De Triomphe. However, since this was not my first trip to Paris and I did not need nor necessarily want to be located in the middle of all of the tourist spots, I chose the Rive Gauche Hotel and will again, if I have reason to return to Paris. I love Paris and I love Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: happysanman
Reviews.Content: Booked with Priceline...great price...yes it is in the 14th so a little far out, however we used the subways which were very convient. We also walked to Luxenburg Gardens, Notre Dame area, hotel provides a great map for walking. We liked the little grocery store just down the street for wine, beer and snacks. We ate breakfast every morning at a great little cafe Lecrit just up the street, had dinner one nite at Rendezvouz Denfert Square. Best suggestion if first visit ask hotel where the Open Bus hop on and off bus tour is, you can walk from hotel we did a 2 day tour which was fantastic, highly recommend. It's key to use the subways if staying at this hotel and you can hit all the main parts of Paris. For the price we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but a bit far away and neighborhood lacking”
Reviews.Author: barusso
Reviews.Content: I am a faithful Rewards member, but I found the hotel lacking a bit. Rooms were pretty modern, clean, and the hotel had the good features you come to expect from a Marriott. It's better for business travelers. I personally didn't like the location as I felt distanced and the neighborhood is lacking. To be fair, my daughter liked the hotel better than I did. The staff was pretty nice, but the Concierge gave us tired and touristy recommendations for dinner. We asked for a recommendation for a local restaurant NOT so frequented by travelers (and he clearly understood us) and when we arrived, we found it full of Marriott guests, referred by this concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: hopegoodeNyc
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and found the traveling a bit tedious as we needed to use buses due to my knee problem. Our main complaint was that the bed was too soft. However, the breakfast was outstanding as to variety for a 4* hotel. Abdul, the chef, could not have been more acommodating. He greeted every guest as they arrived for breakfast and asked for follow up as to the quality and need for special dishes. The concierges were also exceptional in the time they took to map out bus routing and recommend restaurants. These positives outweighed the earlier stated negatives. In addition, the rate paid was quite low compared to other hotels. For us, though, we will book closer in next visit. Should you be able to use the metro, give it a shot!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, efficient with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: BostonFrequentTrav1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Marriott in late May, 2011, because a conference took place there. It exceeded expectations. For about EU 200 ($284) I got a clean, well-maintained room (1556) on a high floor with a great view. Front desk staff was courteous and efficient and was able to provide early check-in, a godsend after an overnight flight from Boston. Laundry service was better than average. Concierge service was excellent. Philippe knew just the dinner place to recommend, he made the reservation and he encouraged me to walk - a good suggestion. Conference center was pleasant and efficient with lots of fresh fruit to go along with French pastry as nibbles. Very welcome. Elevators a bit slow at times - one appeared to be down for maintenance. Other reviews knocked the hotel for location and certainly it was not in a special neighborhood. But proximity to RER (a way better bet from CDG airport than a pricey taxi stuck in traffic) and a few local cafes made up for the lack of ambience in the immediate area. Very fine stay, happy to recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel - great value - decent location”
Reviews.Author: Sully_Caffs
Reviews.Content: We decided on this hotel/area as it's not too far out of town but you don't have to pay a fortune to get an upmarket hotel. I was very pleased upon arrival seeing the lobby and bar/cafe area. All very nicely decorated and quite luxurious. Check in was easy and quick. Our room was great, not huge but fairly sized, lovely comfortable big bed, flat screen tv etc. Bathroom also fine. Not 5* but clean and modern. Breakfast was very very nice, huge choice and all good quality as well as a fresh egg station and the usual stuff. The location of the hotel is in a residential area and is very quiet, however you have two metro stations very very close to the hotel, and a larger one 5 - 10 mins away with more connections; and a little supermarket if you needed it. We did not have any issues with transport and could be in any of the areas we wanted to visit within 10 - 20 minutes on the metro. We didn't have the need to get a taxi once. Overall we were extremeley pleased with our choice of hotel and with the value for money also. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Near Glaciere Metro”
Reviews.Author: bettylopez10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at River Gauche Marriot using our Marriot Rewards. We were upgraded with free internet, access to the business lounge and breakfast due to my husbands Marriot Gold Card . It is as comfortable as other Marriot Hotels.One thing I like about Marriot is the bed and the pillows. A tip to getting here.From CDG airport, take RER B at either Terminal 2C,D,E or F and get off at Denfert Rochereau stop/ Once you exit from station just turn right along St Jacques Blvd. It is about 15 min walk. Make sure you carry coins with you to buy your first RER ticket into paris (Euros 8.7) otherwise you have to queue up at the counter/booth if u want to use your credit cards.

Reviews.Title: “Has Everything but Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Souris
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in this hotel, which seems to attract business people, conference attendees (it has a conference center) and airline flight crews. I was told that it was built in the 1970’s and originally opened as a Sofitel. The room I had was quite nice, clean, large and comfortable. It was a standard quality Marriott room, as I would expect it to be. I do not know if it was an “upgraded” room for Platinum Elite clients. The bathroom was small, but nice, with lots of mirrors. The tub-shower combo is just the European shower hose type of shower; so do not expect it to be invigorating. The WC, as is usual in France, was in a separate little room off the bathroom. My room, 1406, had a view on the Blvd. St. Jacques side with a splendid panoramic view of the city, including the Pantheon, the Senate Rotunda in the Luxembourg Gardens, the Observatory, Sacre Coeur, Les Invalides, and the Tour Montparnasse. As it is a very large hotel, one feels quite anonymous, and you are not greeted by staff as you go in and out of the hotel as is typical in many other Marriotts, if only for security’s sake. The reception/lobby area is just too big and impersonal. (Not a complaint, just an observation). You will need to use your key to access the elevator, so there is some element of security though I would say that it is not totally secure. The Concierge Lounge (on the 3rd floor) was nice and very large, but I didn’t find it quite as nice as at other Marriotts. I especially cringed to see that the drinking water is poured from large open bottles instead of offering individual small bottles. The bottle caps are removed and the bottles are placed in a below-the-counter fridge such that when you try to grasp it, the easiest way is to grab it by its neck near the open top of the bottle – very unsanitary and a particular problem for those with immune-system medical issues. (Just hope that everybody sanitized their hand first). The lounge was always very crowded at breakfast and at cocktail time, and the American guests visiting it during my stay were extremely loud and annoying just at a time when you hoped to relax with a cool refreshment in a calm, quiet environment after a long day. There were only a few newspapers on the reading rack, but unlike other Marriotts, there was no stack of newspapers for guests to read and take back to their room. The service staff in the Lounge were quite nice and professional. The hotel restaurant is designed to sustain weary travelers as a convenience only. It is rather poor quality, so eat here only because you have to for some reason. I arrived a bit too late to go to lunch elsewhere and had a thick, tasteless, unappetizing, split pea soup and a Salade Paysanne of endive, potatoes, lardons, walnuts & hard-boiled egg. The Belgian Endive in the salad was brown & mildewy on the edges – way past its prime. I could hardly eat any of it. It is very expensive and not at all worth the price. The restaurants in the immediate area – pizzerias and bar restaurants – are only a little bit better. The location in the 14th is a distance from any tourist attractions, and although it is right on a metro line, the one running from Nation to the Étoile, it is difficult to get anywhere to the north without changing lines once or twice or more. For example, getting to the Latin Quarter, which is nearby, necessitates 1 or 2 transfers, depending on your destination. You can get to the Eiffel Tower, and the Arc de Triomphe directly on this line. I used to live quite near to this hotel and know Paris & its metro system quite well, so it was not a problem for me, just an inconvenience. However, for those who are here for tourism and unfamiliar with the metro system, you could find yourself spending lots of time, first figuring out how, then getting to & from the tourist attractions. I do not recommend the Marriott Rive Gauche for first-time tourists to Paris, or for those who like to wander around their hotel neighborhoods. There is not much of interest in the immediate area unless you walk further down the Boulevard (turn right as you exit hotel) towards the 13th district to the Place d’Italie and the charming Butte aux Cailles neighborhood. (On the Rue des Cinq Diamants there are some very inexpensive, but hearty restaurants that attract students and die-hard budget travelers, such as Chez Gladines). The 13th also is considered Paris’ Chinatown, so you will find many Asian restaurants & shops here. The Manufacture des Gobelins tapestry manufacturing museum and the Bibliothèque Nationale (National Library) are also in the 13th. If you walk in the other direction (turn left as you exit hotel) to the Place Denfert-Rochereau, the pedestrian Rue Daguerre has a little street market in the morning. This is a very fine hotel. However, I, personally, would not stay here again now that I only visit for a few days simply because of its location. I prefer the Marriott Place Vendôme in the 1st or the Crowne Plaza – Place de la République in the 11th, both of which locations allow me to do so much more with my time and both of which have excellent restaurants in the hotel and very good restaurant choices in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous rooms convenient to Metro, RER B, and local shopping”
Reviews.Author: wetravellight11
Reviews.Content: This is a great up-scale hotel in a quiet residential neighborhood. Our rooms were traditional Marriott with very comfortable beds, spotless bathroom, and mini fridge. We especially like area as it is NOT touristy but, just a few blocks away, has the Rue Daguerre outdoor shopping area with plenty of eateries, a Monoprix, and at least one of every store you would expect in a Paris neighborhood. If you like to be arm to arm with other tourists, don't stay here; but if you want to experience local Paris life, this is a perfect spot. This Marriott has a concierge level and if there is any way you can upgrade to this level, you will have found a piece of heaven with the amenities offered. We took the RER B line from CDG directly to the Denfert-Rochereau stop which put is about a 4-block walk from the Marriott. There was 1 flight of stairs to climb but otherwise was a very convenient way to reach the hotel, especially during Paris rush hour.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs! Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: KikaSthlm
Reviews.Content: Would have been an ok hotel in a too distant neighbourhood if it weren't for the fact that I was bitten by bed bugs in my room.... Stayed for three nights, and the last night I woke up with some weird bites on my arm, all bites lined up in a row. Apparently the bed bugs also got into my clothes because I then got bitten even more times. It took me a while before realilzing what it was and all in all I now have more than 50 bites in total! Just read that bed bugs is becoming an increasing problem in Paris and I can confirm they have now invaded Marriott Rive Gauche. So stay away to avoid getting their nasty bites and (even worse) bringing them home with your luggage!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel Staff Made This A Trip To Remember”
Reviews.Author: djpollux
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we discovered that there weren't enough rooms to accommodate us for the entire length of stay, so the Front Office Manager quickly arranged for alternate reservations at another wonderful property, the Marriott Courtyard LaPlace, with the final night at Marriott Rive Gauche. When we returned at Rive Gauche, we were pleasantly surprised to find ourselves upgraded to a huge suite! Our kids were delighted. We loved Paris, but most of all, we love Marriott Rive Gauche!

Reviews.Title: “Well-run hotel but neighborhood is lacking”
Reviews.Author: Salthawk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well-run with an excellent staff. The breakfast which was included in our room package was very good. The Glaciere Metro Station is just steps outside the door and will take you anywhere you want to go in Paris. The Luxembourg Gardens are within walking distance and just 5 minutes away if you are jogging. We felt safe walking in this neighborhood, although it is always wise to keep your valuables close to you in Paris. The only drawback was that when we would return from sightseeing, it was hard to find a traditional Parisian restaurant for dinner. There seem to be a plethora of Italian restaurants in this neighborhood and we did have good pasta one night right down the street from the hotel. There are a lot of bars with smoking on the patio but that is not our thing. A couple of nights we ended up eating in the bistro in the hotel. The food was good but when we go to Paris, we like to mix with the locals and you won't find them in this American-style hotel. Although our room was very nice and comfortable, we plan to stay in a boutique hotel on the left bank when we visit Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: surfcatFF
Reviews.Content: I think it would be nice to stay closer to the river, but I suspect the price might double, for this quality of rooml. There is a handy free Velibe bike station and Metro station just out the front door of this clean, comfortable hotel. (the bikes are extremely handy to go 'downhill' to the river in a matter of minutes... and also at night when the traffic and tourists subside). The staff was very good. Concierge was very helpful. Get all of your museum tickets from them in advance. Our king room was a bit small, but nice and very clean: good for the price. Ask for a room on the river side, higher up, with views. Ask about the awesome patisserie and brasserie up the road (Rue Dugerre was it?). Great way to start the day! Get to know the metro and velibe bikes on the first days of your stay, they are super handy once you get the hang of using them.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel value in Europe”
Reviews.Author: sjmacdee
Reviews.Content: This is our fifth trip to Paris, so when I say this is a great hotel, especially by Paris standards, I know what I'm talking about. The room, by european or Parisian standards, was huge with plenty of drawer space and a small closet. The bath had a regular size tub, a rarity, and a shower with plenty of hot water and pressure and was very clean. In fact, the room was spotless and very nicely decorated. The best part might have been the bed, the king size bed!. The best bed I have ever slept on in Europe. It had a real matress, not the foam pad you usually find in hotels in this price range, A very comfortable, real matress and six, count em, six feather pillows, soft feather pillows. The sheets were exceptional, too. Very nice quality. The room had a safe, a refrigerator and an amazing view of the Panthenon, the Sacre Coure, the Oberservatory and the dome on the Invaildes. The Eiffel Tower was blocked by the tower in Montpernasse. This was a clean, very quiet, very comfortable room in a hotel that might be the perfect blend of an American and a European hotel. The staff was very helpful, especially Benoit at the concierge desk, and really went out their way to make our stay very enjoyable. Check in and out was a breeze. The location is right across the street from the number six metro line and just down the street from the RER B train that runs directly to CDG. You can be anywhere in Paris in minutes. You are also wihtin a few blocks of lots of cafes and pubs in the nice area called Renfert-Rochereaux, sorry for the spelling. Don't worry, the Metro is very easy to navigate. It takes about five mnutes to figure out. Much easier and much, much safer than NYC's subway. We ride it at all times, day and night. Make sure you get the weekly pass for 18.50 euros. If this place sounds too good to be true, it isn't. This really is the best hotel we have ever used in our 20 trips to Europe and is the best value we have ever found. Don't pass this one up. The only problem we had in eight nights there was on our last day, four of the six elevators were not working for a time. Did I mention there are six elevators, regular size elevators, big enough for you and your luggage, and other guests. lol The breakfast was exceptional but not cheap, 24 euros. Ours was included in our room cost of $179, which, if you've checked other hotels, is very inexpensive. This is the only hotel we will use in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Standard French Marriott”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller550
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice, staff was efficient. I like the location. Quiet. Breakfast was spendy but nice. (It is everywhere). Close to the metro, 2.5 euro to anywhere. I liked it!

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, great deal, clean & convenient!”
Reviews.Author: namila
Reviews.Content: The location is not super ideal for tourist activity but the hotel is very close to the Metro & train lines going into town. Having been in Paris before, I actually prefer being out in the 13th and 14th arrondissement area. The hotel is quite close to a number of cute bistros. We were on a high floor, great views, very clean, seemed recently refurbished. Very happy with our stay and obviously how could you not love Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way but surprisingly convenient.”
Reviews.Author: KTSB
Reviews.Content: Good service staff and Executive Lounge. Suite was a good size for a family. Pets allowed!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Anionfan
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a weekend in Paris, staying at this Marriott. I chose it deliberately as the map showed it to be out of town, yet close to the Metro and the RER. Metro/RER tickets were really easy to buy, as the machines are bi-lingual and there aren't that many options, unlike trying to buy a train ticket in the UK. We did have to queue to check in, and it seems to be down to the fact that the receptionists are super helpful, and want to show you all the best places to go on the map you get given. Maybe they could hand this back to the concierge, who was just as knowledgeable. Our room was way up high with a great view of the city. Very little noise from the traffic, or the Metro across the road. Okay, so it wasn't huge but this is Paris, I don't expect huge rooms. Bed was huge, we actually managed to lose each other behind the masses of marshmallow-like pillows! Plus points for lots of mirrors, minus points for not putting them where there was any natural light. The bathroom was bijou, with a separate toilet - and you wouldn't want to be too big - I've been in bigger airplane toilets. And the flush was really loud - we could hear the neighbours when they flushed, which I found a bit unpleasant. But hey, it was all clean, we got fresh towels and amenities. It would have been nice if they'd taken away our coffee mugs, perhaps we were meant to rinse and re-use them. Marriotts always seem to have magnifying make up mirrors - great for make up, and also for showing all those wrinkles you didn't know were there! We only made breakfast once, and it wasn't the best out there - though it was quite late - they go on until 11am, which is very sociable. I think that's more down to the availability of ingredients - the sausages weren't bad, they hadn't been deep dried, or microwaved; the bacon was excellent, the scrambled eggs were non-existent, the potatoes were diced and sauteed; the cold cuts and cheese looked fine; there weren't many pastries left by the time we got there, and no brown bread for toasting. I can highly recommend the omelette bar though. We ate in the restaurant one night, and although the menu felt a bit limited, the burgers were fabulous and the french fries crispy. Prices are a little on the high side, same for the drinks - pretty much comparable with London. Though 40 euros for brunch seemed a bit steep for what is essentially the same as the breakfast upstairs plus a glass a bubbly. I'd like to see better separation between the bar and the eating area though - if you sit at the bar, then diners are only 5 feet away, and I dislike watching people eating. Some of the tables are even out on the reception area. We had a snack Sunday when we missed breakfast, and had to eat sitting at the bar while brunch was served behind us - the smell of roast lamb when you've a hangover is truly not a good thing. Well done to Roger in the bar for knowing what a dirty Martini is, and for making time to stop and talk even though they were shutting up shop. Husband was going to try the fitness centre, but the hangover won the fight, so can't comment. I'd happily stay here again, and this time I'll remember to take the Berocca. And this time we won't eat at the Italian on the block across the road adn we'll definitely go back to the Aussie bar.

Reviews.Title: “Just the name...”
Reviews.Author: bitzanu
Reviews.Content: I’m happy that I had a coupon code on Expedia, when I purchase this hotel. However, still does not worth the price paid (2 persons, breakfast included ~ 120€/night). Location, far from the city center, close to metro. By the way, metro line 6 is the busiest metro line in Paris. Sometimes, you can not get in the train because it is full. I will not repeat the other reviews regarding the room and services (small room, king-size bed, poor cleaning services,etc), but I will comment the room heating policy. You can warm your room starting 18:00, until midnight. You can set your room temperature however you like, it will not work (max 20°C). The complains to the reception does not solved anything. But they give you six pillows and a thick blanket. I know there is a economic crisis, but still…. Almost nothing french in the morning breakfast (american hotel line). So, I will give you the same advice….choose a hotel in the center.

Reviews.Title: “Not close to ANYthing! Not worth staying here!”
Reviews.Author: Noush01
Reviews.Content: I should've listened to everyone's review... you all warned me that it's not close to anything, that the rooms are super small, that the bathroom is literaly the size of a very tiny closet (and as if placed in a closet)... I didn't listen and I regret it! Don't follow in my path! Choose a hotel in a better (lively) location. There is nothing around the hotel and you have to take a cab or the metro to get to anywhere! I thought this is paris there are restaurants everywhere... well apparantly not in this area! Besides the bad location, small room, and akward bathroom I felt the front desk was trying to pull one over me. I am a Marriott Gold Member so I should get upgraded to the Executive Floor automatically but upon checking in they told me that they would not upgrade me but can sell me that room for an additional 65 Euros a night and if I dont pay that they can be making money on that room and they call sell it to someone else. After I pushed on that I wont pay and shouldnt have to pay cause it's one of the benefits of being a gold (and I wasnt rude or nasty or talking loudly) they put me on the Executive floor. I think they tried to pull one over on me and when I wouldnt budge they gave up. The reason I stay at American chains when I travel is to avoid these games! I also stay at American chains for the rooms and the simple things I am used to while traveling. I think this might be a franchise property (I will be very surprised if it's an owned/managed property) because the level of service is much lower. I've stayed at other Marriott properties in Europe and they were all very consistant. Thats why I wonder if this is a franchise and if it is how is it that they are keeping their Marriott flag. The rooms are tiny! The double beds are slightly bigger than a twin and much smaller than a full (this is not the case at the Hamburg Marriott or the London Marriot). The Executive Lounge is not on the same par either.. it's as if they are being frugal on the items they offer. The funniest thing I saw was that the house keeping staff just made up my bed and didnt clean any of the coffee cups (but placed the cold coffee cup which still had coffee in it back at its place!). I've been here 3 days now and they never replaced my shampoo or conditioners either. So I think the Director of Housekeeping needs to be replaced or the housekeeping staff needs to be trained. Wow, this turned out long! Just do yourself a favor and stay in town. This is too far to travel and taxi's are hard to find in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Decent I guess, not really a romantic spot”
Reviews.Author: fuego2u
