Reviews.Content: So I named my own price for a 4 star in Latin Quarter, and I was matched with this hotel for $135. Then I learned this isn't really the latin quarter, and wasn't really the ideal pick for a romantic stay in Paris. That being said... the hotel was actually really good. Friendly staff who spoke English. Room was a bit small, but the king bed was comfortable and nice and big. The convention center is massive, but the lobby and downstairs rooms are impressive looking. The toilet is awkward detached and without fan, and there was also a hole in my bathroom wall. Europe has a weird half covered shower thing so that was ... interesting. They charge 19 Euros a day for internet. That is ridiculous as it would've been 15% of my hotel bill, but it was easy enough to find a cafe with wifi, or go to a McDonalds which all had wifi for free. The location is pretty awesome as it is right on a metro stop, and Paris metro is amazing. It's pretty quiet which is a good thing. I managed to have a great time in Paris and this hotel was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: CB_Highlander10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights last summer as part of an Insight vacation tour. The hotel is clean and modern and the staff were helpful. The room was spacious and clean. There is a business centre located off of the lobby with internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: VeronicaFox
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a meeting in Paris for a total of 5 nights. It was close to the metro line and close to Montparnasse. Quiet area and and a get-away from a lot of tourists. The rooms were clean and were large for Europe and the King size bed was very comfortable. I have stayed at 4 different hotels in Paris and this is probably the first one I have ever recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-close to Metro Line.”
Reviews.Author: bobseelos
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in Feb 2011. Stayed here previously in 2010. This hotel is situated in a quiet neighborhood away from most tourist sites. However the metro entrance is only one long block away and is a main line that gets you to all the sites fairly quickly. The hotel is a favorite for airline personnel so there are plenty of flight crews coming and going. This is also a convention hotel. The rooms are pretty standard for a Marriott and the beds are great. Plenty of room in the bathroom and the rooms are in great condition. The Paris catacomb entrance is only three blocks away and is a must see if you want to see thousand of skulls and bones taken from all of the graveyards in Paris years ago.

Reviews.Title: “another great stay in paris”
Reviews.Author: umu
Reviews.Content: For 3 nights we had a great stay in this fine hotel. The reason I give only 4 stars is that we were promised 2 connecting rooms at the moment of reservation which they failed to deliver at arrival without any excuse or compensation. This time we really were very happy with the good quality of the beds and the complete silence usually lacking in paris.

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly and helpful concierge”
Reviews.Author: marimexicana19
Reviews.Content: I needed to order flowers for Valentine's Day for a family friend in the U.S. whose girlfriend is studying in Paris. Not only did Bennoit, one of the concierges at the hotel, advise me, he actually offered to purchase and deliver the flowers himself! I was so thankful because it saved me much valuable time. The staff at the Marriot have always been friendly and helpful to me, but Bennoit really went the extra mile!

Reviews.Title: “Reliable hotel for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: americantravelgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a business trip to Paris. It's not in central Paris, so I probably would not choose to stay here for leisure. The rooms are quite nice, relatively recent furnishings. The bed was super comfortable and I slept exceptionally well. The bathroom was small, but fine for one person. I had breakfast, which was a comprehensive buffet with the high quality food you expect in France. Most wonderful of all, I got a small pot of coffee all to myself, an almost unprecedented experience on the Continent (a little touch of America - thanks Marriott). I will use this hotel again when I return to Paris on business and have recommended it to my colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: emcorp
Reviews.Content: What can I say...very comfortable bed, 5 minutes from the metro and great breakfast. It was priced right too! I loved the ice cubes making machine on each floor. If only the Internet was free, it would have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaHD
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy access to all sights. Few minutes walking distance to choice of 2 Metro stations and RER station. Room was relatively small but very nice, great view over Paris. Very comfortable beds. Nice that there was a fridge and safe in the room. Bath tub/shower had one of those glass partitions so that when you showered the water sprayed all over the place - give me a shower curtain anytime. Poor plumbing somewhere because whenever the neighbors used the toilet you could hear the flushing reverberating throughout. Good breakfast, nice bar, very reasonable bar prices considering location and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints...comfortable Marriott like room”
Reviews.Author: newyorker88
Reviews.Content: This isn't the George V, but it offers dependable and comfortable accomodations in a relatively good location and if you can get a good price why not. Modern hotel with standard, comfortable rooms. No surprises here. Just good, decent accomodations. Good for families who don't mind staying at an American style hotel. Location is not in the main part of Paris, but you can easily go anywhere you want by the metro which you can see from the hotel windows. Higher floors offer great views of the city. Not great, but certainly no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott like”
Reviews.Author: anindyachakraborty
Reviews.Content: Verify strategically placed between two metro stations of St Jacques and Glaciere. gave me an upgrade to a junior suite when they say we are three of us. Best hotel of my trip . This review might not be helpful as i should have stayed as a solo traveler and then experienced the pros and cons. nothing abnormal i noticed. the morning breakfast need more variance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice American Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KateCinci
Reviews.Content: Doesn't have the charm of Paris or European hotels, but if you are looking for American comforts - this is it. Big beds, decent sized rooms, and English speaking staff. It's a short walk to the metro and very easy to get from CDG airport to this hotel. However, this is on the outskirts of town - so be prepared to ride the metro for awhile to see anything.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel away from the major tourist areas”
Reviews.Author: Vitidemi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Rive Gauche during Christmas week using points. This is like most Marriotts although the rooms were smaller requiring us to get two rooms for a family of four. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and all spoke English. We had access to the Executive lounge because I'm a gold member. That helped to reduce the cost of our stay because of the included breakfast and access to water and sodas, as well as wine and beer during cocktail hour. What we liked most about this Marriott is that it is very close to the Metro and the Metro is really the best way to see Paris. The mass transit system in Paris is very good, convenient and trains run frequently. We used Paris Visite passes for zones 1 to 3. Note, that the airport and Versaille are in zones 5 so you'll need different tickets for that. Traffic is awful near major tourist sites so mass transit is definitely better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adventureguy010872
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris for one night and stayed at this property. The room was clean and had a great view. Service was excellent...friendly and courteous staff. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted in Denfert...”
Reviews.Author: Afternoon_tea_please
Reviews.Content: Great stay in this hotel. We spent three nights here over a weekend and had a fabulous time. Wonderful staff, large room, HUGE bed, and lots of lovely creature comforts. It's not a boutique hotel, (much the opposite - it's a large conference centre!) but in a city where 'Boutique' often falls synonymous with 'small, grotty and may contain lice', I certainly appreciated egyptian cotton, extra pillows and a plasma screen, despite the corporate vibe. Clean, comfortable, and well positioned for exploring Paris - 3 stops on RER to Notre Dame, (4 to Gare du Nord) or a 25 minute walk to St Germain. Didn't eat in the hotel, but did discover a particularly delicious Algerian restaurant close by (take a left down the diagonal side street out of the hotel and keep walking for 3-4 mins, you'll find it!) Denfert isn't a hive of activity, but even for a couple in our twenties, it has all the absolute necessities - restaurants, patisserie, cave du vin etc... Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice for Paris, Price”
Reviews.Author: HonkHonk
Reviews.Content: If you are like me, price limits and traveling-companion preferences limit hotel options in Paris. Having stayed at the Le Meridien Etoile previously and being less than impressed, I decided to give the Marriott Rive Gauche a try. It is comparable in price and accommodations, but better than the Le Meridien. The Le Meridien is somewhat better located, however. Like many business hotels, it managed to neither offend nor impress. The hotel was clean and service was adequate. It seemed to offer a number of different services. The common areas were fairly beat-up looking and appeared to have multiple coats of paint where a full-blown renovation would have been more appropriate. My room was good sized, clean, ordorless, adequately decored, and sufficiently equipped. There was no hallway noise. Amenities were standard and included an iron/ironing board, instant coffee and tea, hair dryer, and safe. The shower was free of mildew. There was a separate toilet room. The cooling system was shut down, but room temperature was comfortable. The room did not have a useless mini-bar filled with overpriced items, but rather an empty mini-fridge. The bed was very comfortable but was soft, so if you like hard beds this could be a problem for you. Oddly, it appeared the door frame had once been ripped off as a result of the door being forced open with the safety chain attached (see photo) and glued back on. This would not be attractive for safety-conscious people. My room rate included WiFi and breakfast. WiFi worked well. The breakfast buffet was decent, but I would not have been happy to pay full price for it. But having internet and breakfast included in the €178 room price made it a value for Paris. As many reviewers have stated, it is an odd location for a big hotel. In the southern part of the city, the immediate area is primarily residential, quiet, and low key. Nevertheless, it is equidistant to two nearby train stations and about a €10 taxi ride to La Republique. For €1,70 you can ride the train to any point in the city. There are some shops and restaurants within a short walk, so you will not be isolated but if you want to be close to the action, this is not the place for you. I would recommend this hotel as a viable option for a large, full-service hotel especially if you are in Paris for business reasons. Hope this helps. .

Reviews.Title: “Everything that you would expect of a first class Marriott hotel”
Reviews.Author: MauriceC
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Rive Gauche has everything that you would expect in a large conference center - with the bonus of extremely good service from helpful and knowlegable staff, and comfortable rooms. The location is a bit outside the "center' but a short Metro journey or 6 euro taxi gets you there. My one complaint would be the limited selection of English Language TV stations - basically BBC and 5 news channels - but then that is pretty typical in France as is the E 19,95 a day for internet.

Reviews.Title: “YEARS OF LOYALTY; BUT NOW IT'S OVER”
Reviews.Author: CHEOUX
Reviews.Content: Since winter 2010, the Mariott Rive Gauche -where I stayed at least 30 times over the last 5 years, has now decided not to further offer rooms for clients who enjoy smoking. This management decision - not enforced by law- now results in me having found other Paris hotels that welcome smoking and non-smoking guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great option”
Reviews.Author: miamimomofthree
Reviews.Content: This is not a typical Parisian boutique hotel. It looks like a Marriott in the states, so if you're looking for a hotel with that French feel, go elsewhere. However, if you want a comfortable room (read: larger than a matchbox), with a very comfortable bed, large bathroom (by European standards), and proximity to two subway stations this is a great option. I stayed here for $100 (dollars) / night, and got the room via Priceline. I've stayed in other hotels in Paris before and they were much smaller, even though they were more central to the tourist spots. However, I was very happy with my stay. To get a great room with a great view for that price in Paris is not easy. Make sure you ask for a room that does not connect to another room (they have NO soundproofing) and that you request a NON-SMOKING floor. The hotel is in a very quiet residential neighborhood, very safe, and quite a few typical restaurants around, even though they may not be Le Deux Magots... My only real complaint is the wifi. Come on, 8 euros for 1 hour? I wasn't going to spend money on wifi - it's 2010 for goodness sake! I checked email a block away at a cafe with free wifi, and 7 euro breakfast. Don't pay them the 65 euros for wifi and breakfast. Save it for the rest of your trip, you'll need it with the exchange rate where it is at!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: hoteltraveler40
Reviews.Content: We stayed using Mariott Rewards points, so consider this when determining value. However, I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel when footing the bill. Pros: 1. Very comfortable beds. 2. Excellent concierge desk. 3. Good service in Executive lounge. 4. Most staff speak English. 5. Room had small refrigerator, Cons: 1. Not in the 'pretty' part of Paris. 2. Food in hotel restaurant was not-so-great. Grocery store (Monoprix) close by. Turn right when exiting hotel, turn right at Pharmacie sign, turn left at bakery, store is on left, grocery is in basement, first floor sells clothing and such. Executive lounge was open for food service Monday through Friday during our stay. Breakfast was served, along with afternoon deserts and evening beer and wine. All were complimentary with access. No food service was available on weekends. No alternative breakfast was offered. However, lounge was available for Internet access and coffee/tea on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CuriousTraveler27
Reviews.Content: I should start out by saying that we used our Marriott rewards points for this stay so I was very happy with the value, obviously. We were in Paris for a long weekend of sightseeing so, as it should be, we were not looking to spend lots of time at the hotel, but for the time we were there it worked well for us. Great service at the front and concierge desks. We arrived early and were able to check in. There is also a business center where we could check into our flights and print boarding passes for no charge before we left. The staff gave good recommendations to restaurants and were very helpful with directions and general information. We were there during the strikes and the staff made sure to make us aware of the best bets in getting around. There are 2 metro stations within a block of the hotel and you’re able to get to all of the major attractions quite quickly. We did walk from the center of the city back to the hotel a couple of times and yes, it can be a long walk but nice to see more of the city. The hotel itself was quiet and the room was nice. We had a king bed that was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was bigger than I expected and had a separate room for the toilet. The room was clean with the exception of some mold still lingering in the shower. Other amenities in the room included a desk, TV (limited channels but you’re not in Paris to watch TV), refrigerator (which wasn’t stocked as it was noted that guests enjoyed extra space for their own purchases), standard closet accessories and toiletries. I would definitely stay here again next time we’re in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful experience”
Reviews.Author: jojobo69
Reviews.Content: Everyone in this hotel was helpful and friendly. We enjoyed our week stay here in spite of the transport strike which resulted in taxis as our chief means of transportation everywhere. The rooms sparkled. We had the extra benefit of the use of the concierge lounge and we really relaxed there after our days of touring. Close by are restaurants that were an added plus. In the course of the week there, we walked all around the streets near the hotel and felt quite safe.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back - this is our new hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: 1tiredpuppy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Defense last year and were excited to try a new place. This hotel fit the bill in every way! We were greeted at the front desk by the very friendly staff and then the manager on duty who escorted us to our room. They upgraded us to a suite (room 1152) that had great views. We had a king size bed, 2 full bathrooms and large sitting area with a desk and 2 flat screen TV's. There was plenty of room for the 2 of us and could have fit more with no problem. We requested that the sofa bed be made up after I came down with a nagging cough and didn't want to keep my friend up all night. Even the sofa bed was comfortable and I have never said that about a sofa bed! Our mini fridge stayed stocked with free water and canned drinks. The housekeeping staff was very responsive to our requests and were appreciative of the Euros we would leave daily as a tip. The workout center was one of the best we have seen in a long time. We visited the Concierge lounge on the 3rd floor everyday for breakfast and were pleased with the food choices, free beverages and free internet. This hotel is a block from the Metro, line 6. You can get off at Saint Jacques or Glaciere and walk a block to the hotel. RER B is about a 5 minute walk. We like being close to the line and having restaurants and grocery stores around.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: rater1
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's a bit out of the way in that it's not near any of the big tourist attractions. But it is near an RER B stop and near a subway stop. If you're comfortable using mass transit, the location isn't too bad. If you want things - restaurants, monuments, etc. - within walking distance of the hotel, look elsewhere. Staff was nice and helpful. Restaurant was okay and priced a little high for what you get. Gym is above average, particularly for Europe.

Reviews.Title: “No "wow" factor”
Reviews.Author: CFC_Philly
Reviews.Content: The front desk didn't have my room ready for early check-in (not required, but a little annoying). The hotel staff was extremely courteous and respectful and (at least) bi-lingual - making my trip much easier. The gym had LOTS of cardio equipment and a pretty good amount of Nautilus - a rare find in a European (or other) hotels. The location was exactly between 2 metro stops but about a 15-20 minute walk from restaurants. You would DEFINITELY have to take some transportation to sites though (I would recommend for business travel only). It was a bit pricey for a Marriott - but it's in Paris, so that's to be expected. The room was mainly the bed (king-size), but did have a nice flat-screen and mini-fridge. Not too much "storage" space - but as I was on business I hung all of my clothes anyway. My bathroom was in pretty good condition (a few old "mold marks" around the tub but nothing new) but I can see how some other travelers found faults with it. Internet was very pricey too for the rooms despite the claim of "Free Wifi" it was just connection to their router, the actual service was ~12 euros for 5 hours! Mainly, the hotel was serviceable for my business trip, and I slept GREAT (comfortable bed, etc.) but wasn't really impressive. I bumped it to 4 stars instead of 3 because the service was exceptional, and it did meet the needs of THIS trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: darrenSouthWales
Reviews.Content: Travel to Paris at least once a year for leisure.This was by far the best hotel we have stayed at and will certainly return. We went this October for our wedding anniversary and e mailed the hotel before hand to request a special view. We were certainly not disappointed - fantastic view of Paris on the 16th floor. We received complimentary chocolates and a small bottle of wine - a very nice touch! The Hotel is the usual Marriott high standards and quality throughout with very attentive service. Rooms very clean and beautifully decorated - no signs of wear and tear or mold!?. Ate in one evening - nice French menu but very over priced for what you got! Only negative - its location- not just to get into Paris as the metro near but not much in the way of restauarants/bars to chose from in the vicinty. Nevertheless for our next visit it is likely to be our first choice IF we can get a good rate which we did this time.

Reviews.Title: “Marginal, mouldy and 'cheap' service experience at Marriott. My worst hotel this year.”
Reviews.Author: CeesF
Reviews.Content: I have been staying regularly at the Marriott Rive Gauche over the last 3 years, as it comes recommended by the firm I work for. Over this period I gradually have become more and more disappointed. Overall I feel that the Marriott have lost the plot on their pricing as well as on how they address their hospitality. The office booked late and there was a strike on in Paris, however for Euro 329 (exlcuding breakfast) and in this price bracket, I expected some value and service. Some examples: Cheapest toilet paper one can find. No bottled water in the room. Empty mini-bar. Blistered, brown stained, toilet seat. No city guides or any hospitality reading in the room. Cramped, very low ceilinged hallways. Scruffy slighly molded shower wall. Mould smell. The rooms are really small, and the bathroom and toilet even more so. When one showers, one has to watch out not to scratch the ceiling tiles. The toilet is seperate and very cramped too. Overall, It feels that Marriott;s service and value for money have gone down over the last year or so. It feels that they do everything to spend as little on their guests as possible and increase their room rates opportunistically. Lastly, wifi, in most American hotels is now free - except here. I travel a lot (weekly) and this has been, by far, my worst experience - never again.

Reviews.Title: “Super comfortable beds!!!”
Reviews.Author: BubbleGirl13
Reviews.Content: Although not in the best of locations for seeing the sights, this hotel served our purposes extremely well. The hotel has all the amenities you require and the beds are so comfortable you won't want to get up in the morning! There is a metro station within easy walking distance which will take you to all the sights you wish to see.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Great Beds!”
Reviews.Author: 2LHC
Reviews.Content: After two disappointing nights at Le Meridien Montparnasse, we checked into this Marriott. What a difference! The staff was friendly, helpfull and most spoke English very well. The bed was the most comfortable we'd slept in during the past two weeks and the entire hotel was very clean. Our favorite part of the hotel was the restaurant. After a full day of sightseeing it was very relaxing and fun to enjoy drinks and dinner while seated by floor to ceiling glass windows which front the sidewalk. The people watching was just as good as their food. (We had the osso buco and lamb chops...YUMMY!) The location is also good with a metro across the street and cafe's in both directions. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Chain Reaction”
Reviews.Author: Homesick_Alien
Reviews.Content: We were a little hesitant about staying in a big chain hotel in Paris at first as we had envisioned ourselves in a "boutique" Paris hotel. Of course upon researching the topic quite exetensively it turns out in most cases that boutique means overpriced, basic hotels. We were delighted with our stay in the Marriot. The service was excellent. I had requested a top floor room with a view over Paris and it was duly provided - we could see the whole way to Sacre Coeur! Unfortunately our view of the Eiffel Tower was completely obscured by a sky scraper that seemed to have been built exactly for that purpose! However if we had been maybe 15 rooms further down the corridor it would have been in full view I'm sure. Not to worry, the view was fantastic in any case. The bed was super comfortable with some patented Marriot bedding that just swallowed you up (in a good way!). The room was very spacious too. The one thing I will say is that we benefited from a special offer at the time which was 3 nights for the price of 2. It worked out at €300 for the stay, as opposed to €450 if there hadn't been a deal on which would have been out of our price range. However for €300 it was great value.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff that Gives the Lie to the French Being Rude to Americans”
Reviews.Author: Selahrs
Reviews.Content: What a delightful surprise! The staff here all spoke English and were unfailingly friendly and helpful. Not a sneer or a mote of sarcasm about silly American tourists. When my roommate found she had none of the right converters for her appliances - the staff readily made loaner transformers and converters available. The Hotel is a little far from Paris' main downtown landmarks, but I was able to walk from the Hotel to the Sorbonne without too much strain. Then there is an extensive and quintessentially French market that opens up twice a week just down the street from the Hotel. The market features fresh flowers, fresh produce, and fresh meats and seafood. Some amazing octopus eyed me from a counter. I felt as if I was seeing the "real" Paris. The Hotel rooms were spotlessly clean and comfortable. However one member of the cleaning staff oddly wouldn't hand out any extra roll of toilet tissue when we ran out. She murmurred something about not exceeding her quota. So you might want to keep a private stock handy. There aren't many brochures in the lobby offering tips about additional sight-seeing options. The Hotel concierge does readily hand out maps of the City. But the lobby staff doesn't volunteer any information about the availability of extra touring options. When some of our group members belatedly thought it might be fun to sign on for either the Moulin Rouge evening out or the Eiffel Tower lunch - the counter clerk tried to accommodate us, but found these tour options were already booked up for the duration of our stay. So you need to take the initiave yourself. Check out the few available extra-tour-option pamphlets on the lobby counter and book any tours that interest you as soon as you check into the Hotel. The included breakfast buffet was sumptuous and could be enjoyed with a bottomless cup of American-style coffee. All in all, this Marriott provided a great Hotel experience. It cured me of my "Fear of France" and the rude behavior that all the circulated stereotypes about the French had instilled in me.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with basic customer service.”
Reviews.Author: snowlover18
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 night for both business and pleasure. First thing we did when checking in was to open the blinds because the front desk agents kindly pointed out that we had received a superior city view. As soon as my 6 year old pulled the string to open the blinds, the entire rod system came crashing down. Luckily it missed her head. We let the front desk know on the way out and it was fixed when we came back a few hours later. Note that the shades are very thin and it is impossible to keep it dark after 7am when the sun comes up. No sleeping in here! I'm only rating this an average stay because I stay at many Marriotts throughout the year and for the rate you pay here, there should be a bit more service. In the event above, we were never even offered an apology for the rod system, we were just told it would be fixed, which it was. The hotel itself was nice but the service was barely basic, the concierge was not especially warm or friendly. It was very hard to get a cab at night from the front drive and there didnt seem to be enough staff. The front desk was curteous but again, very basic, no genuine welcome. The exception was the restaurant in the hotel, we dined in the fine dining portion and the service and staff was exceptional. Warm, friendly, attentive and genuine. All in all, i will probably try out a new location next time as this one did not impress me. if all fails and the rate is decent, I would consider staying here again. It was not terrible, just forgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Still My Favorite Hotel In Europe”
Reviews.Author: TravelCuties
Reviews.Content: Had a four night stay with DH, Mom, and Gram in September. The beds are still as comfortable as ever. Pick a room on the back side and use the blackout curtains and you could sleep forever. But we got up for sightseeing eventually :) The staff is fantastic - we needed a room change (note there are no family suites on the back side of the hotel as we had been told on the phone) and the manager immediately solved the issue by giving us two rooms at no extra cost and with zero hassle. The lobby bar is great for winding down after a long French dinner on the town - Mom and Gram loved sipping wine in the pod chairs. The breakfast is outrageously expensive - skip it and head for the Denfert circle - Paul has great eclairs, Indiana Cafe has inexpensive prix fix (and great happy hour in the evening), and the little market street next to Monoprix has anything you could ask for in Paris:) Learned a little more about the buses on this trip - in addition to the Metro 6 and RERB, you can use the 21 near the Glaciere metrostop and a whole series of buses at Denfert Rocherot to get all over the city. Note - there were no transfers like buses in NYC so you may need two tickets. Have a lovely time in Paris and sleep well at the Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Not in the city, but close to the subway!”
Reviews.Author: mwhfromchicago
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive about staying at this hotel based on the reviews but I am glad that I gave it a chance. The staff was helpful and recommended restaurants as well as places to visit. The staff spoke English and asked us if there was anything they could do to make the stay more pleasant. The room was a good size and the bed was comfortable. They also had an adequate gym. By the way there is only one metro line that stops near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel with Great Access to the City”
Reviews.Author: 781elephant
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Hotel Rive Gauche, has great access to the city with public transport and the room are a good size. I recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay.”
Reviews.Author: shoegalep
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two years in a row, thank you priceline! I love this hotel the staff and location. And lets just say those beds.....Ahhhh after a long day of walking around Paris heaven! Metro right outside the Door, everywhere in 15-20 min. Staff is Fab! I love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: petermartinZurich
Reviews.Content: The Marriot hotel is a dedicated conference Hotel. It is not cheap for what it brings. The rooms are not that new anymore even they upgraded the TV system. The bed was good. The rooms in general are not very big for the price of the rooms. It is also not possible to open the window. Aircondition was either hot or freezing cold. Hotel from outside very old and ugly. Conference center is good but not the newest. The stuff and Service was good. Gym is nice. It is right between two metro stations. So it is very easy to reach all the sighseeing spots as eiffel tower or notre dame.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: t-spillers
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, nice size rooms, great service. A little far from everything but the train is only about 2 blocks away. There is also a nice little restaurant on the corner that has reasonable prices and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Marriott”
Reviews.Author: mon82
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located in Paris – not far from the touristy spots of Paris but just a few stops away by the RER B. The RER B station Denfert-Rochereau is basically a walking distance from the hotel. It’s not worth it at all to jump on the Metro and then connect to the RER B. Service at the hotel was good. The coffee shop inside the hotel has some good offerings in the morning for a quick bite and coffee before you head out to work or wherever. The staff is nice and very welcoming. The Italian front desk person, who checked me in upon my arrival, remembered my name when he saw me the next day and greeted me in the lobby - the expected Marriott acknowledgment of their elite customers. My only issue is the Executive Lounge could use some more organization and quicker service. Sometimes the food was completely out in the evenings and it took them a while to replenish. There is also a girl that works there in the evening (not French) - she's not very nice. Automatically I speak French when I'm in France, and so I was asking her a question in French. Maybe she knows a lot of people that stay there aren't French, so she responded with "I'm not French, so it's better to speak English with me." I just thought that was a bit out of place. They're one-offs that happen. Otherwise, the hotel is great - no doubt it's a Marriott. Good location, quality service and very comfortable bed!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with spacious rooms, not close to the centre but close to public transport”
Reviews.Author: sweets61250
Reviews.Content: Got the hotel at a very discounted rate for Paris and stayed 5 nights with my wife. Arrived at the Charles de Gaule Airport and took the RER (train) to the Denfert-Rochereau Station and walked the 5-7 mins to the hotel, reaching there at 8 AM. Was told that the room was not ready but we should try in 2 hours. Left for breakfast and looked around the city. Back at 11.30 and got the room immediately. Location of the hotel was far from the centre (Champs Elysees or Eiffel Tower) but the connections via the Metro was very comfertable. (Paris is a big city with the attractions being spread out, it is better if your hotel is near a Metro stop) .There is a Supermarket, which shuts early, to the right of the hotel (opposite the Metro station) and a 7-11 type of a store to the left of the hotel which is open till late hours (12 / 2 at night what i remember). Few cafes for food nearby. Room was of a very good size compared to Paris. Plain and simple and nice with a King bed (as requested) with all the amenities expected being there... like safe, minibar, etc. One surprising thing was the WC was in a separate small box type of a room which was uncomfortable. And water from the shower spill all over the bathroom floor. Did not try room service. But the service at the lobby level restuarant was slow even during an uncrowded evening. The concierge service was amazing... specially Anvin / Anvil (sorry) who guided us with the sightseeings and restaurants. Would be my 1st choice of a hotel in Paris unless getting a similar hotel with similar sized rooms of similar quality and similar price closer to Champs Elysees.....a little difficult maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way”
Reviews.Author: TilaNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few nights in Paris. Denfert-Rochereau Station is one of the trainstations nearby, but I have to say, it really didnt feel safe/secure. Be wary of some people who "linger" there and ask you questions... The hotel was nice, very american feel in Paris, although it felt very removed from everything. Neighborhood seemed residential but just ok. Beds were very comfortable, had nice view of Paris. Gym was pretty good too. If this hotel was on St. Germain, it would have been perfect. If you want to get a feel for a quaint french hotel type experience this hotel isnt it for you. If I had to do it all over again, I would not stay here, good hotel, bad location.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: fabienneLondon
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Marriott Rive Gauche Hotel for 3 nights. We had a beautiful large room (with a comfy king size bed) on the 15th floor with a view on Paris, we could see the Sacre Coeur from our window. The staff was great, the hotel is nice and clean. There's a hairdresser on the 3rd floor and a gym on the first floor. We had breakfast at the hotel and used the room service many times and the food tasted good. We loved the safe area, its so close from the train stations (Denfert Rochereau, St Jacques and Glaciere). There's also a nice restaurant and Bar in the hotel and a nice pizza place down the road. Will definitely stay there again next time I go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “No personality, still dealing with mysterious credit card authorizations”
Reviews.Author: Shwiya
Reviews.Content: Granted, the woman at the reception was new and didn't know how to punch in a credit card number for a deposit without charging the card - but I am now dealing with about 4 authorizations and various transaction fees. Cleanliness in the lobby was great, but the room was not very clean. For example we found a crusty old peanut on the floor... Yuck. Location is terrible, as others have said it is a hike from anywhere you'd actually want to see in Paris. Plan on spending lots of time in the metro. This would be fine if the hotel was cheap, but you can actually find equivalent rooms/rates if you look hard enough. As for sleep quality, it would have been fine if they didn't have a flashing neon light on until 2 am every morning. If you have Marriott points and can get this for a good price, great, if not I would highly recommend you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loredana_88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It was our firs time in Paris. The hotel has a good location. One block away you can find the subway (6th lines) that in some stops reach the Tour Eiffell. We checked in with an oriental girl (i don't remember her name). She was very kind, and she gave us a very nice room, on the 11th floor with a kind bed (i love it) and a great wiev on the city. The staff at the concierge are very helpfull, expecially the thin young boy. He was very friendly. If you are planned to see the show at the Mouline Rouge, come through them. We asked at the young girl at the conciergerie, and she booked for us a table. It was G R E A T. We had a excellent wiev. The table was on the balcony, just in front of the stage, where we had the most amazing wiev of the show. The breakfast is AMAZING. There is a nice woman that cook omelette in some seconds, directly, just in front of you. It is funny. They have many many things, and all the foods is enough for breakfast and for lunch ! For dinner, we didn't stay at the hotel restaurant's but we decided to eat in that area. Just before the subway there are 3 little brasserie. We tried the one in the middle (the second after the hotel) and the last one (just in front of the subway) The price are not very expensive, and the food was delicious. The only thing that i'm dissapointed with this hotel is the market on the 1st floor. You have to pay directly by cash, and is not possible to charge in the room bill. We will come back for sure in Paris and for sure at this hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “The only bed that didn't make me miss my own!”
Reviews.Author: MommaFox
Reviews.Content: Huge Marriott that caters to American travelers. All staff speaks impeccable English. The comfiest hotel bed I've ever slept in. Restaurant downstairs was good, neighborhood has plenty of cafes. Kind of far down the metro line, BUT the stop is very close to the hotel. Small-ish room, but was more than adequate for our purposes.

Reviews.Title: “It was crazy in Paris on Bastille Day”
Reviews.Author: WoodMitas
Reviews.Content: But this hotel had a comfortable bed and air conditioning during a heat wave. Worth the hassles. Such as the hotel was packed with tourists and conventioneers. We used the Metro across the street to go all over Paris. Food in the bistro was forgettable. Skip it. We ate there on a rainy afternoon when we did not want to get wet. Wi-fi connect was obscenely expensive especially after having free wi-fi while traveling all around France. The staff was friendly but half of what they told us was not true. So beware. Double check directions and "special deals". The staff are like Afghan politicians, they must get kick-backs from all their lame recommendations and expect tourists not to notice.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline perfection”
Reviews.Author: Human44
Reviews.Content: For a $100 bid on Priceline, we could not have dreamed of a better hotel in Paris. The room was clean, quiet and spacious. And the bed was comfortable, the air conditioning kept the place temperate, and there were plenty of bakeries and cafes nearby to collect breakfast items to supplement our in room coffee and tea maker. The staff was also both pleasant and competent at what they did, in contrast to the Concorde Montparnasse where we had stayed the week before. No comparison between these two properties - the Marriott is a fine place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Papad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two kids and the hotel did not impress much. It' s a really big hotel and while the rooms are spacious and can accomodate a family of 4 (you have to get these ahead of time), a lot of other things were medicore at best. The executive lounge was so crowded that there was no place to sit for breakfast and the service appalling. The food selection throughout the day was nothing to write home about. If we were paying for this we would have been seriously disappointed. I compare it to the Zurich Marriott where we stayed a week earlier and was totally an immaculate hotel and totally orgainzed. Location was O.K. a bit far away from all the action of the city but not terribly bad. We took at 3 day Hop On, Hop Off Pass that left right accross from the Denfert Rochereau station. That turned out to be a good option. We also walked to Monteparnasse and there were many many restaurant choices available. It was not a bad walk (about 25 mins or so). Overall if my husband was not a platinum with marriott and we were not here with kids and staying on points I would skip this hotel in favor of other options.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: fusiongirl
Reviews.Content: Marriott in a lovely area with plenty of supermarkets, bakeries, and restaurants. When you leave the hotel turn right, 2 block downs on the other side of the street, there's a bakery. They have the best croissants and pain au chocolat! We stayed at this property for 3 nights and it was great! Clean and safe area! It was easy to/fro by RER from CDG airport. A 10 min walk from denfert rochereau station. Because we had a stroller, we travelled mostly on the blue line as it was mostly stepfree. Highly recommend this hotel to families with young children!

Reviews.Title: “Simply great, above expectations...Good for families.”
Reviews.Author: qb76
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 6 nights for our first holiday in Paris. Overall it was a great experience and made our trip so relaxed and enjoyable. The metro station was just 5-7 walk away and the hotel had a lot of options in terms food, super market, banks, bars etc. in the vicinity. Overall neighborhood was quite also. I booked a junior suite and it was pretty much to our expectations with separate living room and two bathrooms, very comfortable. Positives: Good service, nice bar with very friendly staff, kids friendly atmosphere and a good executive lounge where you can breakfast, evening drink & snacks for free. Few negative points: though concierge used to have 3 ppl at the desk, only one used to service ppl so queue used to be long. At times you can hear the sound of water flushing from your neighbor bathroom if you are happen to be in your bathroom as well. But these are manageable…. Overall I would like to suggest this hotel to families with kids and who want to be close to all the attraction but in a peaceful hood.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, friendly staff, okay location”
Reviews.Author: Brittany220
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early June for 3 nights. The hotel is close to two metro stops. It is located far down the metro line though, so it takes a while to get anywhere. We stayed at Marriots throughout our European vacation, and this hotel was by far the smallest. We didn't spend much time in the room though, so it didnt really bother us. The service was very good, and overall I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: ror57
Reviews.Content: From a Marriott Hotel you expect good service, nice rooms even if is also dedicated to conferences. We arrived at 3PM and the reception informed that the room is not available ! Therefore we waited for another 1,5 hours to have the room (my wife was participating to a conference that starts at 5PM that day). The room: depressing view over the air conditioning on the backyard, with walls demanding refurbishing; empty minibar!; nothing to clean the shoes; free access to the noise of the toilet and shower of your neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Cold hotel, service”
Reviews.Author: MelPai
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only because I got a good rate for the hotel. I think when I stayed it was a Renaissance and partial renovation was going on. I see now that it is a Marriott property. The staff are cold and unfriendly, they make u put down a deposit for borrowing an adapter for 30mins and there's no complimentary bottled water, something we are used to in hotels back home. The coffee shop was ok, decent buffet spread for breakfast. Overall, my experience was not great at this hotel, but I don't know whether things have improved after the renovation and rebranding.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Retailwonderer
Reviews.Content: Even with the good Trip Advisor reviews, this hotel exceeded our expectations. We were immediately impressed by the friendly and professional staff. Our attempts at speaking French seemed to be appreciated, but they usually switched to English very quickly when it became obvious that would be far more efficient. Our room was above a main street and the metro line, but almost no sound penetrated the windows. In contrast to many Paris hotels, the air conditioning worked all night and we were able to keep the room at the temperature we prefer. We had access to the Executive Lounge which provides an amazing breakfast 7 days per week, snacks and dessert in the evening, and drinks throughout the day. We were able to get reservations from the Concierge for a nearby sold out restaurant and were treated like royalty when we arrived: “Ah yes, the Marriott guests. Right this way please” as we walked past 20 people waiting for tables. There are many very good restaurants within walking distance. A metro stop and major train are within 0.4 miles, and there was always a taxi waiting out front. We will happily return here on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely comfortable Hotel with all you expect from a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: sallyann1
Reviews.Content: lovely room, large by Paris standards, very comfortable beds, lovely bathroom with hairdrier etc. Only gripe was toilet in seperate room, very small with a dim light. Was akward to get out of the toilet and into the bathroom without stubbing your toe, especially at night. Ice and cold water machine available on every floor, air con and tea and coffee facs spotless sheets on bed, in fact I cant wait to go back there!! Breakfast was great with so much to choose from you didnt know where to start. In a lovely area too right near 2 Metro Stations and loads of different restaurants to choose from each night.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: kingdom100
Reviews.Content: No one is ever going to get excited about a four star Marriott property, especially a dire 1970s concrete monstrosity such as this. The property is located close to a couple of Metro stops and is a very pleasant walk away from Notre Dame, the right bank and further afield, in short everywhere is easily accessible. Staff are efficient and deliver the right level of service for this class of property. One thing to note is that the rooms are not double-glazed, so unless you are on one of the higher floors there is quite a lot of noise from traffic in the street below. Rooms are not large, but have an ultra comfortable king sized bed, small desk area, and a rather tired yet functional bathroom. The view from the higher floors over the rooftops of Paris is rather pleasing. From a tiring day's sightseeing this hotel is very user-friendly, there is an ice/water machine on every floor and they even leave the mini-bar intentionally empty with a notice stating that it is for guests to put their own drinks/food in. This hotel's published rates are relatively reasonable, use a "secret" type web-site and it becomes a positive bargain. At the right price this hotel will offer you one of the best night's rests in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Best bed in Euro trip”
Reviews.Author: Tonybola
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Marriott from 5/18-5/21-2010. I was the best bed of six different hotels. Very convenient to Metro 6. Only three block from Denfert-Rochereau station if you are taking the RER-B from the CDG airport. Montparnasse is an area where parisians live and do all the things parisians are suppose to do in their city. Plenty of nice restaurants in the area. Got a very good deal thru Priceline NYOP ($124/night) and got a room on the 10th floor that looks just exactly as the one in the picture above. Hotel staff speaks english, which I know is a must for a lot of people, but I like to try my language skills when traveling and did not have any problems. On the way out to Amsterdam I took a taxi (13 Euros) to Gare du Nord since I had an early train departure and did not want to walk at all.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal home base for a visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: onygo12
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paris Marriott Rive Gauche for 4 nights in early June--the hotel accommodations are lovely and comfortable, the service was excellent, the staff friendly and helpful and the location most convenient to thee metro. I would not hesitate to stay here again and plan to do on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, big room in a wonderful quiet neighborhood away from the narrow crowded Paris streets.”
Reviews.Author: Brown_Samantha
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel from Priceline bidding, a great value for what we paid. We normally stay on the right bank, Opera area. This location is further from the tourist sights but in a very safe neighborhood. With a short walk to the metro station, Saint Jacques, you are connected to all attractions in Paris with ease. The rooms are spacious , clean and very quiet with comfortable beds. Super large bathroom area, a gem in Paris. We are Marriott gold card holders, so access to the executive lounge gave us free breakfast, beverages (coffee, juice, water) happy hour treats, and free Internet use. A great value!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel/location”
Reviews.Author: alaskanexile
Reviews.Content: Although we stayed at the five star Marriott on the Elysee also, my daughter and I absolutely loved this place! A very short walk to the catacombs, (a must for most teenage girls?) but also walking distance to Luxemborg Gardens, the Pantheon, The Sorbonne, and many great neighborhood bistros. Beautiful view from our room, and if you are in the executive club rooms- well worth it- the lounge was stocked morning til night- great breakfast, and at night it was almost hard to leave for the restaurants: they kept bringing out endless bottles of wine, cheese, and charcuterie- followed by dessert, all included in the room price. Clean, bustling, excellent service, free wireless, large rooms, patience with my mangled French.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: MarijanaTea
Reviews.Content: Spacious, comfortable room with a magnificient view of Paris. It's located in the near proximity of St. Jacques metro station. Professional, friendly staff. Everything was is accordance to Marriot standards. There was a special promotion 'stay 3 nights, pay 2' which was offered to us upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to explore paris”
Reviews.Author: umu
Reviews.Content: We just spent , now for the third time,four nights in this absolutely magnificent hotel . Location is further from the tourist sights but close to a very safe neighbourhood where 'real people' live with nice restaurants and shops where prices are only a fraction of 'the champs élysees' and you actually get very good value for money. With the great public transport the french have -especially the RER A from denfert -rochereau- every five minutes you are in 10 minutes in the -very busy - center of paris (notre dame, les halles ,...). The hotel itself is very new with a nice lobby and a good bar-restaurant to have a drink or a small lunch or dinner. the rooms are spacious , clean and very silent with great beds to rest after a day shopping. Breakfast is a tad expensive- especially if you don't eat a lot in the morning- but in the bar you can have a croissant , an orange juice and great coffee for 8 €. there are ice machines on every floor and a grocery shop almost next door open till 2 am if you want to have a drink in your room eg a nice bottle of champagne. thje only -minor problem-was that we had a cocktail in the bar which we both disliked and returned. -a margarita which tasted like 'no alcohol' -and the bar lady refused to do something about it and charged it anyway. but by far this is the best stay ever in paris especially if you like to avoid the hustle and bustle of 'downtown paris' and the bus loads of people.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: lilythetiger
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, the room was big, and the washroom was comfortable and new. There was a nice king sized bed with 6 pillows and a nice fluffy duvet! It was in a great location too. It was very safe to walk around the area and the hotel is located very close to two metro stations so you can easily get to any one of the attractions in Paris. The staff was extremely polite and accommodating. I will definitely stay here on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: screamingpineranch
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly, great location near metro & market, quiet, perfect bed, slow service everywhere in Paris,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: co_native29
Reviews.Content: I am a loyal Marriott customer and this hotel reminds me why. I spend the last 2 nights of my trip to France, Holland and Germany in this hotel. So by the time I arrived, I had stayed at 3 previous hotels. First the inside of the hotel is beautiful and the check in process was very easy. The hotel staff will speak to you in either French or English which was very helpful. The rooms were wonderful, there was nothing more needed, clean, nicely decorated and the most comfortable bed you will ever stay in. We only wish we had more nights so we could sleep in that bed. The locaiton of the hotel is not bad, the first 5 nights of our trip we stayed in an apartment in the 2nd arr., this was close to everything and we walked everywhere. This is a tad farther, but definitely walkable. We walked from the hotel, up to Notre Dame, to Les Halles, Louvre all in one day and back and felt fine. For those who don't want to walk as much, there is a very close subway stop that can take them closer to the sites. The area around the hotel is safe and clean with bars and restuarants in very close walking distance. I did not use the gym, but it looked wonderful. Also did not try the restaurant as 39 Euros for breakfast is a little too much, but the a la carte items seemed on par to what you would find elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff in exceptional circumstances”
Reviews.Author: Berkshire_UK
Reviews.Content: I was planning to stay at this hotel for a conference, but due to the volcanic dust cloud the conference was cancelled. As we already had bookings for the hotel, my wife and I stayed here with a coleague and his wife. The hotel staff were exceptional as they were dealing with the volcano crisis and having airlines booking rooms for their stranded passengers. They had srafted extra (non front desk personnel) to the front desk to help out. They coped very well with all the changes in everyones arrangements. The hotel is adjacent to the metro, so you can anywhere easily. You can walk to the Luxembourg Gardens and Sourbonne areas. The rooms are ok, not massive, but good enough for a city centre location. The only disappointing thing was the Exec lounge that we paid extra for (€65 per day). At the weekend, alcohol drinks are not free, and the food was basic, so really a bit of a waste of money. I understand the rules change during the week, but that time we had cancelled access to the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Paris hotel for everyone”
Reviews.Author: babymoto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I redeemed some of our Marriott points to stay here for a few nights a few days ago with our infant daughter. Having stayed at the Marriott on the Champs Elysee, this hotel was 1000x better. The room and bathroom were clean and the view was spectacular. They even had a "newer" pack-n-play already set up in our room when we arrived for our daughter. The check-in process was a breeze; the executive lounge was fully stocked and breakfast was delicious. The conceirge was great at providing directions to a food store, ATM, pharmacy, post office, and restaurant suggestions that were baby friendly. Many restaurants in Paris do not have highchairs, or can accomodate a stroller and the conceirge was able to provide multiple options within a 10 minute walk from the hotel. There was many conferences and tour groups also staying there, and the hotel was able to effortlessly handle everyone. The only downside to this hotel is its location away from the famous sights of Paris. You will need to take taxi's to get places, but found that to be a minor inconvenience compared to the hustle and bustle and party atmosphere that surround the other Paris Marriotts. We will DEFINITELY stay here again when we go to Paris again. This place was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: timesharetraveler11
Reviews.Content: Hotel is convenient to Metro to get to most sites in Paris. They upgraded me to suite even though paying with points,. The Executive Lounge had great breakfast and evening snacks available. This hotel is a great choice in Paris, less expensive than some closer to the main attractions. They French people were very helpful to us.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly, noisy, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: HC44
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a large group of colleagues (over 300), and was very disappointed. My first room was tiny, with an awful view, and was next to the service passage on my floor - which was used by staff with trolleys and loud equipment moving around all night. I moved on the second day - to a room that was obviously once a smoking room - when the hotel had still permitted smoking. It stank and paint was peeling off the walls in the toilet room. I mentioned this to the staff (who were very friendly) and they sent someone up to 'fragrance' the room. It didn't fix the problem, but I was tired of moving my things around, so I stayed. The hotel is very overpriced - the rooms are not nicely decorated, and are small, even for business travellers. Good point: the breakfasts. AMAZING. Such a great selection, all fresh and tasty - I could have spent hours there! I would not go back, and this hotel has put me off Marriott hotels. The price pays for the name, and there is no luxury at this hotel, as one may expect.

Reviews.Title: “MMMM Not up toits name”
Reviews.Author: bdenaz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last month, and unfortunately I can not express any positive impression. As from my arrival, I was not even greeted, which I felt quite rude!! And hoping this would only be a one time event. There is not much to say about the rest of the stay; the staffs were not helpful and rude sometimes, maybe it is the French style. After paying such a price for the night, the least you can expect is to feel welcomed or at least be greeted. About the room there is not much to say either, I have stayed with thMarriott quite often and I am a rewards member as well, and I think this one was one of the poorest I have had. I wanted to se the posiblility to change rooms, but no one ever paid attention to me while I was waiting at the lobby. And of course, I did not want to spend my whole say waiting. I do not think I would recommend this hotel. It is quite a pity since Marriott has always been to its best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, OK location, close to Metro stations”
Reviews.Author: Gutch2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a coach tour for two nights. While the location was not ideal for seeing the more major tourist attractions on your own it was OK if you chose to use the Metro (which we found to be quite efficient and easy to use). The check-in was OK but this was the longest wait that our Tour Director had at our tour hotels to get our room information. Having said that, longest wasn't really all that long. Room was clean, well-equipped and comfortable. The elevators are a bit odd since you have to put your room key in a slot to get them to run. I have seen this before but in these elevators there are floor buttons on both sides of the elevator but only a slot on one side. This caused considerable confusion when we first got into the elevator with a number of people. Nobody realized the slot was there and those of us on the side without the slot didn't even have a clue. Once you know it is there, it's not a problem. The layout of the room was a bit quirky in that the desk was about one foot out from the wall, couldn't be moved and wasted a lot of space. The view from our room was horrible, just the top of air conditioning units but fortunately we weren't there for the view from the room. Breakfast in the morning was excellent with a very large selection of hot and cold items including freshly made omelets and cooked-to-order eggs. As with every hotel on this tour getting coffee was difficult. After eating half my meal I finally had to go get someone to pour me a coffee and for my second cup I just went and got the carafe from the server's station. Europeans just don't realize how important coffee is to some of us from North America I guess. All in all, a nice hotel but I suspect my opinion may be slightly different if I had been paying full price for the room and the breakfast. From what I heard from a few other guests this is a pricey hotel. Then again, what hotel in Europe, especially London and Paris, isn't pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Definetly NOT a good value, and considerably lacking french traditions”
Reviews.Author: scochelle
Reviews.Content: Prior to checking in to this hotel because of the Paris marathon (someone else booked the hotel for us, so we didnt have a choice) - we stayed at the best western in the Latin Quarter. It was a quarter of the price, had free wi-fi, all-in (free drinks (non-alc), breakfast & dinner), and an awesome location. So i am judging this review on my FIRST experience to Paris. Fristly the price of a room here does NOT include internet, any type of food, and there is not any tourist attractions within walking distance that are worth going to. It is close to transit however. If you wish to use internet.. it is either 5euros for every 5 minutes.. or 20euros for 24 hours (which you can not use a portion, than use more the next day, etc).. food prices are ridiculous (18euros for a hamburger). The hotel is VERY americanized. If you are OK with that - than maybe this hotel will work.. but if your looking for french culture and traditions.. do not stay here. Personally i enjoy travelling somewhere and soaking myself with the locals, not talking to people close enough to my own home. Personally not recommended as overall not a good value.

Reviews.Title: “i liked”
Reviews.Author: Slonius
Reviews.Content: Very nice location. 3 metro station near. Room are quite small but nice. It's clean and stuff is very frendly. I think so even though I left in the room souvenir from Brussel (teddy bear) and 3 hours after my checking out the souvenir just disappeared from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best ..........”
Reviews.Author: LizzieBenet
Reviews.Content: This was probably the worst Marriott we have ever stayed in with regards to the actual room. The public areas of the hotel are nice as well as the staff, and since my husband is a Marriott gold memeber we had access to the concierge level which I can't say enough good things about. It retrospect we should have turned around and went straight back to the check-in desk to ask for a different room. The issue I had with the room was the bathroom, in particular the toilet was quite visably dirty all over outside of the seat and back part. It was very evident that it hadn't been cleaned well in some time........there was pubic hair all over the floor where you could tell they just mopped right over it. It was also apparent that at some point or over several stays that someone had vomitted because the walls in the toilet area had a lot of something splashed on them. There were also little things like holes in the bed linens and bath towels. It is a very busy hotel and I can only assume that it's because when compared to other hotels in Paris it was reasonably priced and in a fairly good location.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in the best Marriott tradition”
Reviews.Author: ronDover
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. English speaking staff made check in easy, the Concierge service was also very helpful 9and in English), rooms were large for Europe and well appointed and clean, and staff was very attentive to our needs. About the only negative was the cost of drinks at the bar which was expensive. We did not eat in the restaurant so I can't comment on this. The hotel was in a great location nearly across the street from the subway, there was a small grocery store about a block away for essentials and a few restaurants in easy walking distance. Overall it was a very positive experience and the hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “More like Ibism no way Marriott”
Reviews.Author: bvcbv
Reviews.Content: Unbeliveble for a Marriott! The room is tiny (the smallest I have ever seen for a simmilar class hotel). The same with the WC and the bathroom (they are separate). In the WC it is almost imposible to close the door while you are in: there is no space and you have to squeze between the WC and closing door. No minibar! You have a fridge but it is empty! Nothing in the bathroom or room like you would expect (except shower gel). Therefore, NO: toothpaste, slepers, bathrobe, shoe polish, etc. In 3 stars hotels you might find more of these then here. The internet is not free! The breakfast is somewhere between decent and poor. Do not expect an egg corner. The location is ok. It is close to a metro station with direct link to the Eiffel Tower, and with one change you could get to other places like Concorde, Notre Dame, etc. However, expect a total of more than 10 stops. The only good things about the hotel are: the employees - very helpfull and smiling! and the conference center - which is very big with a lot of meeting rooms, etc. Next time I go to Paris, I will either stay at Ibis for almost simmilar conditions but for EUR 80 instead of EUR 170, or pay EUR 170 for a hotel that worth this amount.

Reviews.Title: “Great room AND I've never been so insulted in my life”
Reviews.Author: emandj
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff, especially the bar staff WAS EXTREMELY RUDE. Everything at this hotel is grossly overpriced, which is unfortunately the norm in Paris. I was unpleasantly surprised since I usually like Marriotts in the states. However, I have to say the bed was very comfortable, and the location was OK. Just don't talk to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location for sightseeing in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: SarahPacatte
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent! Clean and comfortable! Easy access to the Metro and local cafes!

Reviews.Title: “Just stayed there one night prior to a Uniworld River Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Mjobryan
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and close to the train station. Would stay there again. Don't just try the Pizza Rest down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Big bed, excellent breakfasts, close to metro”
Reviews.Author: MonsieurBadger
Reviews.Content: Wife and I had two nights here over Valentine's weekend. Very easy to get to from Gare du Nord; 10 minutes on RER, then two stops east on Metro. Note that this part of the journey on the Metro is probably superfluous as, by the time you have changed lines at Denfert-Rochereau, you could probably have walked to the hotel. Note also that the hotel is midway between St Jacques and Glaciere on the Metro, and that St Jacques is presently closed. Check-in was quick and efficient. We were placed on one of the upper floors, which had extensive views, but unfortunately to the south of the hotel, where there were no landmarks of note. Room was spacious, and so was the king sized bed - it can't have been far off 6 foot wide. Toilet was separate to the bathroom, and both were clean. Approx 35 TV stations, including various English language news channels, and BBC1. Buffet breakfast was superb, with plenty of choice: fruit; cereal; cooked (sausage, bacon, tomatoes, herbed potatoes, button mushrooms, and thebest scrambled egg I have ever tasted); Swedish; croissants/pastries; pancakes; bolied eggs, fish (smoked salmon, pickled herring, peppered mackerel); yoghurts; or even ommelettes cooked to your exact specification in front of you. With many of years of travelling behind me, both business and pleasure, I can honestly say that this hotel serves the best breakfasts that I have ever had. Half hour to 40 minute walk to Notre Dame from the hotel; which did us the world of good, after the breakfasts that we had eaten! Can't really think of any downsides. Didn't bother with the wireless internet as the cost was extortionate. Oh, and make sure that you put a do-not-disturb sign on your door if you are not planning on leaving the hotel early, otherwise you will be continually disturbed by over-keen cleaners! Highly recomended, we are already starting to plan our next visit to Paris, and will almost certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Below Marriott standard in the US, but OK for Europe ... not a great base of operations”
Reviews.Author: DQC76
Reviews.Content: If you are in Paris to take in the sites & get the fell of Paris, this hotel isn't the right one for you due to location. Otherwise, the hotel was mediocre but below my expectations for a Marriott ... but then again, that has been my general experience of Marriotts in Europe Good: +rooms were recently refurbished, were reasonably modern & good condition +easy access to the metro & taxis available ... really not too far to walk (if you are fit & enjoy walking ... 30-40 minute walk to Notre Dame) +suite room was a proper size & had 2 bathrooms ... great value here +price was quite reasonable for Paris + grocery store across the street was convenient Bad: - location is really not where you want to be ... 3-5 kilometers south of the river & a good walk to anything on the south bank ... too far to walk to the Eiffel tower - service wasn't great, though i cannot put this in context of other Paris hotels - was not as clean as i would have liked ... some mold/mildew in the corners in the bathroom ... not egregious, but i expect more from a Marriott i certainly didn't do my homework before i booked, so its difficult to blame the hotel, however i just cannot recommend it & the hotel does have room to improve (even for what/where it is)

Reviews.Title: “good location - but small bedroom, below average breakfast, bad service”
Reviews.Author: b2dac
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very adjacent to Metro line 6 (Glacière) and the RER at Denfert-Rochereau which suited us as we were heading to a match at Stade de France. It takes about 30 minutes on line 6 to get to the Arc de Triomphe. We found the bedroom cramped. The bed was excellent and the room clean. The toilet cubicle, which is separate from the bathroom, is uncomfortably tiny. Breakfast was below average and was served for us in a large room with tables set for 10 such as in a billet or boarding school. For convenience, we dined in the hotel restaurant on both nights. Food is average. The first night service was friendly and good: the second night service was bad. Service at the café in the lobby beside the restaurant was appallingly slow and inefficient. Bar prices were high. This hotel suited us this time but it has no character or special feature that will attract us another time

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, great service”
Reviews.Author: BienVago
Reviews.Content: Good service. I was impressed with the number of restaurants within walking distance from the property. The Metro stations is close. The food at the restaurants on the ground floor are quite nice. Don't use the concierge for "booking" trips, go on-line and book yourself and save at least half (in particular, river dinner cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: lrcalliope
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Even thought it is outside the major tourist areas, it's a very short walk from the metro. We were very impressed with the level of customer service. The room was spacious and very, very clean. We will definitely stay at the Rive Gauche on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and worth the extra money and travel time”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Fiend_007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights between Christmas and New Years Day. It was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at in Europe. Location: Located near St. Jacques (5 min walk) and Denfert-Rochereau (10 min walk) metro stations, it is very easy to get to this hotel from either Airport and to and from the city center. Paris has great public transportation, why not use it? There are a few restaurants in the area and the hotel's restaurant is great. It may seem expensive, but go out a few nights and one will see that it is on par with the rest of Paris. There is a great Pastry place about 10min (left out of hotel, make 2nd left - walk away from St. Jacques station and you will run into it.) They have amazing food! There is also an Ed market and other restaurants near Denfert-Rochereau. Try Chez Papa about 15-20min from the Hotel. Best food I had in Paris! Room: Very big for Europe. Had a king-sized bed that was very comfortable. TV with many different languages (but who goes to Paris to watch TV). All the amenities one would expect from a Marriott. Ice machine on every floor. Yes, ice machines! Staff: Extremely friendly and helpful. 24 hour open cafe downstairs and friendly people that speak English. But, be polite and try your French first. Parking: Did not use it, but there is parking available. Only Cons I can think of: doormen were pretty useless and the internet was very expensive. Overall - try it out. If you are looking for something in the 14 Arrd, this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely best service in Paris...”
Reviews.Author: RobbertS
Reviews.Content: On arrival in this hotel very early in the morning we could directly go to our rooms which were ready and clean. The Junior Suites in this hotel are absolutely incredible! A separate living- and bed room, and 2 bathrooms. The staff is all over the hotel the best I ever experienced in Paris, they did everything their guests requested to make sure their stay would be even better. Breakfast in the restaurant had plenty of choice between cold en warm foods. Only little minus is the location, it is located in the southern part of the city, but of course with taxi or subway one can reach anything in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: EUTravellerZurich
Reviews.Content: Good location for the hotel. But not my favorite in terms of the type of room. Had feeling that the room was very old and wasnt maintained well even though the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it for a nice way to see Paris at a great price”
Reviews.Author: nora1fenton2
Reviews.Content: With the metro right out the front door and some restaurants in the neighborhood we got to see all of Paris for 5 wonderful days at a clean, modern and very functional hotel for a price we could not find any where else that had a name brand attached to it. The staff took the time to be very helpful and the concierge planned every detail of our trip twice, once before we arrived and then again after we checked in as some things had changed before we got there One note of caution, watch out for the slippery bathroom floors. For some reason they installed only 1/2 a shower door and the water just flies all over the bathroom floor. They have a drain in the floor so the water does eventually flow out but right when you are stepping out of the shower it is like ice and if you put a bath mat down so you don't slip you step on to a sopping wet mat.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Paris”
Reviews.Author: A_VK123
Reviews.Content: Marriott, Paris, Jun07 This was my first trip to Paris alongwith my family. A wonderful experience at Marriott made the stay enjoyable for my kid too. The hotel is very well maintained and service is great. Their staff is extremely helpful and ready to guide and advise a new tourist in the city. The help us plan our two day stay to be able to cover all the sight seeing and keeping in mind my child's need to visit the Disney World. Its a great place and lovely people!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Practical True Marriott Standards in semi-suburbs of Paris”
Reviews.Author: JohnChiongLuke
Reviews.Content: This is a great and comfortable 4 star hotel~ you have the modern signature marriott fixtures with the fluffy towels, amazing bed, nice bathrooms, polite service, plush carpets, great gym, right down to the marriott colours of the bedspreads and philips brand of LCD tv...
