However, if you're looking for chi-chi or the oh-la-la of paris, you won't find it here.. no big french windows that open up to a quaint parisian street or garden courtyard.. in fact the windows don't open at all and the view, although up high and is of nice open sky, overlooks a big street with the commuter train line running in the middle.. if you want to be seduced by Paris' charms of freshly baked croissants in a corner boulangerie or pâtisserie, you won't find it here.. there are some nearby convenience stores and the odd smaterring of shops, cafes and a supermarket but it is mostly residential with local housing apartments... Hence, if you're bidding on Priceline and have your heart set on the romance of the narrow winding streets of Latin Quarter, you may find yourself here on a USD110 4 star St Germain - Latin Quarter - Montparnasse bid. It's terrific value for the money of course - just may not be for young couples looking for romance and adventure. To be fair, the Glaciere metro sta is merely steps away.. and you can connect to everywhere within the extensive metro network.. however it is Denfert-rochereau sta (about 10 mins walk) which is the blockbuster connection with metro, RER, ORLY buses etc.. there's a square here with a more cosmopolitan flair and a shopping street with fresh produce on the side.. if you like to walk and explore.. well you'll be disappointed.. until u get to Rue Mouffetard.. abt 20-25 mins away north-east...

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Bart_2009
Reviews.Content: We had an executive room: great beds, great airco, everything you need. This type of room also grants access to the executive lounge - a self service where you can get snacks and drinks. Not cheap (209€) but value for money !

Reviews.Title: “Best Christmas Ever!”
Reviews.Author: fitgator
Reviews.Content: Santa had a big bag for this one. This hotel, although not in the city center is absolutely perfect. From check-in to check-out, every detail was taken care of. From Charles de Gaulle (Rossy) take the B train to the Denfert Rocheau station and take the M6 which will drop you practically across the hotel. The trip lasts 45 minutes to an hour and costs a mere 8.50 euros. The concierges were the friendliest ever and they are so eager to point you in the right direction. Buy your tickets there for The Louvre and the Eiffel tower and avoid the long lines. They have a phenomenal, above average and frankly one of the best fitness facilities I have worked out in a hotel. I highly recommend burning some of the calories consumed eating French food at the fitness facility. There are two supermarkets within walking distance from the hotel. A little one two blocks away to the right of the hotel and a larger Monoprix further out on that direction as well. There is an italian restaurant that is decent to the right and a French one a block away on the left towards the train station. This hotel is Marriott at its best. Highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Bachacookies
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for our 2nd week in Paris because it required less Marriott "point's" than the two other Marriotts in the city, therefore this review does not address price. I was a little apprehensive about the location because it's in the 14 arrondissement which is on the outter fringe of the inner city. No need to worry. The Glaciere stop of the METRO is less than 2 city blocks to the right. The METRO will take you within a block of any place you want to go. The trains come every 3 minutes, just be cautious of pickpockets. Teenage gypsy gangs make a living ripping off tourists that way. The Hotel was what you would expect here in the US. We had a large room with two queen beds. The bathroom was also large and every modern; beautiful lobby, nice restaurant. I would deffinately stay there again but we are an older couple and were not interested in the Paris night life. We were there to sightsee during the day. A young couple may be more interested in staying closer to the action near the Seine. Paris is an expensive city and the exchange rate for the US dollar adds about 60% to the cost of everything. If you sit at a sidewalk cafe and order to 16oz beers it will cost you $35.00. Be prepared and enjoy the architectual wonders of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff... and Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: granviajerodelmundo
Reviews.Content: The Rive Gauche, although a ways outside of the touristy section of Paris, is an exceptional property. The Hotel is situated in a fairly quiet residential area, but there are plenty of restaurants and bars right outside the hotel. The nearest metro station is just steps away, making it easier to get around than some downtown Paris hotels. The entire staff we met while at the hotel was great, from the check-in clerk to the housekeeping staff. The rooms are standard American sized rooms, with comfy beds and large bathrooms. We were on the top floor with an amazing view of the city out a large floor-to-ceiling window... def ask for a high floor!

Reviews.Title: “a great find in paris”
Reviews.Author: francisBelgium
Reviews.Content: As we go regularly to paris we really had a true find in this hotel in a residential neighbourhood in paris. Location is NOT in the center of paris but in a quiet non touristic very safe neighbourhood , so you absolutely need to use rer or metro transportation which is very convenient ; you are about ten minutes from the city center . there are very fine typical 'marriott rooms' of very good size especially for paris, nice bathrooms and separate restrooms. bedding is absolutely great ,rooms are silent and can be made absolutely dark with a screen. breakfast has a vast and fresh selection. staff is very friendly . On the marriott website we had a very good rate , especially for paris , where you pay more for a low class hotel with lousy beds and tiny rooms which is more centrally located. Bar and restaurant are very elegant and offer good quality of food at a very reasonable price. So if you don't mind travelling half an hour a day with an excellent and cheap public transportation system this is really a great find.

Reviews.Title: “3 months in Paris”
Reviews.Author: speedster351
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from August till November 2009 through the summer and fall which is a great time to be in Paris! It is nicely situated on the Left Bank in the 14th district. Most of the staff was fantastic and became more like family after almost 3 months. The executive lounge on the 3rd floor which was managed and ran by Liz were friendly, very gracious and generous. The front desk crew and "at your service" teams were very friendly and accommodating the entire time we were working in Paris. The rooms were nicely appointed with decent views of Paris. I had a two room suite with a separate living room area and a large flat screen in both rooms and I highly recommend that arrangement if your budget will allow. Easy access to the Orly Airport via the Orly bus that comes every 10-15 minutes and stops right out front of the hotel and will have you at the airport within approx. 20 minutes and 3 stops. CDG can be had easily from the RER B train at stop "Denfert Rochereau" which is a approx. 7 minute walk from the hotel or you can connect from the M6 at "Glaciere" and go two stops to "Denfert Rochereau". The train ride from CDG is approx. 45 minutes and will cost you $8.50 Euro and the Metro will be $1.70 Euro one way compared to a taxi ride of $50 Euro. The M6 is located right outside the hotel, but you won't really hear the metro but on occasions. The M6 is fantastic and will take you directly to the Eiffel Tower at "Bir-Hakeim" stop and then you can continue till the M6 ends at the Arc de Triomphe which is at station "Charles de Gaulle Etolle". This station will leave you at the upper end of the Champs Elysees within a block of the Louis Vuitton flagship store. The M1 runs down the Champs right pass the Louvre then you can take it to the "Nation" which is at the other end of the M6. This will complete a loop of Paris and you can get back on the M6 to the hotel. Off the M6 is stop "Place de Italle" which is only two stops from the hotel and has a large modern shopping mall with a large Carrefour for food shopping. I would also highly recommend, we ate there at least once a week, "Villa St.Jacques" which is a GREAT Italian place one very, very short block from the hotel. Ask for "Eddie" the restaurants proprietor. He is funny, speaks good English and will treat you like family. All the food is excellent especially the Lasagna!

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience.”
Reviews.Author: marisilvia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Rive Guache for 3 nights in November 2009. The room was lovely and very clean, Paris view from the 4th floor, breakfast is just lovely, buffet style. My daughter totally loved the swivelling red round chairs in the bar area, by the restaurant on the ground floor. Just two complaints: you can not open windows in the hotel, which is for health and safety, but does not help air ventilation. And my daugher fell asleep before my room service arrived the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull hotel in gr8 location Best Consiarge Ever”
Reviews.Author: Kuminda
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel, with easy acccess to two Metro stations, plenty of resturents around and the best beds we've had in our trip. We ware lucky to get a special price based on a promotion. Otherwise we would not have considered this hotel. (Three nights for the price of two). Hotel is little out of the way, close to city limits of Paris. However, this does not compromise the accesbility. We've returned to hotel after our late night visits around 11.30/12.00 midnight and had no problem in catching a Metro. Best experience is the Gentleman that was in the Consiarge. I must have seen so many hotels in my life, But this gentleman in the consiarge is the best ever me. He was very considerate of a small accident my wife had and went out of the way to help us. I am sure that many other people in the hotel can learn a lesson or two from that gentlman. Sorry I cannot remember his name. The rooms ware large, with ample space and with wonderfull facilities. As usual we had an issue with the Bathroom as the shower is not properly covered. We endup spilling water all over the bathroom. however that is a very mnor detail that we could ignore. We liked the breakfast , However, it is little on the expesive side. (Two options available as cheaper options are without any warm food, hence we are forced to take the more expensive option) One other miner point is the lack of free channels in the telvision. Since no decent channel is available, visitors are forced to purchase expensive pay per view options. We would definealy go back and recommend this hotel to any other person.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind travelling the metro while in Paris, this is a great place”
Reviews.Author: flyingquant
Reviews.Content: If I go to Paris for the weekend and I need to stay in a hotel, I always go for Paris Marriott Rive Gauche Hotel. When you walk into the building you're greeted by friendly and experienced staff all around. The lobby looks great and the rooms are spacious. I'm always pleased when I'm there. As it is a little out of the city center you'll have to commute via metro or taxi. As a result of this, the room rate on the weekend are much lower than they are during the week. If you're on a budget but don't want to give up the benefits of a nice hotel try this place, other wise grab a hotel on the Champs Elysees if you don't mind spashing out.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: SouthernTrifecta
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Rive Gauche was an outstanding choice for our first time in Paris. As Americans we had heard horror stories about the parisians, but our experience was first rate and the staff at the hotel deserve high marks for patience, helpfulness and courtesy. The hotel is located in the 14th district and well situated between two metro stations. The restaurants in the hotel were superior in their service with the breakfast being the best bargain for quality and costs. At night there are several brasseries nearby, several of which offer different types of italian food - which for us proved a God send as we did not love the french food. That said, the wine was excellent, and the hotel comp'd us an excellent bottle as it was our anniversary. They also com'p our parking. We did not request either of these courtesies. The bed was not only the best hotel mattress I ever slept on, it was the best bed I ever slept on - period. My wife readily agreed. There is an exercise salon and several other perks in the hotel. Security is excellent and we were impressed with the cleanliness of the building and the attention to detail given by the clenaing crew. There is a pharmacy and grocery within walking distance and you can get anywhere in town on the metro in less than 25 minutes. The hotel attracts lots of international travelers and we witnessed several flight crews from American, Iberia and other airlines. Almost everyone employed at the hotel speaks english and is ready to assist.

Reviews.Title: “American Hotel in Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: Timandpenplusten
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room for 3 nights off priceline.com. I payed for 2 nights and received the third night free. but generally the rooms are pricey for a Marriott. The hotel is located in between Saint-Jacques and Glaciere metro stations on the number 6 line in the 14th arrondissement . The staff was great and the concierge was extremely helpful. The room was large for European standards. Bathroom had a large tub. Room had an iron which is pretty rare in European hotels. We didn't eat at the restaurant but it looked pretty good. The only downside to the whole stay was the ridiculously priced internet access. They charge 10 Euro for 15 minutes, and 30 Euro for an all day pass. I thought that was insane when you can go to a cyber cafe and pay 1 Euro for 1 Hour. Overall this hotel is nice but a bit pricey for what it offers but it is centrally located

Reviews.Title: “Its a Marriott....”
Reviews.Author: Wicklowlass
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for my 30th Birthday my husband had arranged it. We contacted the hotel and asked for an early check in and a large spacious room with a view after reading reviews on TA We landed at 8.50am with Ryanair in Beauvais, after bus ride and 2 metro rides we arrived in the Marriott Rive Gauche at approx 11.15. Our room wasnt ready, we could have accepted a room on the lower floor but opted to wait. The receptionist was very pleasant and informative. We found the metro Glaciere station very easy to use and was on the direct line to Tour Eiffel which took about 10-15 mins. We came back around 4.30pm and checked into our room, we were given a room on the 11th floor. It was average size, view was ok. Looking out onto the metro and city. There was no welcome card or enjoy your stay even though my husband emailed them in advance, (have done this in previous Marriotts and a welcome card or message on the tele). On the first morning house keeping walked in while my husband was in the shower! Second morning they came in again at 8.15am! I know we should have but up the do not disturb sign but who checks outs at 8.15am and if they do the house keeping should check with the receptionist to see if they have settled the bill!) This annoyed us alot. There is a Mc Donalds out to the left of the hotel top of the road, also a Boulangerie and a supermarket again to the left of the hotel and then 2nd left, bought our croissants here, yum. If its your first time in Paris like it was ours I would recommend two things - we did the bike tour, fat tire bike tour thoroughly enjoyed it. Also went up to Sacré Coeur walked around Montmartre, really beautiful. We didnt eat in the hotel dined in the city both nights, Alcazar and La Taverne du Sergente Recruteur in Isle st Louis. On check out on Sunday the receptionist didnt ask if we enjoyed our stay, just took the money and said goodbye, which I thought was rude, he just seemed to be more interested in serving the next customer. One tip...dont order a large coke in the cafes, we were charged €12.10!!! Ouch....near Notre Dame I would recommend this hotel to a friend

Reviews.Title: “good location for public transportation, spacious rooms, helpful staff, bathroom could be cleaner”
Reviews.Author: baianamomma
Reviews.Content: We had paris visite passes (access to all public transport) so this was a great location. The hotel is a couple blocks either way from metro stops. Its about 4 blocks from another major metro station with several lines and a train. Its just a quick 7-8 minute ride to the right bank. The 68 bus stop also was great as it went straight past major attractions. The hotel has pharmacies, 2 groceries, and a laundrymat close by. The Bon Marche was about a mile away. There is a precious market street (Rue Laguerre) just a short walk away with a marvelous cheese shop that will vacuum pack cheese for bringing home. I cant remark much on value as we scored a deal on travelocity after our apartment reservation was cancelled the day before we arrived. What we paid would not have gotten us much anywhere else. It was nice to have the extra space from a american-style hotel versus a small room typical of european hotels (we travelled with a baby). My only complaint was the bathroom. For a 4 star hotel, the bathroom could have been cleaner. There was a bit of mold and mildew.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel outside center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: peace_n_love18
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is a very english/US friendly hotel in Paris. It felt like we were in a US hotel and it is VERY close to two metro stops and only a few blocks from the RER stop from the airport or to Versailles. The rooms are considerably larger than a typical Parisian hotel. There are water/ice machines by the elevator with cups so you can grab some ice water, which was nice after a day of walking in the city. I would recommend this hotel to someone who is not yet ready to experience a true Parisian hotel or speaks only a little French as everyone spoke English. Also, by the RER stop there are a lot of restaurants and shopping that we didn't see until our last day. Until we saw these we didn't think we had many options for food, but were wrong. There is a grocery store across the street to pick up a few items to keep in your fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: JLiss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott in Sept 2009 for 2 nights while passing through Paris, and would recommend this hotel highly. As other reviewers have mentioned, the location is perhaps not ideal for tourists who do not want to deal with public transport, but we found it to be very convenient, walking distance to the RER (which we took to and from CDG airport, saving a lot of $$ vs. taxis), and a short walk to one of two metro stations (which made it easy to get all over the city). As my husband and I had to do work while we were there, the one drawback to the hotel, we found, is the lack of free internet (the hotel charges a rather high fee). Because of this, we spent time (hate to admit it!) in the nearby McDonalds, using their free WiFi! It seems like the Marriott could offer this key service to their guests (many of whom are on business), at little cost to their bottom line. One thing I want to mention specifically is how helpful the staff were to us, as we realized too late (on the train, almost having arrived at CDG airport) after checking out, that we had left a passport and other key items in the safe in our room. One phone call had the front desk staff quickly on the case, retrieving the items from our room, and making plans to get these to us by taxi to the airport. A couple of phone calls later, this was all arranged, and the items showed up as promised in the taxi, allowing to make our flight, and saving our vacation! THANKS to the wonderful front desk, concierge, and security staff (unfortunately, I do not recall their names) who helped us that day (Sept 11)! We appreciated it greatly, and hope to return to your hotel in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay - exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: yankeegirl125
Reviews.Content: I recently got back from a 6 night stay at the Marriott Rive Gauche. My husband was there for a conference and I was there to tag along and stay. After reading reviews on the hotel, I went there thinking that it would be just an OK hotel, but I was wrong! While the price to stay at this hotel per night is quite steep, you really are getting everything that you paid for. The stay at the Marriott was fantastic. Not only was the room HUGE on European standards, it was big for an American hotel too (which is what we're used to.) The bed was VERY comfortable! The bathroom was very spacious too - the toilet was in a separate room and the half-glass shower didn't pose any kinds of problems (the water pressure was really good too.) The decor of the hotel was very modern and trendy in the common areas. The neighborhood surrounding the hotel was lovely - very residential but walking distance (within 5 minutes) to 3 Metro stops. The service at the hotel was great too - concierge, front desk, housekeeping, bar/restaurant staff, etc. I thought that it was unfortunate to stay farther away from the big attractions and areas of Paris, but I was surprised to find out that it was great to be away from the hustle and bustle of the city - the hotel offered a quiet "getaway" feeling from the hectic parts. We also went to the hotel bar every night for drinks - I can safely say that it was one of the nicest hotel bars I've ever been to. If I had to think of any negatives about the hotel - I would have to say it was the price for Internet - it was 19.95 Euro per day. But if that's the only bad thing I can think of, I would say all in all it was a great experience. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone - if I am lucky enough to come back to Paris, I will certainly be staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon stay”
Reviews.Author: DennisKeya
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful stay and was even upgraded as part of my honeymoon stay. Quality service and rooms very clean with good view of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: gudu22
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is in the quiet region of Paris but convenient from most tourist sites and CDG airport via RER B3. This is the only hotel I think deserved 4-star during my two weeks trip in Europe. Room is not spacious but enough for two comfortable double beds. It is clean and quiet although the view is not good, no complains considering the price bid from priceline. Front desk is professional and English-speaking. This is mainly a business hotel. Most of people dress in black suits and you can also see airline pilots.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and great value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: PoorKia
Reviews.Content: Would stay here again if I was in Paris. Staff offered sound advice on Paris. Rooms were clean and well furnished. Hotel is right beside a metro station and we found it to be a great base for the city. Great fitness centre. No swimming pool is the only minor issue. Overall recommended though

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience All Around”
Reviews.Author: IA_FARMBOY
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights on a getaway when I was working in Brussels. The accommodations were awesome. The beds were comfortable and the staff was very nice and helpful when inquiring about restaurants and sites to see. We had a group and they gave us adjoining rooms even though we'd booked through priceline. Overall it was a great place to stay and the restaurant in the hotel was quite good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good hotel, petit rooms, very low ceilings”
Reviews.Author: Roel2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Marriot over the past weekend. Overall, our stay was satisfactory. The hotel staff is great, helpfull and friendly. We have had only good experiences with the front desk, concierge and bell staff. Hotel location is fine, just a few minutes from two stations on the 6 line. If you decide to walk downtown, it's a 25 minute walk to the Latin quarter. Using the metro, you can be everywhere within 15 minutes. As for nearby restaurants, we had dinner at L'Ourcine on saturday, a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Do ask the concierge to call and make reservations as far in advance as possible, as this place is always filled up, probably because Michelin put it on their "Bid Gourmand" list. There is a small 7-11 style convenience store in the direction of the St Jacques metro station which is open at night. I do however have a few remarks about the hotel. We decided to have breakfast at the hotel on sunday. The breakfast was ok. However, you have to choose between three different buffets when you enter the breakfast restaurant. There is a EUR 14, EUR 19 and EUR 24 selection. The more expensive breakfasts include more items. For EUR 14 you get just coffee, bread, butter, some pastries and jam, and for EUR 24 everything is included. However, there is just one buffet, and you are expected to only eat items included in your breakfast selection. As there is no reference whatsoever as to what is included in your selection after you have entered the restaurant this can get a bit confusing. It left us wondering wether we were allowed to take a glass of orange juice, or a slice of cheese. Why not just a single, flat-fee buffet for a reasonable price, say EUR 15? That would probably lead to more guests buying breakfast, making the buffet more cost efficient and making everyone happy. Housekeeping could do a better job. We found an empty minibar-style bottle of alcohol on the floor in our room, under the chair. As this hotel does no longer stock their minibars it left me wondering how long that bottle has been there. We had some mold in the bathroom, especially in corners on the tiling around the bathtub. A more important remark concerns the ceiling height in the (public) hallways and in the bathroom. This hotel has installed false ceilings that limit the free height in the public hallways to just 2 meters, which can get very claustrofobic, especially if you are tall. Furthermore, the sprinklers stick out from the ceiling a few centimeters, which put them in a position were I could have actually walked in to them, probably causing a nasty head wound. Fortunately, that did not happen. And I am just 1.96m in length, which is not extremely tall and fairly common. In the rooms the false ceilings are used in both the hallway area, which is common and no problem, but this hotel has also put a false ceiling in the bathroom, limiting the height to 2 meters. I could therefore not stand upright in the bathtub/shower area (which was a few centimeters above the floor) without pushing up on the ceiling plates with my head and looking straight into the ducting area above. Not very comfortable for showering as you can imagine. I ended up showering while sitting on my knees in the bathtub. Pretty uncomfortable. I find it hard to believe that these low ceilings, especially those in the public hallways, are actually permitted under current french building codes. I was under the impression that building codes and safety regulations in the EU were pretty much standardized through the Eurocodes building codes program. In the Netherlands for example, in a highrise hotel building like this, fire escape routes, which the public hallways are, would need to have a minimum free height of 2m30. Public hallways which are not part of the fire escape routes would need at least 2.1 meters of free height. 2 meters is just not enough and having sprinklers stick out of the ceiling lowers it to under 1.95, leading to an unsafe situation for taller people. Imagine having to evacuate your room in an emergency situation through a smoke filled hallway where sharp, pointy sprinklers are sticking out of the low ceiling at forehead height, invisible due to the smoke. I would have almost certainly ran into them, causing head injury. In such a situation, an event like that could leave you incapacitated or desorientated and could therefore easily turn out to be deadly. I would like to urge this hotel to check building codes and raise the height of the false ceilings and sprinklers in all public spaces accordingly. My final remark is about the Internet service, which is pretty expensive. I can not judge on the connection speed or quality. However, It still amazes me to see that hotels like this continue to charge excessive rates for a commodity like an Internet connection in this day and age. Why noy offer free wireless in the lobby and charge a small, nominal fee to use the wired connection in the room?

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal hotel and experience!”
Reviews.Author: patai12
Reviews.Content: First off, since I am about to write a gushing review, I should mention that I have no connection whatsoever to the Marriott Corporation. Second I would like to say that we absolutely loved this hotel and wholeheartedly recommend it to business or leisure travelers. We stayed in room #1619 - on the southward facing side of the building. The room ROCKED! While others have mentioned that the even-numbered rooms have a better view of Paris (which is true), there are approximately eight rooms on each floor on the odd numbered side in a "bump out" part of the building that are significantly larger than the other rooms we saw (we looked at several, out of curiosity). Our room was absolutely pristine. It was newly renovated and featured a supremely comfortable bed, bedding and pillows (the mattress was as comfortable as our $4,000 one at home). There was a "black out" screen for the window that when closed left the room virtually pitch dark - perfect for tourists from California needing deep sleep in the middle of the day. The air conditioning system was excellent: quiet yet effective and without blowing cold air on your face all night. We slept better in this room than we have in the past several years in any other room, at home or on the road. The bathroom was spectacular. Indeed, as others have mentioned, they do have those odd swinging glass doors that only cover about 2/3 of the tub length - leaving water to spray all over the floor. (Can anyone explain the logic of this design choice?) Having a fridge in the room was an excellent addition - though it was small it served its purpose: keeping our perishables nice and cold. The desk and desk chair were very comfortable. The flat screen tv was large and produced a clean, clear image. The English language options were a bit limited, but hey, how much time should you spend watching tv when you are in Paris? Then again, watching Russian language programming had its own unique entertainment value. The lobby was beautiful with lovely off-white tile on the floor, and it was also immaculately clean - as were the carpets in the hallways and pretty much every surface you could find in the hotel. We didn't spend much time in the bar, but one night they had a large group of people swing dancing. It seemed a lively place, newly decorated in a hip 1960's theme. The fitness center was free for guests and was also newly renovated (and immaculate). They also have a yoga/pilates studio - though I presume there is a charge for group classes. The hotel staff were all professional, helpful and friendly (which was especially refreshing as the stereotype about French service workers being rude is generally true). Georgina, one of the front desk workers was particularly pleasant and helpful. While the hotel is in a residential area, it takes only 2 minutes to walk to the Metro station and you can get to almost any of the main tourist spots in the city within 10-15 minutes (if you miss a train you can be sure the next one will arrive within about 3 minutes or so). The only negatives I can think of relates to the cost of various "elective" services which we found to be rather expensive, namely: the hotel breakfast, room service, laundry service, internet and premium tv channels. In short, we loved the hotel and can't recommend it highly enough. The Marriott got this one right!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpful staff, stunning hotel, wonderful place to kick back and relax!”
Reviews.Author: dolldede1
Reviews.Content: My daughter (19) and I went to Paris for her graduation trip. We were there from May 6-May 21, 2009. This hotel was absolutely wonderful! The rooms are very spacious (which I understand is rare in Paris), the staff was extremely helpful, and even the food service was delicious (They have the best cheeseburger in Paris). The beds were wonderful, like sleeping on clouds! After a LONG day with tons of walking in Paris, it was wonderful to come back to the room and collapse into the bed and order room service. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that can afford it. We spent a couple of nights at a different hotel (much cheaper) and discovered that in Paris...you get what you pay for. When I go back to Paris I will definitely book the entire trip at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Houston2Paris
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Paris Marriot Rive. Large rooms, large bathrooms. The beds were heavenly! I travel to Paris quaterly for business and will never stay anywhere else for now on!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: BMWEIFW
Reviews.Content: While the hotel wasn't in a Paris hotspot it is near two metro stops which made sight seeing quite easy. Rooms were more American than European in size. The hotel staff members were all nice & helpful (and spoke English). Also, it is near the best bakery we have ever visited- Le Pain au Natural

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuvzTennis
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Paris and a 3 night stay at the Marriott Rive Gauche. Perfect in everyway. Clean, great mattress, modern bathroom, close to 2 metro stations. My advice is turn left when you leave the hotel. One block to the left are many restaurants . The first day we kept going to the right and not much there. We prearranged before leaving home the Parisshuttle for 80 Euro prepaid. DO NOT USE THEM!!!! They were to meet us with a sign with our name when you left customs. No one was waiting there. After a long overnight flight we were exhausted and kept calling and given different excuses each time. Our flight landed at 9:00 a.m. and we were not picked up until 10:45 a.m. They have your money so they know you will wait. Back to the Marriott- it was great they let us check in early and our room was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: dhclean
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. Accomodations were great. Staff was very helpful and friendly. There was a small store, gift shoppe and nice restaurants. As usual things are expensive, but that is to be expected. If you are brave enough to use the subways, and we were, it is just across the street so very convenient. On weekdays there is an sidewalk market place that is absolutely fabulous, just a short walk from the hotel, to the right as you exit. The rooms and beds were so comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel and would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “massive hotel with a personal touch”
Reviews.Author: leipzig9
Reviews.Content: Great attention in the reception area and from Valerie in guest relations! The rooms were very spacious and in general the hotel was recently refurbished. The bar is very nice, close to train station. Although is not in the middle of champs ellysees, you can get some great rates!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: CJSToronto
Reviews.Content: You can always count on getting a nice hotel when you stay at a Marriott. The only problem with this hotel is that is is a little far from any of the main areas in Paris. There are subway stops within 5 mins of the hotel but would still be better to stay closer to the city.

Reviews.Title: “poor service lets it down”
Reviews.Author: Clon11
Reviews.Content: good location for a Parisian city centre hotel. Poor check in, taking over 15 minutes in a business hotel is a poor service record. check in staff was advising tourists on tourist spots when at concierge there were 3 staff joking with each other. signage within hotel was poor, and none talong the very generic corridors on room floors to point you to the lifts. Lifts were slow and noisy, and after waiting for 10 minutes with 2 full lifts passing by, I chose to walk the stairs for efficiency! The linking corridor between hotel and conference centre was not obvious. I was given a room overlooking the roof of the conference centre, so my curtains were drawn all day - simply no point to look outside the window. check out was equally (un)impressive, 25 minutes queueing and it took over 10 minutes for staff to find the stapler (there was one on each desk, but it seemed only 1 worked among 4 desks!) and gave me my receipt. food was passable, but it took 45 minutes to serve 20 people the same main course, a huge logistic issue in the kitchen, so we opted for buffet instead on day 2 with much better results. Not an efficient business hotel. drinks prices in the bar was very much over the odds for reasonable fare, and their mojitos was very poor. Food at breakfast was reasonable but it was a slow coffee service, and even if breakfast was included, we still had to sign a check before you are allowed into the room-the usual surly receptionist attitude must change! one of the worst Marriott I have been in, and won't go back for that level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Paris Experience”
Reviews.Author: Lois611
Reviews.Content: As a Marriott Rewards member, we used a lot of points to book 7 nights in a King Champagne Suite and an adjoining Executive room for another family member. Both rooms were reasonably large (473 sq. ft & 237 sq. ft) for a Paris hotel. The suite had 2 sofas and a large cocktail table in the living room so we could relax after our busy days. The hotel is very standard Marriott so you don't really feel like you are in Paris. However, we knew that before booking. We were in Paris for the sights and excitement of the city and knew we'd come back to a comfortable room and a good night's sleep. Pros: Executive Lounge had a nice breakfast (croissants, breads, cereals, meat, cheese, fruit) on the weekdays. On weekends, they serve a hot/cold buffet breakfast in the dining room. They even make fresh omelets. The rooms were fresh and clean with nice Marriott bedding. Maid service was prompt and efficient. As a Marriott Silver member, we had free wifi. Just had to call every day for a password. Lots of closet and shelf space in both rooms. Close to Metro and taxis were always waiting outside. The location is a distance from the main tourist areas, so it was nice and quiet. They have a beauty salon in the hotel which allowed us to book services conveniently. Good hairdressers and reasonable prices. Cons: Front desk was inadequately staffed all the time. Many airline personnel stayed while we were there and they came in large groups. Lines were long and slow. Concierge desk was always busy and the people were not very knowledgeable about restaurants or shows. We found some great places to eat ourselves using the internet and Tripadvisor. Restaurant menu at the hotel was "adequate" - not much variety. Prices were ok.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel. VERY comfortable bed. great stay.”
Reviews.Author: cherylsmith30
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. On checking-in to hotel staff were very friendly and spoke great english. Room very clean. Very comfortable bed. There was an empty fridge in room which was far better than a mini-bar. The location was good. We got the RER train from charles de gualle airport to defert-rochereau station which is about a 5 minute walk from hotel. It is also has 2 metro stations very close by that connect directly to eiffel tower. The catacombs is a 5 minute walk away. There was a small shop near the hotel which was handy for filling up the fridge. McDonalds is a 5-10 minute walk. All attractions in paris within easy reach by the great metro system.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: uvabrian
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel after having an aweful hotel experience in Arles, France. The hotel staff was superb. [They speak English.] Delphine at the reception desk was so polite. The concierge was very informative. There was also a representative of the RATP (the Paris Metro/Bus operators) at the concierge who helped me exchange defective metro tickets and showed us how to get to Charles de Gaulle airport by train. The hotel is near St. Jacque Metro station (Gare de Lyon and Gare Montparnasse are served by this line) and only one stop from RER B station Denfert-Rochereau which goes to the airports. There were not many restaurants/cafes/bistros... within 2 blocks of the hotel, especially ones that are open on Sundays. But it is a safe and easy walk to more dining options towards Place Monge or the Latin quarter. The room was immaculate with a view of the city. [We were on the 12th floor.] It also isn't the charming little French bed and breakfast or a basic no frills place. As a 4-star hotel, it can't be expected to be a bargain. But that being said, the rooms and property are great and the service is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory Stay”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid1
Reviews.Content: A few hopefully objective comments. Stayed four nights and value for money was fairly good IMO. Rooms are on the smallish side and ours measured 12 X 17 feet; bathroom was small with one of those not unusual "half" glass "shower curtains. There was some mildew in some of the grout in the shower, otherw ise the housekeeping was good. We booked a room which included executive lounge access. A few days prior to arrival I received the usual Marriott e-mail asking if we wanted additional items such as flowers in the room, extra pillows, etc. That e-mail also included an offer for an upgrade "to the Elite lounge." Huh???? That 'elite lounge' is simply another name for the Executive Lounge located on the 3rd floor of the hotel. Breakfast in that lounge was truly continental...NO hot food such as eggs, etc. Lots of pastries, orange juice, toast-making supplies, cold cuts, cheeses, etc. Lounge staff were efficient and helpful. Free internet access and printing capability ia available in the lounge. The service in this hotel was VERY good: our mini- bar fridge wasn't working; they replaced it immediately. Tub/shower combo which had good water pressure had no soap dish which I found to be inconvenient, especially at this price..we asked for an additional one but never got it..a minor point I suppose. Ate in the hotel restaurant one night: pricey but I will say the filet I had was good and a step way up from the usual thin "steak" you often get on menus in Europe. Hotel is located half-way between two metro stops (St. Jacques and Glacier) on Line 6. Easy access to either of these stops but getting to the more main tourist areas/sites can be time-consuming and requires time-consuming changes at some of the biggest stations such as Montparnasse Bienvenue....you CAN get directly to the Eiffel Tower using Line #6, however. Air conditioning in the room worked well and the bedding was the usual comfortable Marriott offering. Value for money we thought was good but overall as much as we enjoy Marriott properties will not use again as it is simply too far away from the attractions we enjoy the most. I would recommend itr to a friend but with reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: luv2trvl09NY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Marriott from August 21st -24th. The hotel was beautifully furnished and had a modern feel to it. The room was on a smaller scale but the comfortable beds and pillows, spacious bathroom, nice furniture, flat screen tv and the refrigerator (which is a rarity in France) made up for it. There is a fully equipped fitness center in the building and is free for guests to use. Also, the front desk staff and concierge were very accommodating and helpful. The location was not a problem to us since the French metro is so efficient and reliable. The hotel is situated between the St. Jacques and Glaciere stations on which the #6 line runs through. Both are a 2 minute walk from the hotel. From CDG airport, we took the 45-minute ride on the RER-B train which stops at the Denfert Rochereau station. It is a 7 minute walk to the hotel or you can also transfer to the #6 metro. There are a few restaurants, cafes, a Franprix supermarket and ATMs close to the hotel. Across from the Denfert Rochereau station is Boulangeries Paul which became a regular stop for us to buy our croissants, gourmandaise and baguettes. The reason we chose the hotel was because we took advantage of Marriott’s “buy 2 nights, get the 3rd night free” promotion. With all the amenities available and the wonderful experience we’ve had, we will definitely stay at this hotel again when visiting Paris. P.S. Upon check-in, we were offered an upgrade to the Executive Lounge for 50 Euros but we refused it. We found out later that the hors d'oeuvres and cocktails are not served on weekends and would have been a waste of money if we took the offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: NZLTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Marriott for 4 nights at the end of 5 weeks holiday in Europe. Was such a pleasure to walk into a decent sized comfortably furnished room Beds are very comfortable. Great that they have empty fridges in the room, there are 2 supermarkets nearby to buy drinks and snacks etc. Also ice machines on each floor All the staff I dealt with during my stay were lovely, especially the concierge staff. Although not right in the heart of Paris this was no major downfall for me, there are several metro stations nearby (the hotel website has very good instructions on how to get to the hotel from CDG). I brought a 3 day pass for the hop-on hop-off tourist bus from the concierge, there was one of these bus stops several blocks from the hotel so made this very easy for me, and no getting lost! The hotel is just down the road from the Catacombs. There is also a laundrette nearby which is handy when travelling for any length of time. Even though I was in Paris as a tourist the location for me was fine, just took a little longer to get to the major sights Only negative was the cost to use the internet, I used one of the hotel computers, EUR10 for 45 mins which was the most expensive of all the hotels I stayed in Europe I would happily stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “A tranquil hotel that exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: oshea45
Reviews.Content: After a business trip in Paris that started with a less-than-stellar experience at the Meridien Montparnasse nearby, I extended my stay in Paris by a few days and went back to the drawing board with Priceline, this time having the good fortune of being dealt the Marriott Rive Gauche, which is located between Saint Jacques & Glaciere metro stops in the 14th arrondissement. Since I was not visiting tourist hot spots, proximity to those was not an issue for me (as it might be if you are looking for something within five or ten minutes' walk from major attractions) and I appreciated the good transportation connections within a short walk to the hotel. Upon check-in (and despite the fact that I was a Priceline customer paying peanuts for my room), I was given a wonderful room on a high floor (16th) with a fantastic view of the 14th and the Parc Montsouris. The room was clean, comfortable, cozy, and the bedding, furniture, and TV up-to-date and just as nice as any Marriott I have stayed at in California, DC, London, etc. Also what a nice touch to have that empty fridge for drinks, fruit, etc.! The bathroom was a combo of marble and tile with an American-sized shower/tub combo and very nice lemongrass-scented toiletries. All in all, I had a great stay at the Marriott Rive Gauche and I would definitely return there again. Although I did not take advantage of the fitness center or the cafe/restaurant on the main floor, they book looked really nice, and the bar a step up from a typical cheezy hotel bar.

Reviews.Title: “Large American Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: e2637
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Rive Gauche Hotel & Conference Center is a large American style hotel only a half dozen or so metro stops away from the major tourist sites. During a nearly month long road trip of Europe I checked in and out of many hotels. While it was great to experience the culture of the places I visited, the Rive Gauche turned out to be a welcome escape from the traditional European hotel scene. The Rive Gauche basically has all the amenities that one can expect from Marriott in the states. The hotel is exceptionally clean and the hotel rooms appear to be recently updated. The beds were particularly comfortable. The bathroom is actually two separate rooms – one for the toilet and one for the sink and shower. Even though the hotel is a one minute walk to the nearest metro station, the location may not be ideal for some travelers. The hotel is in a residential section of Paris well outside of the city center. If you need to be in the middle of the action this hotel may not be for you. If you can tolerate a short commute on public transportation this hotel may be the perfect match.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay close to the metro station”
Reviews.Author: hahin025
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was a great hotel. The front desk was excellent, as were the associates at the concierge desk. The room was a good size, especially for rooms in Paris. It is not in a central location within walking distance of the major sights, but it takes a total of 90 seconds to walk to the metro station, where you quickly get to your destination. The beds are absolutely wonderful! They are so comfortable, it was hard to get out of bed! The downsides: internet access was very expensive. The food in the hotel was also overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room for Paris in ok location but nightmarish front desk service”
Reviews.Author: JacquesLacan
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the room is good size for the money compared to other Paris hotels. The decor is without charm but fine. wifi is 25 a day. Amenities are fine. Location, is somewhat on the periphery but near a metro station. That was all fine, except for the service. It was perfectly nice but completely incompetent. The pipe in the room leaked causing a tile to collapse at 3 am. This was not fixed well and happened again the next night. To get it fixed properly and cleaned up was quite the ordeal in being shuffled from night staff to day staff and back again. Ditto for the telephone, which did not work in the room and was not fixed for the 5 day duration of the stay! It was an exercise in frustration.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room good service, pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: croodb
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel in good neighbourhood, there are good places to eat close by and the subway is about 150 feet away. The staff were helpful and the room was nice, big and clean. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Metro is a block away”
Reviews.Author: ziggyziggy
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself seems quite dated but renovations have taken place over a period of time. The window in our room was tiny as it was only about three feet wide. The room itself is small. Our king size bed was only one foot from the TV cabinet. Theres a little work desk and not much walking room. The toilet is in a small room outside the bathroom. Although the hotel rooms felt dated, they felt clean and well maintained. The only think I disliked is how the housekeeping person has total disregards for our bathroom items left on the counter. When our room is made daily, bottles will end up sideways and items re-arranged. I don’t expect them to organize by bathroom stuff but if you wipe the counter and makes a mess, shouldn’t you at least pick it up to show you didn’t do a half-assed job? Anyways, that my only fit with the hotel. Upon arriving we were surprised with a bottle of red wine placed in the room so that was a nice touch. The hotel is one block from the number 6 metro line Glaciere. When we first arrive we got off Denfert-Rochereau and we had to walk about 5 blocks. The 6 metro takes you directly to the Eiffel Tower stop and takes about 20 minutes. The hotel itself is not too close to any historic sites but the close proximity to the metro makes up for it as the 6 line is very convenient. We usually head straight to the metro every day upon leaving the hotel although we did attempt to walk to St Germain Avenue which is across the Seine River from the Louvre Museum to do some shopping. That took us over 1 hour. The gym is very modern and all the machines looked quite new. They have lots if cardio machines and weight machines and even free weights. The selection of free weights in huge and they have a light set and a heavy set. On thing that irritated me the most was when we were returning home one night from the Metro station outside the hotel. There were officers waiting to check ticket stubs and we threw ours way upon entering the original station. We were fined 25euros each and they did not even care we were tourists and did not understand French. Apparently they have signs that advise people to keep their metro tickets before getting off or something. They don’t have machines to verify them on your way out so logically speaking, why would anyone keep them?

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromMtKisco
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights and really had a great time. Since we have 2 teenage daughters, we booked 2 rooms and they gave us connecting rooms which was great. The location of the hotel was ideal for us. It was only a 10 minute walk from the RER B line which goes directly to CDG Airport. The hotel is also a 5 minute walk to either the Glaciere or St Jacques metro. We loved the location because it was so close to the metro and only a few stops away from all the major attractions in Paris (15 - 20 minutes max). The front desk and concierge desk were all very friendly and helpful. They also have a fitness center which can be used 24/7. The hotel and the rooms were clean and spotless. The breakfast buffet was excellent. For breakfast they served a wide variety of fresh fruits, breads, crossants, pastries, pancakes, cereals, eggs, meats, cold cuts, vegetables, omelettes, cheeses, juices, coffee and tea. This hotel fit our needs perfectly because it was clean and situated in a great location that met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice (& Expensive)”
Reviews.Author: franksbeans
Reviews.Content: Typical Marriott quality, although from what I hear, a nice hotel for Paris. Very close to the metro, and within a reasonable walking distance of the major sights. Clean room, English TV, a decent view of the city from the higher floors. Parking was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: brewster69
Reviews.Content: We have been to Paris three times and stayed in other hotels, this time we decided to try the Marriott. When we return we will be going back to the Marriott Rive Gauche. The hotel rooms were a good size for Paris, the decor was nice and a bit modern, good selection of english TV stations, and the empty fridge was great idea. The buffet breakfast was very nice and had a good selection. On our first trip to Paris we learned that you really need to book breakfast with your room, otherwise you will find yourself at 8am wandering the streets looking for a cafe that is open. The only down side to staying at the Marriott Rive Gauche is the location, as others reviewers have said, it is not very close to any of the major tourist attractions, and a metro ride to Le Marais or Hotel De Ville will take some time and require you to change lines a couple of times. However, travel time wasn't an issue for us so we enjoyed ourselves. Another issue for me was in the bathroom. The tub/shower has a moveable glass partition instead of a shower curtain, something very common in Europe. The problem with this was the glass didn't meet the front wall of the shower so the spray leaked water all over the floor. We used many towels during the week, most of them to dry the bathroom floor. Twice the water leaked all the way out on to the bedroom carpet, which you could tell had happened before. Overall we loved the hotel and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice find for leisure travellers”
Reviews.Author: momtobook
Reviews.Content: I stay at Marriott properties on business if convenient. My teen aged daughter and I booked a room here for a vacation week in Paris. Although at first I was concerned about being in the 14th arrondissement, the location was actually ideal. It gave us a feel of residential Paris, and was a nice respite from the bustle of the lower numbered arrondissement neighborhoods. It felt calming coming back in the evenings after long days of touring. A block or so from the Glaciere Metro stop, it was only a short trip on the Metro to all the sites. The facility is modern, with a definite European 'edge' about it. The cafe off the lobby was perfect for breakfast/lunch ( skip the buffet service in the dining facility!). There is outdoor seating off the lobby for a coffee or drink so that one can watch the 'street scene'. The bar and dining area were busy at all times during the day and evening which made it fun. We felt very safe in the hotel as there was life in the lobby but also staff within site at all times. There is key entry in the elevator to the room floors above. The rooms themselves were clean and comfortable, with air conditioning which baffles noise. The hotel has a gym which was clean and well maintained. Although Paris is filled with interesting and charming hotels, this facility cannot be beat for security, service and comfort! It is large without an overcrowded feel even when busy with conferences and many business visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Bad Location.”
Reviews.Author: 30thBirthdayTrip2009
Reviews.Content: Great accommodations. Comfortable/Americanized room – great bed and view. Staff was a little pushy – insisting we were not due a discounted rate we had secured, but did promptly apologize when they realized they were in the wrong. Internet access was a disappointment – no free wi-fi and business center charged 5 euros for 15 minutes. Hotel is 15-20 minutes via Metro to major tourist attractions in Paris. It’s not close enough to justify a mid-day break to drop off shopping bags or rest. While we enjoyed the room, we will not stay there again – instead will choose a better location in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious”
Reviews.Author: beachfront914
Reviews.Content: We booked online and at check-in, they wouldn't accomodate our two children (7 and 13) in the same room with us. At first they were going to charge us double, but then they went out of their way to accomodate us. We were very pleased with the arrangement and the service. Very large, modern, almost american style hotel. The location is a little bit away from city center, but the metro stop is a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not centrally located”
Reviews.Author: cchri1p
Reviews.Content: As a previous reviewer wrote, the closer you are to the center of Paris, the worse the rooms look. And this hotel is no exception- while it has wonderful renovated rooms that are generous-sized, it is not located near any areas of interest. However, it is a short metro ride from central Paris, and it is located near the St. James RER stop on the "B" line direct from CDG airport. Besides the location, my only other complaint is the cost of internet- 20 euro for 24 hours is absolutely outrageous. But if you don't mind taking the Metro, and you do your net surfing elsewhere, this is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel close to Metro...but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: bedenji
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel recently for four weeks while on a business trip. I'll start with what I liked about the hotel: - The hotel has been recently renovated and the rooms, while basic, look more modern than a lot of hotels I've stayed at in Europe - The restaurant/bar in the lobby is nice for an easy and quick dinner and/or drinks - There are two Metro stops very close by with easy access to all of Paris - The staff was friendly and we had no problems finding someone who spoke English Now, for the things I didn't like: - While the rooms appeared to be clean for the most part, there seemed to be the beginnings of mold growing in some of the bathrooms (in particular, around the shower edges and on some of the WC walls) - The staff, while friendly, was not the most helpful. I tried for four weeks to get a special rate for parking. I contacted the front desk manager the first week of my stay, who gave me the impression that she could definitely find some sort of special rate for me. However, I had to continuously follow up with her to check on the status of that (she did not make much effort to get in touch with me). After FOUR weeks, I still had not gotten anything resolved and am having to follow up with her via email. Similarly, I had a problem with a bill (they charged one of my coworker's bills to my credit card), and had to talk to several people on several different occasions to get anything done (for what I assumed would be a pretty simple fix). Nothing major...just not the best customer service for anything beyond basic checking in/out. - The location is not the best, but its ok. You are definitely not staying in the hip or trendy part of Paris (which we knew going in), but the neighborhood really dies down at night. Even with that, I didn't feel unsafe walking around up until dark, but there just weren't many close options for good food, etc. Now, I know that while staying in a hotel for four weeks, pretty much anyone will find something they don't like about it. However I travel a lot with my job, and for 4-5 weeks at a time, and usually really enjoy the hotels I stay in. I just didn't find the customer service at this hotel to be up to par. All in all, if you're staying for a short period of time and find a really good rate (or can use your Marriott points), I think this hotel is an ok bet. But for anything longer than a night or two, I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, close to Metro, but basic”
Reviews.Author: neighborKissimmee_FL
Reviews.Content: We moved to this hotel after 4 nights at a beautiful resort, to be closer into Paris. If clean, comfortable beds and the ability to bathe or shower are all you want from a room, you will be fine. This is no resort hotel, it is made for convention and business travelers. In America, this would be a 3-star hotel. The bathrooms are tiny; the rooms are no larger than a cruise ship cabin. There was a desk with internet connection and a huge flat screen TV. They were not able to give us connecting rooms with our kids, or even let us be on the same floor, and we were not the only family with that problem. We got a "two night, third night free" deal through Expedia. All in all, we felt we got what we paid for, but would not stay there again. If we had paid full price, we would have felt ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Great and extremely confortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: n00btraveller
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Beds were amazing and they had all the amenities you need. Staff was great too. The concierge spoke perfect English and told us exactly where we needed to go.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler9735
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week in August 2008 and were very satisfied with our stay. It is a large,well kept, extremely clean, staff friendly, busy hotel with many amenities. The pros: 2 metro stations within 3-6 minutes walk. We go a pass and were able to REALLY make the most of our stay seeing almost every site possible. The breakfast- wonderful and large buffet with all the American favorites and a good many French standards - breads, cheeses , yogurts, hot items, every fruit, great coffee and service. We had such a great breakfast and did not feel the need to eat a big lunch. We just took bottled water from our room fridge (free) and stopped by a bakey for items. Later in the evening we came back to the hotel for complimentary cocktails, snacks. in the bar - very relaxing and nice. Cons- If you have to step out your door and have 20 restaurants right there this is not the place for you. Stay closer to the sites. You will have to take the metro to go to great places for dinner. We did not mind and usually at just traveling around was so interesting. Stay here if you are adventurous and want to be sure that you are getting a hotel quality you are used to in the states. The rooms are the same just a bit smaller. We also had free wireless in our rate which was almost like having a concierge in our room (consulting tripadvisor for ideas/opinions) Nothing really bad to say about this hotel except we were not able to use the great gym because we made every moment count toward seeing as much as we could.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelmonkey247
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Rive Gauche is a nice place to stay after having stayed smaller France hotels. The staff was very friendly and nice. The whole hotel is kept very nice and clean. The rooms are big for France and has mini-fridge. The beds are very comfortable and soft. The shower glass is very annoying though because water is all over the floor after a shower. There is really nothing around the hotel as far as sightseeing but the hotel about five minutes away from the metro. While I was there there seemed to be a big business conference and a tour group there. My only other complaint is the 19 euro charge for internet. Tip: If you are looking for a place to eat, turn left out of the hotel and walk for about 5 minutes and you will find many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Residential area, safe, quiet but not a lot of good dining options around”
Reviews.Author: Senor_Schmutzig
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and 4-year old stayed at the Marriott Rive Gauche this past week for 5 nights. While it's a short 5-minute walk to either Glaciere or St. Jacques on the #6 Metro line, it's not within walking distance of much else. Here are some bullet points about our stay and the surrounding area: - The hotel was pleasant, beds were very comfortable and the room was quiet. We had an end room so that may have been one of the reasons why we thought it was so quiet. - The concierge(s) were always helpful and provided good information when needed about transportation options or suggestions. We did our own restaurant research so we didn't use them much for that. The one restaurant they suggested, we opted not to go to after not finding anything on the menu that we wanted. - There is a patisserie right across from the St. Jacques Metro station that is a good spot to get some pastries before you head out for the day. When you walk out of the hotel, take a left and it's on the same side of the street as the Marriott. - In the room there is a small refrigerator that the Marriott has emptied all of the typical minibar items from so hotel guests can use them. Great idea and I wish more hotels would do this instead of charging inflated prices - There is a Monoprix grocery nearby to pick up some food and drinks. Walk out of the hotel, turn right, turn right when you get to Rue de la Glaciere, it's down a block or two. - I wouldn't recommend any of the cafes right on St. Jacque near the hotel. If you go to any of them, have low expectations. We tried an Italian place nearby and it was pretty awful. Cheap, but not much better than what I could have put together with some Ragu, a microwave and a frozen pizza. - Internet is expensive at €20/day but I would suggest signing up for a Boingo.com account. For $69.95/month you get 2000 minutes on any of their networks (including iBahn, which is what Marriotts use). I also used it successfully in a few other cities in Europe. It saved me a ton in internet charges at hotels during our 5-week stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best Location, But a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robs4219
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Rive Gauche is exactly what you expect from a Marriott: clean, comfortable, and luxurious. The hotel itself is located on a relatively quiet street in the Montparnasse area. The RER C Line runs just a few blocks away at Denfert-Rochereau, so getting to and from the airport is easy (as long as they’re not on strike!). If you do take a taxi to/from CDG, it should be around 50 Euro. There is a metro located one block on either side of the hotel (Saint Jacques to the left, Glaciere to the right), so getting around is quick and easy. After walking a few blocks to the right of the hotel, you’ll find multiple grocery stores for buying snacks, bottled water, etc. On Fridays there is also a street market about 5 minutes away (turn right when you walk out of the hotel, on the way to Place d’Italie) selling fresh produce, meat, cheese, etc. The room was excellent, spacious and comfortable with what must be the best bedding in the hotel business. Rare for Europe, the king-size bed was actually a king-size bed and not just two doubles pushed together. I can’t think of anything negative to say about the room at all, everything was great. Instead of a mini-bar, there’s an empty refrigerator to keep your drinks/food in. The room also had very effective air-conditioning, which makes things quite comfortable in the summer. Overall, I felt the hotel was good value considering we had booked on Priceline. For their regular rates I might be tempted to stay elsewhere though. The location is convenient due to the proximity of the Metro, but otherwise it is quite out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Marriott, great service, price, gym, room, and safe area”
Reviews.Author: JBS123_9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights recently. Hotel accessed by Denfert Rochereau metro with a three block walk using RER B, or M 4 metro lines from CDG or elsewhere. From the hotel you can get to Versailles in 45 minutes, and Les Halles main metro station in 25 minutes, (access to Louvre, Notre Dame, St. Germain, Rue de Rivoli, etc.). So, while not centrally located the the prices are typically excellent, and you have a full service hotel with excellent gym, (atypical of Paris), a somewhat larger room, in a safe quiet, area. If you don't mind not being in the heart of Paris and are willing to travel on the metro, want great pricing and full service, this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best location, but good value and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ray420
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Hotel at Rive Gauche for 3 nights a couple years ago after getting a very good deal (85 Euro/night) from our friend. The hotel is a bit out of the city centre and sometimes it's pretty tiring to travel 40+ minutes to get to the tourist attractions. But on the bright side, our hotel room was nice and spacious with a small balcony. The hotel is also within walking distance (5 minutes) to the 'Glaciere' metro station and on the way, there are some nice small cafes on the sidewalks. There's a grocery store on the right of the hotel in case you want to pick up some milk, fruits or snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: cherjack10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our anniversary in Paris and my boss provided the hotel accomodations for us. We stayed in the junior suite(equipped with a daily stocked fridge, living area, 2 bathrooms and 2 plasma televisions). We had access to the executive lounge (complementary breakfast along with refreshments and alcohol in the evening). The hotel itself is very posh and chic. This was our first visit to Paris and although the hotel did not provide a true Parisian, authentic experience, I was very pleased with the accomodations. The bed was very comfortable.The staff was very friendly and helpful. There was no language barrier as the staff was fluent in English. The concierge provided great recommendations for French cuisine. The hotel is within walking distance (5 minutes) to a major metro line. Restaurants and ATM's are plentiful. The hotel is located in a safe neigborhood. Sidenote: any important messeges, voicemail, etc. are relayed via passcode that you access on your television.

Reviews.Title: “Out of centre, good value, modern amenities”
Reviews.Author: Boldizsar
Reviews.Content: Modern rooms as usual, good food, good conference rooms. Location is not interesting for a walk, no shops, no restaurants nearby. In Paris either you have small and a bit worn rooms in the center or the modern, comfortable ones a couple of metro stations away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: IndiaKhanna
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Marriott Rive Gauche Paris was just for one night but was simply amazing. The staff were absolutely pleasant and courteous. We arrived there early and had requested for an early check in - we were not promised the same, but the hotel was extremely accomodating. Though the Hotel is far away from the airport (it tooks us bout 45 min to get there) yet it is very close to all the magnificient places you would like to see while at Paris. Hope to be back there sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully comfortable, centrally located!”
Reviews.Author: ldayFlorida
Reviews.Content: Marriott Rive Gauche is in the Latin Quarter of Paris. Metro station is one short half block in front of hotel, very convenient to everywhere within minutes. The room was clean, modern, with an extremely comfortable bed, linens, etc. Full bath with tub and every amenity Marriott is known for. Would definitly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Return Travelers”
Reviews.Author: GoEast
Reviews.Content: Located in one of the outer arrondisements on the left bank of the Seine river, the Marriott is a welcomed break from the usual European boutique hotels. After a few weeks traveling and one is travel weary, it's nice to have some elbow room and blush comfort with their oh so luxurious Hanse Pillows and Duvets. If you are a first time visitor to Paris and want to experience the full effect of romance, architecture, and cafe life, it may be better to stay in one of the central arrondisements (1-7). The Marriott Rive Gauche is in a bit of a commercial/industrial area though there is a metro stop a block away on either side of the hotel entrance. They have these strange half doors on the tub which does a...well, half-decent job of keeping the water from the shower in. The toilet is in a separate closet--truly a wash closet (WC)--makes you realize how the term came to be. A nice plus was the empty minifridge which you may stock with you own items from the supermarket down the block. It allowed me to keep items for picnics in the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great gym. Too far away from the action.”
Reviews.Author: KristaInLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here primarily based on price. The hotel was convenient for Gare du Nord, as it was only five stops on the RER to Denfert Rochereau and a 8 minute walk or so to the hotel from there. The Pros Awesome gym. You don't see this much in Paris. Five or six treadmills, four or five ellipticals, three bikes, and lots of weight equipment. Also, the exercise machines mostly all had TVs attached to them, which was a nice feature. The gym is free and open 24 hours. Ice machine on at least the floor I was staying on. You don't see this much in Paris! The beds. They're huge and soft in a good way, with great bedding. (Not surprisingly, there's a catalog on the desk where you can order your own set of Marriott bedding.) The "minibar" is actually empty. There's a sign there that says that the Marriott has discovered that guests prefer to use the fridge to keep their own stuff cold. What a nice change from the signs I sometimes see that say, "You are not allowed to keep your own things in the refrigerator." The Cons 14 euro continental breakfast. Interestingly, my first morning, I got a bit confused about what was continental and what wasn't, so I asked someone and they told me it didn't really matter what I took because the staff can't keep track of who's taking the continental and who's got the full buffet. (You state your preference at the door.) There are a lot of hotels in Paris where continental is included. I like that. 20 euro per day Internet charge. The staff did note that once I had signed up, I could take my laptop anywhere in the hotel and use it. I wasn't relegated to my room. I liked that. Hallways are a bit beaten up. Location. I had no idea how far I was from everything until I took a taxi back from Vendome one night. It took ages and I think it was 18 euros. In short, I wouldn't stay here again. But if you're a looking for a business-class hotel and it's convenient to where you are working/visiting, maybe you should consider this.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would definitely come back.”
Reviews.Author: rainemd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days with my spouse. The room was big, great view, clean and big bathroom, and the king size bed was heavenly. The breakfast buffet was very filling with lots of choices. The staff were very nice - especially the concierge - they helped us book tours, book dinner and show at the Moulin Rouge, and helped us find our way around the city. The hotel is in between 2 metro stations (St. Jacques and Glaciere) so it's accessible to the city - although it takes 30 minutes to go to the Eiffel Tower area from the hotel by metro. Overall, had a great time at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you'd prefer an American-style stay at an American-style hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Catou
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying that I've been to Paris before and have stayed elsewhere in the city. If this were my first time in Paris and I stayed here, I'd be a bit dissapointed in the location. The hotel is located in the 14th arrondissement, seemingly far from all the obvious tourist points and attractions. But if you're savvy with the train and the métro here in Paris, you will be able to go wherever you need to get to. The hotel is close to both a major station (Denchert-Rochereau - about three blocks down Saint-Jacques) and two métro stops (Saint-Jacques and Glacière - that one's closer- for the 6 line of the Métro) If you're looking to stay somewhere quaint and romantic on a narrow street of Paris, you do not want to stay here. There is not much ambiance in the immediate area of the hotel. Walk in anyone direction about 10 to 15 minutes and you'll have your narrow streets and quaint hidden bistros. Are those areas as romantic and quaint as those in Montmatre, Marais, or anywhere in the 7th arrondissement ? Not quite. But walk North, and hit Montparnasse, and the neighborhoods are lovely, keep walking North and the Latin Quarter along with the areas around the Jardin de Luxembourg are lovely too.
