I say if you have an option between this Mariott and a similarly priced hotel more centrally located, I'd pick the other option - but all is not lost if you decide to stay here. Like you have read in the other reviews, the hotel is your average Marriott. A sizeable room and bathroom (separate toilet) by European standards (could be considered even large) with super comfy beds with comfy duvet and lots of pillows (often a rarity in your run-of-the-mill European hotel). For rooms: your options are queen bed or two singles (I don't think they offer two doubles unless you're in a suite). The 18th Floor is the top floor of this hotel and gives you a nice North view of the city with Montmatre and Sacré-Coeur in the far distance (but still visible on a nice day). Day concierge service was infinitely better and better informed than those on the night shift - (i.e. concierge service at night told us that the Galeries Lafayette would be closed on Ascension day, when we went to confirm the following day with the day concierge, they told us the complete opposite, good thing we double checked!) I can't attest to the restaurant or the European brasserie but to tell you that this is Paris, so venture out and go eat elsewhere. There are so many great bistros on Boulevard du Montparnasse - which is the closest area with the better restaurants...so go there.. But also don't shy away from the few restaurants that are nearby the hotel either. An affordable breakfast can be had at any of those on Saint-Jacques if you don't want to venture too far first thing in the morning. Also there is a little épicerie (food shop) about a block down from the hotel towards the Denchert-Rochereau stop which also sells super affordable wine. You want a Bordeaux for 5 Euros? It's the place to go after a long day of sight-seeing. Bring it back with you to the hotel and toast the city! A great convenience of the hotel if you so choose to stay here, is if you have access to the executive lounge. It's roomy, modern - with happy hour beer and wine - along with a coffee machine that makes pretty good espresso, lattes and coffee. It also offers you a selection of sodas and bottled water you can take back to you room. Breakfast was decent, but not delicious. Some cheeses, breads, pastries, cold meats and fruit salad. I would have preferred to go get a pain du chocolat or a croissant at a proper place, but when you've got a whole day ahead of you - it was nice to have a place you could just go down to from your room, grab breakfast, read the paper, check your e-mail (there are three computer terminals) and go back upstairs to get ready. If you're accustomed to American type hotels, american-type service and convenience (everyone speaks english of course!), and american-style and sized rooms and you can navigate the convenient public transportation of Paris this place is for you. p.s. on a side note, if you're interested in checking out the catacombs, they're right nearby, just across the street from the Denfert-Rochereau station.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Marriott in poor location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LWTWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in the location of the hotel. Far from the Paris attractions and no good restaurants nearby. Had to take a metro or taxi to go anywhere. Room was very small and cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Modern Hotel, Crazy Comfortable Bed, Lovely View”
Reviews.Author: Iceman41ak
Reviews.Content: Great staff, modern hotel, located close to three metro stops within three-four blocks in either direction. Loved this hotel for the price. Bed was crazy comfortable, roomy bath, (although odd "half" shower screen, allows water to spill on floor) flat screen, nice desk and wonderful view. Asked and was granted upper floor (room 1630) with view toward downtown. Room 1630 is at the end of the hall, and I didn't hear a peep from any other rooms. Very quiet, but rooms closer to the street might by a bit noisy due to significant traffic and apparently it is mandatory to honk the car horn, when driving in Paris, at any and every opportunity. Important to ask for a room with view facing north as the southern view is mundane. I declined the $50 Euro per night upgrade to the Executive level, which would have allowed complimentary Cont'l Breakfast, as we're fairly early risers, and I prefer grabbing a croissant or pain du chocolate at one of the nearby patisseries / pastry shops. Concierge were excellent - made great recommendations for dinners outside the hotel. The female concierge even loaned my wife her a curling iron, when we couldn't get out Radio Shack electrical converter to operate. Entire staff speaks english. While located away from the central tourist district - all of Paris is only a few Metro stops away, so after reading the sketchy reviews about the Priceline four-star hotels near the Louvre, I am glad I chose the Marriott Rive Gauche. Felt perfectly safe walking back to hotel at night, after dark. At $100 US per night - best bargain I found in Paris, except maybe the pastries.....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ryans_auntie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Rive Gauche and Conference Center for a one week vacation. The hotel is not "in the middle of it all", however the metro is two blocks away and extremely convenient. I had no transportation problems at all. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. Everyone from front desk, concierge and executive lounge staff. The executive lounge was great. It was nice to have computer access, snacks and drinks throughout the day and evening if needed. Liz, the host, was wonderful. She had great restaurant and bar recommendations. The hotel room was very clean and quiet. The size was great for a European room. The concierge was so helpful in booking two of my tours. One day, our tour was late, and the front desk staff brought us coffee and pastries for our tour while we waited. I would definitely stay at the Marriott Rive Gauche on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Bobinepa
Reviews.Content: We had a really great experience at the Rive Gauche. While it's a little out of the way, I would still stay there again. I had my back-pack stollen in Geneva on the way to Paris and the staff at the RG went so out of their way to be of help. We were on the Concierage floor and had use of the club lounge. It was a nice lounge with decent offerings albeit crowded. Our room was large especially by Paris standards. The only reason I gave this hotel a 4 is because of it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: VoyageuseDeCanada
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was a nice hotel and a comfortable stay. The service we received was very good and the location not bad. It’s not right near the sights, but does have an excellent link to transportation. The beds as always were super comfy and the room nice and clean. The bathroom was quite large, but yes be forewarned that there is only a little half shower wall so we had water all over the bathroom by the time we were done. One thing I really loved was that they don’t stock the bar fridge. My friend and I bought our own drinks and breakfast food so that we could eat before going out. The hotel does have a store where you can buy the normal bar fridge items if wanted. But there were grocery stores nearby so we bought everything much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional Marriott Property - Easy Access to Rest of City”
Reviews.Author: orange76Indiana
Reviews.Content: The hotel was what you woud expect from a Marriott propoerty - clean, comfortable and friendly staff. The best thing was that while it is not centrally located it was very easy to access any part of the city as it was no more than a 5 minute walk to two Metro stations. I found the rooms larger than normal and very clean and comfrotable.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in The Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: NEEDSPEED
Reviews.Content: Great location. Rooms are a decent size given Paris hotels. Well connected. Great concierge. Super food. Room allotment at check in was pretty disappointing though

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: emily27
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel after bidding on priceline, initially was a bit concerned that it might be a bit off the beaten path. Once we were there we couldn't have been happier. It was close to 3 underground stations, one almost right across the street. Very easy to hop on, hop off for all of our destinations. The room was huge for Paris standards, clean, and very comfortable. A bit dissapointed at the tv channel selections. Everyone at the desk was very willing to help with directions. There was a gym (we didn't use it). Skip the breakfast in the hotel, and eat at the many little brasseries up and down the street. There is a market near the hotel if planning a picnic.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gizmo100
Reviews.Content: I booked this Marriot via priceline and received a rate of £70 per night which was good value. We were on vacation so not attending any conferences within the hotel. The hotel is locates in the south centre of Paris but although myself and my boyfriend used the metro and walk non-stop we felt it was just too much out from the Bizz so to speak. The area that the Marriott is in is residential and although there are a few restaurants nearby there is nothing to do at night so we found ourselves coming back to the Hotel very late at night. The Reception staff are very nice but for checking in and checking out there is always a queue. As one American guest said do you think this is the only hotel in Paris – this is a very busy hotel. The Hotel is immaculate and the bedrooms very nice and the bed very comfortable. A word of warning if you wish a lie in please put the Do Not Disturb sign on your door before bed as housekeeping will keep attempting to get into your room even though you are in the room and call out ‘were still here’ . I would say when I stayed in the Marriott Regents Park London all the housekeeping staff would say hello or acknowledge you – here they didn’t and avoided eye contact. There is no minibar in the room but there is a supermarket outside at the small amount of shops turning right when you go out of the Marriott and the Hotel allows you to keep these in the fridge which is pretty good – as stated before there is an ice machine on each floor at the lift so this is very good too plus iced water. The bar is pricey but this is to be expected in any hotel of this size we also ate from the room service menu and the food was fine. We never used the concierge because there was always a queue at their desk! The gym is quite small but the equipment looks very good. It is opened 24/7 so good for people that don’t sleep! This is an American hotel and the main visitors are Americans many that are on organised tours. Glacier metro is 2 mins walk from the Hotel turning right when you get outside the Hotel. The metro is easy to navigate (I found it very easy and much simpler than the London Tube) but bear in mind to get to the centre of things happening in Paris you either have to walk or take the metro – if this doesn’t appeal – I would pick a Marriott closer to the hub of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Large Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ooookch
Reviews.Content: This large and busy hotel is exactly what it says in the name: hotel and conference centre. Don’t expect anything charming or romantic in it. That said it’s a good standard Marriott, the rooms are nice and clean with a pretty view on the higher floors. The lobby is very crowded sometimes, so checking in or out can take a little while. The restaurant is ok, but there are some good restaurants with better food and prices in the area. The location is ok; it’s not in the centre but there’s a metro station not far away and it’s also quite easy to get there by car. What I really didn’t like: I booked an executive room with lounge access-which was a really bad joke: the lounge is closed on weekends! The hotel offers decent rates at weekends, so if you don’t mind the business atmosphere you may consider it also as a place to stay for a leisure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, Some bad, but overall a fine American style hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Joeleeo1227
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Paris over Christmas with our 16 and 14 year old children. Chose the hotel since we could use our Marriott points to stay. Overall, it was a pretty good stay, in what is essential a business hotel, but there were a few challenges/issues Good: 1. Very large, clean room. We had a junior suite and it was nice to have the extra room. 2 bathrooms allowed us to get out early every morning without killing each other. 2. Service was Ok. The staff tried very hard and were generally very friendly, especially the people in the Executive Lounge (see more below), who were warm and charming. On the other hand, the concierges were a mixed bag-one was charming, but eccentric, another was all business, but not very consistent-promised reservations were never made and would get huffy about it. 3. Breakfasts were very good-either in Exec Lounge or at the buffet on days shut down for holidays. 4. This is an American hotel, so people looking for amenities they would get in the US and don't want to try something new, this is the place for you. We would have preferred a more continental experience, but using points is good Issues/Concerns 1. Location. It is a train ride to all the attractions and sights in Paris.The green line stops are about 5 minutes away (Go to the Glaciere stop-it is closer than St. Jacques), but then you need to connect at least once to get to most places other than the Arch De Triumph. It is approximately a 10 minute walk to the Denfert/Rochereaux blue line stop which connects to more places and also has an RER stop for easy access to DeGaulle. Tip-do not transfer from the blue line to the green at Denfert-it is MUCH faster to walk the 10 minutes then to follow the path underground to the green line connection. Bottom line is that if you don't mind not being in the middle of everything and riding the Metro to get places, then this won't bother you since it is pretty convenient. If it is impotant that you be in the middle of the action, then select another hotel. 2. Food in the restaurant is awful, except for breakfast. 3. The Executive Lounge had some great conveniences, but some real problems, and many of them were outside of the control of the hotel. The staff was very helpful and charming, even for things they could not help with. Many of the guest were nice to talk with and interesting. Most were polite to the staff. However, several families took over the place in the evenings and proceeded to get drunk while their children took over all of the computers, drink all of the remaining soda and basically trash the place. There was food and wrappers strewn all over the place and empty wine bottles left on the tables, which was a real problem over Christmas when no one came in to clean. If you are using the Lounge, remember, they are serving appetizers, not a meal at "Happy Hour".

Reviews.Title: “US above average experience in Paris, bit off the tourist map”
Reviews.Author: tom_redlaw
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott Platinum member and stay at a lot of their properties. On business I recently I chose this hotel due to its proximity to my work. I have actually stayed at most Paris Marriotts, and this one probably feels the most like a US city Marriott, ironically I think it was built as a Sofitel or some other French property. It has a great gym (which is not common in Paris Marriotts), a fantastic concierge lounge (better than most anywhere in the world), and a (forgive the term) US standard for courtesy. I am not an AMerican snob when I travel and am fine in local situations but for a business or US Marriott experience this is the best I have found in Paris, though if I was on a holiday I would not choose this location which is a bit far from the classic Parisian destinations (the Renaissance Vendome, Trocadero, or Champs Elysees are the Marriotts of choice for that type of trip). So, if business takes you to the south and you want a US experience this is the place for Marriott stays, if you are doing Paris as a tourist choose another location in preference but you will pay more or give up part of the US Marriott experience (gym, nice lounge, etc), which may be exactly what you want to do!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: xelaw34
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, and the staff is helpful. The neighborhood is very nice, but it's not central. To get to the main tourist spots in Paris (St. Germain, Monmarte, Eiffel, Les Halles, Louvre, Pompidou, Marais, Place de la Bastille, etc.) you have to take a bus or Metro - not too terrible in Paris, but take this into account if you stay here. Eating at the hotel is a no-no, as far as we're concerned. It's very expensive, the menu looks like glorified MacDonald's. Much better and cheaper to eat in a brasserie about a block away (also for breakfast). The room was very nice. We were on a high floor, and we had a very good view of Paris (you can't see the hotel from the hotel). All in all, if you get a good deal on room rates (we had a pretty good deal from Priceline), I would recommend staying there, especially if you want a hotel with an ice machine on each floor in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fav business hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: TravelCuties
Reviews.Content: Had my 3rd stay at this hotel for a week in January 2009. By far my favorite hotel for business in Paris. It is everything you would expect from a Marriott starting with a courteous, professional staff to the most comfortable bedding on the planet. Also, it is spotless - both in common areas and the rooms. Good desk for working at night and great accessibility by public transport to the airport and various business areas in and around Paris. Take the RER B line from the airport to Denfert Rochereau stop - it is a five minute walk to the hotel and will save you traffic time and insanely high cab fare. You can get to most Paris suburbs using or connecting through this line. For getting around the city, the Glaciere Metro stop is right outside the hotel. Don't bother with room service or the hotel restaurant - over-priced and sub-par food. If you need a snack, check out the Paul on Denfert Rochereau. If you're too tired to go out, the Italian restaurant on the block next to the hotel is ok. Watch out for the internet charges - 20 euro a day is completely outrageous, but I guess they know people have to use it for work. If you're looking for absolute quiet, ask for a room in the back of the building - the views aren't as good, but you don't have to deal with the traffic or Metro noise.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Hampronstraveller
Reviews.Content: Accompanied my wife who was chaperoning 22 college seniors on an annual trip to Paris. Have been to Paris 8-10 times and stayed at boutique hotels (Montalambert) and top end (Ritz) hotels. While rooms were standard chain size, furnishings, TVs, Internet connections were first quality and service was top notch. Maitre d' in the breakfast room invariably addressed guests by name. While hotel is a bit out of the heart of the left bank, the metro is across the street and there are always taxis at the front door. Superb health club on site too. Everyone should stay at a romantic Paris hotel once, but after that this Marrriott is terrific for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel stay in Europe”
Reviews.Author: westphillyboy
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. From the moment you arrive the staff bends over backwards to make your stay great. The rooms were well appointed and quite large. The exercise facility was well staffed. Food in the restaurants was quite good, albeit expensive. Although not in the city center it is a quick metro ride from all the major sites. My family greatly enjoyed our stay here. I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel in Paris, location easily accessible to sites by Metro”
Reviews.Author: yummytummy
Reviews.Content: We stayed during New Year's Eve and this hotel was hopping with guests! The room we stayed in was comforable, modern and looked resently renovated. A typical chain hotel feel. May feel a bit small for North American standard but totally adequate for our needs. An easy metro ride (about 20 min) takes you to the Eiffel Tower and Champs Elysees, museum areas. Neat little restaurants close by for bistro type fare. The hotel concierge desk team is great with info and helpfulness.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Foddye
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel off Priceline for $175/night from Dec. 28-Jan. 4, so I was not expecting very much at all. One shouldn't expect much if you want to stay in the center of a major city like Paris during one of the busiest tourist seasons! The Marriott Rive Gauche definitely met and exceeded my expectations. The location is good--across from a Metro stop that gets very, very regular train service. We never waited more than 3 minutes for a train to come by, and you're just one stop away from a major transfer station so you can head out all over Paris with relative ease. That being said, don't expect to be too charmed by the surrounding neighborhood; it's fine, but very residential and just not a whole lot of note. The hotel itself is just what you'd expect from a Marriott; decent, clean rooms; very comfortable bed, etc. I loved the bed actually--none of those gross polyester blankets like at US hotels, but soft cotton duvets that were washed as frequently as the sheets. A big downer was the price of Internet; 20 euros a day, and NOT wireless (it's that iBahn plug-in thing). The breakfast buffet was great too; omlette station, etc. But again, you'll be paying 14 euros a head for that. So, your room rate might be cheap, but with all the add-ons, it might be good to see if there isn't a place a bit more centrally located that costs more but includes more.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: PMLMontreal
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Marriott Rive Gauche for 8 days in early December and I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms are very well appointed, nicely decorated, quiet and the bed is particularly comfortable. The rooms with an even number offer a nice view of some of the main Paris Landmarks (Panthéon, Tour Montparnasse etc..), especially if your are on one of the highest floor. One of my friend who is a regular user of the hotel as an airline crew mentioned to me that the room with odd number do not offer such a nice view. The service is attentive and friendly and the R’yves restaurant, bar and lounge is a fine example of inspired modern design and food was quite good. I feel that I got good value for the money by paying 200€ a night during the week (as part of conference package) and 178€ for the week with breakfast included in both cases. My only gripes are the cost of internet (20€ a day) which is unfortunately typical of Europe and the rather slow checking in. Be also aware that the hotel is not located in one of the most active part of Paris. They are only a few restaurants in the vicinity (Villa St Jacques next to the hotel and offering Italian food is to be recommended). However, Montparnasse is only a few Metro stations away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ProfT
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed at the Marriott Rive Gauche and I love it. The staff treats you wonderfully and the rooms are luxurious, the beds to die for. Book through Marriott.com -- much cheaper rates than I see in other people's reviews. I also don't understand people who said the rooms were small. Maybe with a whole family, but spacious for one or two people. I wrote ahead and told the concierge that my flight would be arriving from the US at 5:20am and asked if I could get in early. They said they'd try and sure enough when I arrived before 7:30am it was ready. The hotel is very conveniently located to the metro (I prefer Glaciere over St-Jacques). Place d'Italie is a major center for connecting lines. If you are traveling from the airport by RER, it is best to get off at Denfert-Rochereau. There are elevators and escalators then it's a straight walk to the hotel for about 3 blocks. As someone who travels frequently to France, I can't say enough about this hotel and prefer it to all the other Marriotts in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “food?”
Reviews.Author: sara75013
Reviews.Content: Well designed but food dreadful and over priced - much better to go out and eat at a restaurant I had over cooked (in france) steak and undercooked potatoes - They should employ a real chef

Reviews.Title: “Great Beds”
Reviews.Author: robingichuhi
Reviews.Content: We are so glad we stayed here instead of some of the French Hotels. The rooms are adequate and the beds are wonderful. It is possible to walk to many of the places we wanted to go but most of the time we took the subway. We also added the executive lounge and enjoyed that most of the time. We happened to be here during Nov.11th a holiday and no body told us it was going to be closed for breakfast and nightly wine/appetizers time so we felt that was unfair since we were still paying 50€ for it. After we complained they gave us two free drink vouchers. When we went to use them a few days later they said it was only good for that day(of couse nobody told us) so in general there is no assentive for good customer satisfaction. We did find a good American/Mexican restaurant called Indiana within walking distance at Denfort area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - but hard to find”
Reviews.Author: kentwaller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here couple of nights on Marriott points and got upgraded to a 15th floor suite. Very nice! Modern, convenient suite with decent views of Paris. Typical Marriott food, good but not great. Had lots of trouble finding it - GPS kept taking me to Rue Saint Jacques rather than Boulevard Saint Jauques - key to success was to plug in the zip code. Traffic in Paris is a 3rd world nightmare - really not the best place to visit in Europe in my humble opinion, but the hotel was nice and close to a metro, which is the only feasible way to get around in London since there is absolutely no public parking and no taxis! When you get to the hotel they have to park your car for you, just pull up in front. Why is Paris so popular? Visit any small village anywhere in Europe and you will enjoy yourself much more!

Reviews.Title: “Met Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: House_of_Kain
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all our needs and expectations. Although compact, our 14th floor room was very comfortable, well appointed with a terrific view stretching as far as the Sacre Coeur. I particularly appreciated the complimentary soft drinks in the mini bar and the fact that there was space left for the bottle of wine and juice we bought from the late night shop next to the hotel. One small niggle, and this is not confined to the Marriott, of the four English language television stations available, why are they all news channels? Answers on a postcard please. Oh, and whilst I`m having a moan,why only one bathrobe? It is two minutes walk to either Glaciere or St. Jacques metro stations on ligne 6 but if you are heading across the river it is probably quicker to walk for 5 minutes to Place Denfert Rochereau. This gives you the option of the RER and 3 metro lines. There are also some good eating and drinking options in this area, I can recommend the funky Appolo restaurant right next to the RER station. If you get bored at night you can always shoot the breeze with the Scandinavian pilots and stewardesses in the surprisingly trendy hotel bar. Would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, nice hotel by Glacière metro stop”
Reviews.Author: aacree
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel on Priceline and enjoyed our stay. It is easy to get to the hotel on the Metro although the hotel is a a little ways out from the tourist attractions. The room size was bigger than average for most European hotels. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel and there are a couple of places to eat at in the neighborhood including a nice little pastry shop up the street. The neighborhood was safe even coming back late a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with nearby Metro”
Reviews.Author: klh717
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from the hotel website directly & paid for Non-refund package of Euro 229/night. We arrived at 20:00hrs from Eurostar London, the check in line was cleared & they gave us the highest floor (18th floor). The room in Paris considered average and clean. If you come out from the hotel you turn right walk for 3 min across the road you will reach Glaciere Metro station & if you turn left walk for 5 min across the road then you'll reach Saint Jacques Metro station. We paid Euro 11.40 for 10 tickets (which is cheaper) which we can use it for 2 days within the city center. Hotel conciere is very helpful even we don't speak France.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: T02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paris Marriott Rive Gauche for one week. The main reason we stayed at this hotel was because we could use Marriott points to cover the entire week. The location was convenient to a metro station and a great street (Daguerre) where we could get fresh bread, cheese and other items to take back to our hotel. Also there was a Franprix and Monoprix close by to pick up other items as needed. The only complaint that I had was not having the ability to check in early, we arrived to the hotel at 9am and they could not check us in until 3pm. The online concierge was very helpful, they booked dinner reservations for us and we were also able to get a museum pass conveniently upon arrival. I would recommend this hotel for easy access to the metro and clean and comfortable accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off.”
Reviews.Author: WiggleOxford
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for an exhibition for 6 nights rooms were clean but small in fact very small, stayed with my son in a twin bedded room and we could not get all our clothes in the small wardrobe. in fact for Euros275-00c per night it was not value for money in any way. Even more exhorbitant were the prices in the bar an average glass (Marriott Meagre Measure) of Chardonay was Euros9 plus tax and the waiter admitted they get 5 glasses out of every bottle,Heineken as Euros7-50c a glass plus tax. How an hotel can charge such prices in what is after all not the best part of Paris is beyond me and I would tell anyone to look carefully before booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not This Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: Mosinay
Reviews.Content: My nephew and I recently stayed at the Marriott Rive Gauche at the end of a two week trip to Normandy. I want to like the Marriott as a hotel chain because we have reward points with them and we own Marriott time shares. Generally they are reliable and clean, if unexciting accomodations. While still in central Paris, this hotel is on the outskirts of the tourist area but the metro is quite near and it's rather nice to be away from the intensity of the tourists and traffic. We arrived after a train ride from Rouen at 7:00 PM. Our check-in time was 3:00. We were told by the reception that our room was not yet ready. This was, of course, irritating, but the worst was that the front desk clerk was rude and impatient with me and offered me no recourse except entrance to the executive club (bar). This wasn't exactly appropriate for my 15 year old nephew and in fact, children weren't allowed in the club! I guess he could wait in the lobby. We opted instead to have some dinner in the quite good hotel restaurant. Our room was finally ready at 8:30! The room was nice typical Marriott fare and we enjoyed a comfortable stay. However, on the plane home I began to notice that I had what appeared to be large mosquito bites all over my body. I didn't remember getting bitten. When I got home, after some internet research, I realized they were bed bug bites. I have traveled all over the world and stayed in hundreds of hotels, B&Bs, inns, pensions and even a few hostels and have never encountered bed bugs. Given the delay at check-in and the insect infestation, I can hardly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Paris Marriott Rive Gauche”
Reviews.Author: consultantguydfw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for three nights using Marriott Reward points after staying at the Renaissance Le Parc Trocadero. I was able to check in around 1300 but there was a very long line with people checking in and out. As a Marriott Rewards Platinum member, they had a room available for me at this early check in time and had upgraded me to a Champagne Suite on the 16th floor. The check in agent was extremely polite and offered me an invitation to the executive lounge (due to my Marriott status). He also explained that breakfast on Sat and Sun was served in the restaurant instead of the lounge (although there on Sunday, I did not partake of the breakfast in the restaurant on that day). The Platinium arrival gift I selected at check in was brought right up to the room. The suite itself appeared that it may have at one time been two separate rooms. It had two identical bathrooms in the living and bedroom with separate WC rooms next to each. Each room had a closet and flat screen TV. The living room had a nice couch and a desk. The bedroom had a king bed, a chair, and a dressing table. The south-facing view was lovely. The shower temperature fluctuated a bit, but it really was not an issue. Amenities were on par with a full service property. The TV remote from the bed occassionally hit the TV in the other room, but I found that more amusing than annoying (otherwise, I probably would have attempted to turn the TV in the living room towards the other direction to avoid this). The Executive Lounge was nice and large. Breakfast there was popular but well stocked with fruit, cheese, meats, breads, cereals, and most importantly pan o chocolates. Coffee, tea, water, juice, soda, and light snacks were available all day. Wine/beer was available between 1730 and 2130, although I was never there at these times to take advantage of that. Two computers with internet access and printer were available in the lounge, as well as two internet cables with free access if you bring your own laptop. The concierge was very helpful when I asked him which train station to use to get to Epernay. He wasn't sure, but he cheerfully checked for me (Gare d'Lest if you're interested - a very easy half day trip to the Avenue du Champagne). He also showed me the best way to get to the train station by metro without me even having to ask. The hotel is not located in a touristy area, but that's not a bad thing! It's still in a good part of town, with good transportation options. It is located between the Glacerie and the Saint Jacques metro stops on the ligne 6 (Glacerie is probably closer, but take whichever stop you hit first). It is also walkable from Denfert-Rochereau with access to the RER B and the ligne 4. Although a moderate walk (and slightly uphill), I found it convenient to walk to Denfert-Rochereau with my luggage to catch the RER B to Aeroport CDG. The Orly Bus stops right in front of the hotel for convenient access to Orly airport (thougth I think you may have to walk from Denfert-Rochereau if coming FROM Orly). For groceries/beverages, there is a Fran Prix on Boulevard Saint-Jacques on the opposite side of the Saint-Jacques metro stop (on the east bound side of the boulevard). There is also a Monoprix on Avenue Gerneral Leclerc at the wonderful pedestrian shopping street Rue Daguerre near Denfert-Rochereau. For business or pleasure, I would certainly consider staying at this property again. It is a great value, and it is very convenient when working in Montrouge.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Rive Gauche was great”
Reviews.Author: Wendytravelbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week at the Marriott Rive Gauche in Paris, France. We were not sure what to expect since it is a large convention hotel. It turned out to be excellent. It is located in a neighborhood which is quiet and has plenty of shops and restaurants. It is very close to the Metro which meant we could easily go wherever we wanted in Paris. The concierge staff(all of them) were extremely helpful in helping us figure out the best way to get to the various sections of the city. They also directed us to very good local restaurants to which we could walk. The rooms, although small (to be expected in Paris) were very comfortable and had everything we needed. A little fridge which we stocked with fruit and cheese from a local open air market. We did not eat in the hotel but there was a good variety of food options both within the hotel and within walking distance. The bed was very comfortable (one reason why we like Marriotts). I would definitely stay there again should we be back in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: maui2006
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriot after moving from the Hotel Concorde La Fayette (close to Arc de Triomphe) (+) Pleasant staff, was able to check in before noon. The room was a good size, with space for a desk, chair, and king sized bed. Bathroom itself was large, water pressure was great (4th floor).The hotel provided a tea kettle, tea bags, instant coffee, hair dryer, empty fridge. Flat screen tv was great. (-) The decor was dated. Wall paper was peeling, carpet was not the cleanest. The toilet area was tiny like a bathroom stall. Location: Between two metro stations, we walked 5 minutes to the Glaciere stop. 10-15 minute ride to all the sites, even though this was a more central location then the Concorde hotel, we ended up changing/walking between stations a LOT. Overall: I like staying at a clean/larger "american" hotel, and experience the "french" culture outside. We got the hotel through priceline for US$185, which is ok for what we got. I don't think it's worth the rack rate of Euro$400.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Experience”
Reviews.Author: liplord
Reviews.Content: We used Marriot points to stay for two nights and liked it so much we cancelled our reservation in another Marriott and stayed for a third night at a very reasonable price, including breakfast. Everything about this hotel was great and I highly recommend it to anyone visiting Paris. As other reviewers have noted, it is off the "touristy" beat and has great walking areas, is near wonderful Latin Quarter restaurants and is within a short walk of two Metro stops. It is Paris, so why not walk, and it is an easy walk to Notre Dame past the Latin Quarter, Pantheon and Sorbonne. We had a great view from our 15th floor window. It was our 30th anniversary and a bottle of champagne and a chocolate Eiffel Tower appeared in our room. The staff at this hotel should be commended by Marriott. All of them are polite, helpful, good humoured and often interesting people who are willing to talk. The hotel has an excellent business centre with helpful staff. The breakfast express is a good idea although the full breakfast we had on the weekend was no more expensive than the express downstairs. We did have a car and this one of the few hotels in France we visited that has a convenient place to leave the car when you check in. We were instantly met, welcomed, and the car was whisked away. When we checked out, the car appeared almost immediately. Great service. Breakfast is outstanding as others have noted, and there is no reason to eat dinner in the hotel unless you are too tired to go out. The meals are OK but expensive compared with the surrounding neighbourhood. Rue Mouffetard, an old Roman road now filled with interesting shops and markets is a short walk away. Try charming restaurants such as La Cave Bourgogne and the Volcan (among others I'm sure) for excellent food at very reasonable prices. Next time we are in Paris, this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: ReneB
Reviews.Content: Arrrived on Saturday, to wait on line more than a half hour just to check in. No one even acknowledges that there was a line or made an effort to open another line. The room was very small with a view of a roof and a industrial sight. I am a Marriott elite member which made no difference to anyone. There was no mini bar or water avilable to purchase in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: demondmoy
Reviews.Content: Nice beds, nice sized rooms. Top-notch concierge. The hotel is right next to the metro and located in a very "local" area. This means that there are not too many tourists and a visitor can really get a more authentic feel of Paris. The gym is really good, but the restaurant is expensive. Overall, I highly recommend . While not located by an monument, it is just metro rides away.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend Staying @ the Marriott Rive Gauche...”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in September in the Champagne Suite. The room, hotel, and executive lounge were lovely. Since our room was a suite, it was quite spacious with 2 bathrooms, a bedroom and a living room. While the bedroom and living/sitting area are separate, they do not have a door in between these rooms. They put free water and soda beverages in our fridge, and encouraged us to call room service for free replacements as needed. There is also ample coffee and tea supplies with an electric kettle. We had breakfast each day at the executive lounge. They have breads, cereals, meats, cheeses, and juice and coffee. Soft drinks, snacks, and beer are available all day from 6:00 to midnight. They also have weekday appetizers and desserts from 5:30-7:30. They serve wine in addition to hot and cold appetizers. We found it very convenient to stop in each night for a break. The location is not near any major sites, but as other reviewers mention, the metro is 2 blocks away in both directions. The staff at the front desk was wonderful and the staff in the Executive Lounge really goes over the top. I would highly recommend this location and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, Nice staff, Room matched Hotel Website description”
Reviews.Author: welove2travel01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend trip to Paris. It is located aoubt 1-2 blocks (at most) to the Glaciere stop off the metro. This is only two metro stops off the RER B which goes to/from CDG airport. Very handy if you plan to take public transportation and can carry your luggage easily. The young lady at the reception desk was very pleasant, especially considering we were checking in early. We found out that she was originally from Savannah, GA and had been in Paris for a few years. We brought the wrong outlet converter and thankfully they had one that they let us borrow. We did end up asking the Concierge some questions and both times they spoke some English. Our room was on the 10th floor, regular guest room, king size bed. As others have mentioned, the rooms were small compared to US hotel size rooms. But only in that the distance between the foot of the bed and the dresser was about 2 feet. The toilet was in a separate small room and the door opened inward. The shower and sink were in a room right next to it. There was a small closet and little area for coffee making. Underneath the coffee part was an empty fridge. The bed was quite comfortable and there were plenty of pillows. I would like to note that the bathroom did have a hair dryer, small shampoo and conditioner, soap, washcloths and towels. Pretty much the room had the amenities as listed on their website. In the morning, we did take away pastries & orange juice from the Le R 'Yves bar/cafe . It was nice & convenient, but expect to pay top Euro for the items. Overall, if we felt like we found an American like hotel in Paris. This was perfect for us and our needs. If you are looking for an authentic French hotel, this is not the place for you. But, if you are looking for a comfortable place to sleep and some American like qualities, this is a good place to pick.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AAADawg
Reviews.Content: Seven of us stayed at the Marriott Rive Gauche for five nights in early July of 2008 and we were very impressed. The hotel is very conveniently located in a Beautiful area of Paris with Metro stations about two blocks away in either direction from the front door. The neighborhood is fantastic with several small markets within two blocks, again in either direction, and several very nice and affordable (by Paris standards) restaurants, again within 2 blocks. The hotel itself is fantastic and the rooms are wonderful. We booked the hotel on Priceline and bid on the rooms. We got them for less than $140 a night which is CHEAP for Paris, anytime of the year. The only problem we had was the fact that the hotel wanted us to rent a fourth room for an 8 year old child to stay in by himeself??? They would not allow a child to stay in the room with the parents. At first they claimed this was a law in France and that it was a safety rule but then they offered to allow the child in the room for an additional 1200 Euro for the entire stay??? If it was a safety concern I couldn't see how 1200 euro would have fixed it but that was their stand. We simply rented our three rooms and kept the child in our room. The hotel beat themselves out of 300 Euro or so by trying to strong arm us into paying more. We would have gladly paid another 300 euro or so for the child but they were simply trying to rob us at 1200. Other than this the experience was fantastic. One final story about the Hotel. One of our friends left their camcorder in the rooms safe when they checked out and the hotel mailed it to our home in Germany free of charge. I do not believe there are many hotels that would do this anywhere in the world. This leads me to think that there was a simple misunderstanding about the child in the room. If your planning a trip to Paris this hotel is definitely worth looking at.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant staff, ok location”
Reviews.Author: 1sweetcandygirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is average with a number of unpleasant staff members. I stayed at the Paris Renaissance and they where a lot nicer. Both hotels where clean and close enough to the metro. This hotel is closer to the Eiffel Tower and the train that takes you to Versailles.

Reviews.Title: “A very basic four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: flashguru
Reviews.Content: A four star hotel is independently rated by a reviewing body primarily based on facilities. This hotel may tick the boxes, but it is most definetley a very basic four star hotel, for example if you arrive in a car, you have to park on the road out front of the hotel until you can find the bell man to park it for you, hes hard to find. Good luck trying to get a taxi if there aren't any infront of the hotel, again the bellman is nowhere to be seen on atleast three occasions. If you want to eat in the hotel after 11pm you have to call room service and choose from 4 available options, soup, pasta, salad or various desserts, not exactly a very good in-room dining service, during the day the menu isn't much better. When the food arrives day or night, its not so good, especially for the ludicrous prices. If you dont speak french you will have problems if you have questions for the reception, only the concierge can understand English properly and will need to translate. The in-room Guest Services Directory is also out of date and list services that are no longer available, such as the 24 hour coffee shop downstairs, which is no longer 24 hour. On the plus side, the rooms are modern and the beds are really comfortable, If i were you, i would pay a little more for a real four star hotel, i definetley will next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality stay!”
Reviews.Author: concoin
Reviews.Content: In June we stayed two nights in this hotel. We booked it for half price on priceline. Although it is a little outside of Saint-Germain, there is easy access to metro right in front of the hotel. The staff was very helpful, polite & efficient. The rooms where great! very clean & the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Only thing, the shower was pretty unstable, alternating from very hot to very cold. But maybe it was only our room. Over all it was a nice stay. But quite expensive if you don't bid on Priceline......

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good position”
Reviews.Author: travelguru55
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviews, this is a really good hotel. We liked the location as staying in the middle of a city in summer can be claustrophobic. We found the Metro ride Ok and the hotel is very handy for the Eiffel Tower and the Bastille areas. We had a lovely room with a great view. The beds in Marriott hotels are so comfortable and a bonus was tea and coffee making facilities, rare in Europe. Also, there was no mini bar, instead the fridge was empty for your own drinks etc which was very handy. Breakfast was excellent, everything you could want. In all we had a great stay for the very reasonable price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trekkingcat
Reviews.Content: Got to this hotel by way of taxi (about 25 min. ride) from the Eurostar train station. Upon arrival, we were immediately helped with our bags being removed from the taxi and taken inside for us. Check in took a bit of time for some reason, esp. if there are large groups arriving. The Concierge desk does have plenty of help however and language was not a problem as they speak english very well. Saw lots of flight attendants and pilots from various airlines that stay there. We had a two room suite. The room had a nice view of which Sacre-Coeur was off in the distance. The rooms were large and beds and pillows were very comfortable. An executive upgrade got us champagne and access to a private and clean quiet lounge room where they had all sorts of drinks hot and cold, cookies, fruit, snacks, etc. available so it was great to have after getting back from touring all day and also at night before bed. Also, the upgrade got us breakfast in the morning in the restaurant which was a fabulous all you can eat buffet. There was a chef for omelets, eggs, sausage, cold items, hot items, fruits, pastries, everything...and seating in the dining room. Excellent and worth it. We also had dinner in the restaurant that was good but pricey. Rooms were very clean. Problem with a window shade not raising up but they quickly sent someone to fix it. I was disappointed that the dry cleaning/laundry service was not available on Sundays. Two t.v.'s thankfully had access to english channels and CNN. Two room suite had only one shower/bath but other room had its own sink/toilet. Countertops were granite and modern. Shampoo/cond./tissue/bath gel/ soap included. Towels were large and clean. Very nice beds, room, bath, table with chairs, credenzas, t.v.'s, safe, lots of drawer space and closets. We had an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A GREAT STAY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gnorman003
Reviews.Content: My wife, and 3 year old spent 4 nights at this hotel and found it to be a charming. The service was 4 star, the rooms 4 star and the beds....ooooooh the beds were 5 star. I'm a SPG member and I love their "heavenly beds", this was on par with those beds. It should be noted that I did stay in an executive room on the 17th floor and not a standard room. the hotel is right off the green line which you will be able to get to any major attraction in five min. Make sure you get the breakfast and Conseeaires suite in your package, as both were absolutely GREAT. I got my stay for 141euro via hoteltravel.com, which seem to be cheaper than hotes.com or priceline. The hotel has two great casual eatery outside which have good food for a reasonable price. I read alot of good and some bad reviews about this hotel. Please take it from me, as I travel for a living, you will not be disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “All-around good hotel, for business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: pamarx200
Reviews.Content: Stayed here four nights for business at EUR 199 per night. Considering that some three star hotels were selling at this price during the busy summer, the Marriott was a great deal. Rooms are spacious and well furnished, with ample aromatherapy amenities, iron, high quality water boiler, and everything else one would expect from a hotel of this standard. The nicest touch was an EMPTY refridgerator for guests to put their own things in. Internet was expensive at 20 Eur a day, but this seems to be standard in better hotels in Europe. The gym is not particularly spacious but has all the necessary equipment, including at least 6 or 7 treadmills, about 12 weight machines, bikes, and elipticals. Only complaint was that the duvet was way too thick for the summer, meaning that one had to turn the air condition to a temperature that was uncomfortable unless one was under the covers. Hotel was convenient for the left bank sites, since it was on the 6 line which goes to all major places, including trocadero and the arc de triomphe on the right bank. Great views of the city from the upper floors. From a room on the 15th floor, one can see clear across the city to the sacre coeur in Montmartre. Overall, an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “A good spot but expensive Internet!!”
Reviews.Author: outandabout68
Reviews.Content: We pricelined this hotel and got it for the price of a 2 star place closer in. It was very comfortable and the staff friendly. There's a great Greek place around the corner that is cheap. My only complaint is that they charge 20 Euros/day for Internet which is truly highway robbery.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel w/ Nearby Metro Stops”
Reviews.Author: I_Love_NY09
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week-long trip to Paris and stayed at the Marriott Rive Gauche. It was a clean hotel with nicely appointed rooms. The service was great throughout the hotel and we found the front desk and concierge to be most friendly and helpful. Luckily our hotel membership status gave us access to the Executive Lounge, which turned into a great place to start and end our busy days. We found it quite easy to get everywhere thanks to several metro stops within walking distance from the hotel. We felt very safe coming and going, even late at night. However, it would have been nice to be within walking distance of some of the great neighborhoods such as the Marais. We did not dine in the hotel's restaurant, but did order room service and found the food to be very fresh and well prepared. This was a very nice place to stay for our first trip to Paris. I would return here, but also would jump at the chance to stay somewhere a little closer to the Seine.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Olos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Rive Gauche during Easter. We have been to Paris sometimes before and have learned to be a bit sceptic when it comes to choosing a hotel. As mentioned in other reviews this hotel is not situated in the city centre but it’s very close to the Metro. Paris is a widespread city so one has to have transport to get around anyway. Check in was most courteous and English was fluently spoken, which still can be a problem in France. All my request was duly noted and prepared (smoking room, two duvets, extra feather pillows) I find this most impressive, most often this demands numerous telephones to different departments of the hotel even when requested well in advance. The price we paid for our junior suite, which actually is two rooms put together without a door between, was quite reasonable compared to hotel closer to the city centre. Between us we had to bathrooms and two toilettes there was placed in separate rooms (you’ll find this in most French hotels). King size bed in one room, sofa, two chairs, table and writing desk was placed in the other room. Lounge access was included in the rate where breakfast was served. Free use of internet in room was also included. The lounge was closed for breakfast some of the holidays so we also had breakfast in the restaurant. Rooms were large very well kept and clean. The windows could however have done with some cleaning (they could not be opened). Nice view from the rooms, some noise but defiantly bearable. The air-condition function well in both rooms. Bathroom amenities was ample, water pressure was good and never any problems with hot water. All together this is an excellent choice for a stay in Paris. Metro is cheap (by a “carnet”) and very easy to get around Paris with. Living in the centre of Paris means that you are close to one attraction but far away from others i.e. you’ll have to travel anyway. Restaurants of all kinds are located just outside the hotel door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Janewb57
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Rive Gauche on a Priceline bid of $115 for 7 nights in May 2008. The Hotel is located in the Montparnasse district, but just outside of St. Germain de Pres. The Hotel is just 2 blocks from the Metro (Glaciere) station. This is on Line 6 which is a direct route to the Eiffel Tower. Just up the street is the Denfert-Rochereau train station (RER). This is Line B which goes directly to the Luxembourg stop if you want to go to the 6th arr. It also goes to CDG airport. You will see a lot of people coming down the street with their suitcases. Upon arrival at about 3:00, I provided my Marriott rewards number and asked for a room on an upper floor. I was told I could have one of those rooms, but not until 4:30. I decided I would wait and stored my luggage. I also upgraded to the Executive Level, allowing access to the Executive Lounge. This was 50 euros per day per room. This includes: breakfast (pastry, rolls, fresh fruit, fresh juice, cereal, excellent European yogurt, coffee, tea, soda, meat, cheeses), snacks and non-alcohol drinks all day; cocktail hour from 5:30-7:30, dessert buffet from 7:30-9:30. On Sat. and Sun. breakfast is served in the restaurant, not the Executive Lounge. On those days, it was a complete buffet with hot and cold dishes. The cocktail hour is on Sun – Thurs. This included wine and beer and a hot and cold appetizer buffet. I considered it ‘dinner’ on more than one night. The upgrade also included cable internet access, normally about 20 euros per day. While the upgrade sounds like a lot of money, given the savings on the Priceline bid, it is still less than 50% of the normal rate. It should also be noted that if there are two people in the room, you automatically break even due to the price of breakfast at the restaurant which is about 22 euros. The room was very nice. It had a king size bed with very soft and substantial bedding. There was also a down puffy pad on the mattress. My only complaint is that the mattress was too soft and was not comfortable. The TV had several channels in English, however it was all news most of the time. I was able to see some other shows over the weekend such as Jay Leno. The temperature control in the room worked excellent and the air was nice and cool if desired. There was a small refrigerator that the hotel leaves empty for guest use. The closet had plenty of hangers and the dresser lots of drawer space for clothes. There was a desk with a comfortable chair and good lighting. The hotel staff was very helpful and they all spoke English. The concierge provided a lot of helpful information about transportation and how to get places. I never had to wait more than a minute or two for help. The lobby was always busy, but I never had to wait more than a minute or two for help at the reception desk or the bellhop. I had dinner in the hotel restaurant one night. The price for the dinner which included a starter, main course and 2 glasses of wine was about $50. It was delicious and also came with a small baquette and lots of butter. The staff in the Executive Lounge was also very friendly and helpful. The food for breakfast was always delicious and very fresh. The cocktail time included hot appetizers, like shrimp and chicken. It also included platters of little sandwiches, veggies and dip, a couple of salad/slaws. Also, olives and little peppers stuffed with great French cheese. The staff that worked in the room came around and filled your glasses with red or white wine which was delicious. The hotel lobby was very attractive and bright. The hotel is located in a somewhat residential area, but it was nice to get out of the bustling city at the end of the day. There are a couple of restaurants within walking distance, as well as a bank with an ATM.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel; especially for American travelers”
Reviews.Author: Justtravels988
Reviews.Content: I recently visited The Marriott Rive-Gauche with my parents and extended family for our first visit to Paris. We had three rooms (2 kings, 1 twin-bedded for 6 guests: 2 couples, my sister and me). The hotel is not in walking distance of attractions but is just off the subway which frequently has trains and is overly convenient for travel (10 minute ride to any major attraction). The hotel just completed a major renovation and is very accessible, stylish, and comfortably American (which can be refreshing on one's first trip to Paris with a family). The guest rooms are very comfortable, clean and modern. The hotel restaurant is fantastic and the breakfast buffet is even better! Do book a room including breakfast buffet you will not be disappointed (omelets, fruit buffet, hot buffet, yogurts, granola, coffees, juices...all included and wonderful!) This was perfect for our traveling family. The hotel is just what you would expect from Marriott: Comfortable, affordable, pleasant, and courteous. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great bed, good hotel, close to th metro”
Reviews.Author: nuheart
Reviews.Content: Stayed again at The Marriott Rive gauche (stayed there in November 07 too, and really got to like this hotel. We were there for 3 nights and enjoyed the comfortable rooms and wonderful beds. Got a spectacular rate (for Paris) with priceline and I highly recommend you use them. (refrig in room and ice down the hall-- yea! Eat at the corner cafe down the street instead of at the hotel. It has a nice selection and good food and friendly service. (hotel prices are outlandish for food) easy to jump on the metro to take you anywhere in the city. about 50 euro's to the airport (CDG)_ from the marriott. Friendly service for the city of lights. Great stay all in all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms great people”
Reviews.Author: nonstoptraveler41
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here and even though it is a little out of the way the people are great and the metro is only a block away. The restaraunt is very good and the service was great. Nice area to walk around and the Gare du Midi is close.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: DutchyCan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not completely downtown Paris, but when in Paris you will for sure need the metro... well, this hotel is very close to a metro station and you're still in Paris... As we frequent Marriott hotels, I can say this is one of the better ones we visited. Not so much the service (hey, you're in France, people tend to look more pissed off then they might actually feel) as more the hotel. I read people find it not too charming, I rather stay in a Marriott with their level of quality, then in some small overpriced filthy French hotel (which we did on the way to Paris). We got a good deal over the internet. We liked the soft bed and the working airco (which a lot of French hotels promote, but then it doesn't work too well). We loved the breakfast: the pancakes with Nutella was a hit at our table. This is a good quality hotel, breakfast is nice and the room is convenient. And a big plus: close to the metro. I would come again!

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in better”
Reviews.Author: thornka
Reviews.Content: This was my last stop of a trip around France, and I just needed a hotel to stay in for the night before my flight back home. Very nice and clean, but I was underwhelmed with most everything else. Upon check-in, two big tour groups (all Americans) were checking out, so I had to wait for my room to become available. They offered to hold my luggage, but I had to wait at least 45 minutes at the bell desk for help. I was finally told to go to the room behind the front desk and do it myself since he was busy. Room was clean and bed was comfortable. There is no shower curtain or door; just a small partition near the faucet intended to block the water. However, my bathroom was soaked after my shower. Had to call for more towels, which never came, so I had to call several times. Although I've stayed at many Marriotts in the U.S. it seemed to me like this one was ill-equipped to handle large tour groups and others simultaneously. The area is away from the touristy parts of Paris, which can be good and bad. I'd pass.

Reviews.Title: “no complaints here”
Reviews.Author: hannymom
Reviews.Content: my daughter and i stayed here the first week of april. the hotel was clean, the staff was friendly, and benoit our concierge was the best. every day he mapped out our metro line for us. yes, we did have to take the metro everywhere but we didn't mind that at all. we always felt safe walking from the station, even on the nights that we returned very late..........just one thing, don't get the pizza in a box room service, it was awful.

Reviews.Title: “nothing but great”
Reviews.Author: kakowNy
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Paris few days ago. This is my third trip to France and my previous experience with Parisan hotel has been disappointing except for Intercontinental. With the good reviews on this site, my wife decided to take a chance. And it turned out great. The location is in the 14th district, which is a bit away from tourist attractions. But as stated by others, with 2 metro and 1 train stop near by, getting around is not an issue. All the staff were excellent, especially the ones at the executive lounge. Very courteous and polite. They do have security people around the clock at the front door. Maybe it's not the greatest of neighborhood, but my wife and I felt perfectly ok coming back at 11pm. The room is excellent by Paris standard. Good size with comfy bed. The room is very clean and bathroom is also in good condition. There are several Velib station nearby the hotel. For those who do not know, Velib is a bicycle sharing system developed by the city. You can get a bike rental for free for the first 30 mins and 1 euro per hour after that. Rental process is easily done at the bike station. If you are interested, make sure to bring a few credit card with you. We had problem with Visa and Mastercard, but finally Amex worked. Riding around Paris is a blast. The bike is actually pretty well made with 3 gears and easily manuverable. Just be careful of the cars...

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful girls getaway!”
Reviews.Author: mrselj06
Reviews.Content: My friends and I visited Paris the week of April 16th. We stayed at the Marriott Rive Gauche in Saint Germain de Pres and had a wonderful time. The hotel was very clean with great food, drinks and excellent customer service. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We saw all of the major attractions and maneuvered the Metro very easily. I highly recommend this over taking a cab. If you want a nice area to shop and dine try Marais. There are some great French boutiques as well as some American staples. Also be sure to visit Sacre Coeur. Simply Beautiful! Quite an adventure for a girls getaway or a romantic excursion!

Reviews.Title: “It was fine.”
Reviews.Author: PackRat08
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there twice in April. It's o.k....trendy, good food. The hotel rooms are good, ask for a view of Paris and a higher floor to appreciate the view. Breakfast is served in the morning on the first floor and is quite expensive but good. The rooms are a little bit less than a standard room in the states, Canada or anywhere else for that matter. Meaning that there's twin beds instead of double/queen beds like normal Marriott's. Overall the check in process is quick and efficient, the service is good. Close to the Metro line (make sure you don't put your ticket in your purse if you have a magnet of any kind on your purse and ask for a metro map at the desk) in the hotel be sure to get a map from the concierge. Internet access is available for a fee, taxi's are ample.

Reviews.Title: “A little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: pengysan
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, a little out of the way - not in the city center by any means. However, it was clean and public transportation made it accessible. Rooms were typical for a metropolitan city, a little small but overall comfortable and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Marriott Rive Gauche Hotel in 14e”
Reviews.Author: lithlith
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights, April 5-8, 2008 using Marriott reward points. We took the RER train/subway from the airport to Glacier (the nearest subway/metro stop to the hotel). The subway/metro stop is only 2 blocks from the hotel, so it was an easy walk. We arrived around 1pm and our room was not ready yet - check in is at 3pm. The hotel stored our bags so we could go see the city. The subway/metro ride to the Louvre stop was about 25 minutes including one transfer. Our hotel room was clean and nice - a typical Marriott hotel room - like what is in the US. We also had access to the conciergerie/executive lounge, where they have beverages (pepsi products, juices, and beer) and light snacks (cookies and chips) available all of the time. There is also an appetizers, desserts and wine available Sun-Thur evenings and breakfast Mon-Fri mornings. I thought that the breakfast selection was weak compared to other places, there was toast, fruit, croissants, cold cuts and cheese. We were given a coupon to eat breakfast Sunday morning in the restaurant, where there was a fabulous breakfast buffet with everything you could possibly want. I wouldn't pay the 27 Euro for it, but it was great for free! There is no pool, but a small fitness center overlooking the street. The elevators are fast and use key cards to access to your floor. It was a nice hotel to stay in for free with points or for business travelers, but for anyone who wants to get right out and sight see, I would recommend staying at a Marriott more centrally located without the long subway ride.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: johnnycee
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed here during the first week in april as part of a state bar association trip; this hotel appears to cater to the college alumni and professional association travel group crowd, as well as to tourists and many business people and is also used by several airlines as a sleep-over point. location is great, shady street, within a few steps or blocks of many fine cafes, bistros and brasseries. metro stop -- glaciere -- is a half a block away and all cab drivers know where the hotel is. about a 16-17 euro metro ride to degaulle airport and mostly a ten to 12 euro cab ride to restaurants or the heart of the city. our initial twin-bed room faced the back and looked out on roofs and air conditioners; we requested a different room and were cheerfully given an upgrade to a room with a king-sized bed on the street, higher up, with views of the arc de triomphe, notre dame, les invalides, sacre coeur and pantheon (the tour montparnasse, a few blocks away, blocked view of eiffel tower). the staff was young and very courteous and helpful and spoke english and tolerated our fractured french. concierge got us reservations at a popular brasserie for dinner and also a doctor who came to the room when my wife became ill. there is a pharmacy a block away, as well as a book store with english newspapers and a grocery store. room was clean and bed was best and most comfortable hotel bed we have ever slept in; room service attended to details and responded to requests for extras. hair dryers, high quality soap and shampoo, refrigerator, safe, lots of storage space and an HDTV that got all channels in all main languages. did not eat at R'yves, the hotel restaurant, but it appeared nice; ultramodern and hip; there is also a coffee shop and a 24 hour express food store. we ate breakfast in a dining room for travel groups -- excellent quality and choice of food -- bacon or ham and eggs, croissants and petit pains, great coffee, and opened early -- 6:30 am. we would definitely stay in this hotel again if or when we return to paris. even on our own, the price would be worth it for the location, and all of the above factors recommend it. others in our tour group and to whom we spoke echoed our own observations -- especially about the comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: scottishlad
Reviews.Content: If you have the opportunity to book this hotel through Priceline, do so. I'd much rather be in Marais, but this hotel fronts a subway line and it is a quick twenty minutes to the more bustling parts of Paris. And if you're smart in your bidding, you'll stay for about 1/3rd or 1/2 of what you would pay elsewhere. Rooms are fine. Bed is comfortable, flat screen has about five channels in english, and hvac works well. Only irritant is the toliet which is in a small--very small--room.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dallasworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous experience! From the moment we arrived at the hotel, it was a luxurious experience and it matched our expectations of a four star hotel as we booked it from Priceline. The doorman assisted us with our luggage into the hotel, the reception desk was very friendly and helpful, and the bell hop brought our luggage to our room. The concierge was wonderful in helping us with our hundreds of questions and secured tickets for us to various locations. It is a nice location-near two metro stops. Several shops, cafes, and restaurants are within walking distance as well. It is a bit of a distance from the city where all the tourist attractions are located~but with the metro, everything is only a short distance away. If you are looking for a fabulous deal and a lot of luxury~go with this hotel. It isn't in the middle of tourist spots, but that is part of the beauty of this place!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Tjeep
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Rive Gauche does not have the most central location and lacks the charm of many Parisian boutique hotels. What it does have is effortless comfort and every service you could imagine for a business or combination business/pleasure trip to Paris. I stayed in their Executive rooms with access to their Executive lounge, which I booked at an internet discount rate. The room was huge by Parisian standards, with a California king size bed, and desk with internet access. The bathroom had a vey large bath and sink area with a separate toilet cubicle. The Executive Lounge has free internet and space for quick business confabs, and is always open for snacks and meals. It is a great amenity to have available for when you have missed a meal or just need a quick coffee on your way out the door. The gym was especially well equipped for a hotel, as good as most stand alone gyms in terms of the range of equpment offered. There is a beauty shop and gift store, although I didn't try those. In short, everything is well designed for comfort and service. It is not impossible to walk to the central tourist areas, but it takes 30-40 minutes. However, a metro stop is close by and you can be at the Champs Elysses in 10 minutes by metro. The hotel has recently had an entire makeover, so everything is new with a retro 1970's design feel. The staff was young, friendly, and helpful, particularly the concierage who booked a table at a popular restaurant at the last minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: Tawnia
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in Paris. New and spotless rooms with comfortable beds! This hotel is 2 minutes from 2 metro stops. Not much french ambiance here, but see Paris all day and sleep well at the Mariott! Excellent for business travelers or seasoned travelers who demand business amenities. I could find no faults at this hotel and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: PTD
Reviews.Content: Good location and rooms were adequate. Good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay given the price we paid for”
Reviews.Author: muffine
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through priceline and got a great price. When we travel we always prefer modern hotel and this hotel did not disappoint us. The staff was helpful and friendly. The room was clean and modern, but on the smaller side. The location was definitely not as central as one might hope, but we took the bus into the tourist attraction everyday and found no problem. The bus ride to Notre Dame typically takes about 20 mins. I will not hesitate to recommend this place to anyone under a budget who wants comfortable lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Commercial”
Reviews.Author: worldly_me
Reviews.Content: Won the hotel room from a bid on Priceline - unfortunately, there were no cancellations allowed. If you want to feel like you are in the US while in Paris, then this may be the hotel for you. If you are like me and want a hotel with local character and charm, then look elsewhere. The location is in the middle of nowhere, although it is situated between 2 metro stops (but which hotel isn't?) It is in a very residential strip and not a nice one. My advice is to be careful on Priceline when including 'Montparnasse' as a boundary - bid less than $100 b/c I won at $120, which I later discovered was too much.

Reviews.Title: “Marriot US vs France”
Reviews.Author: dlallen
Reviews.Content: While traveling out of the country with my wife, we were scared of what we might encounter when it came to accommodations. We chose to stay with something familiar, so the Marriott and its American standards we are used to was our choice. We were very happy with this decision after we arrived and even upon checking out. We just got back home yesterday 2/21/2008 and want to return soon. The hotel was home, in a foreign country. The rooms are not as sprawling in size as we Americans are accustomed to in the US Marriott’s, but very comfortable. Pay close attention to this when booking in Paris, you might get stuck in a closet sized room in some hotels. We were even accommodated with a king size bed which is not normal in most hotels there. Usually get 2 doubles or 2 singles from the research I made before booking. Not very romantic or at least comfortable I thought in "the city of love". The food in the hotel restaurant was awesome. I recommend it highly. Loved it so much we ate supper there the first 2 nights! About supper, most eating establishments do not serve/open for supper until 7:00 to 7:30.
